review_text: I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.

These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.

I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!
I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.

We have been buying crocs for a long time and this time we received crocs that were marked the right size .... but one was significantly smaller and more narrow than the other. This was something we only realized after leaving on vacation. Our 12 year old constantly complained that the one was too small and the other was too large. He had to wear them until we could find a store to buy him flip flops and so we couldn't return them by the time we got back as they had been worn. Not sure what happened here but I have them and they are definitely two different sizes...
literally best purchase of my life. Everything went well was packaged very nicely. They looked great with my prom dress. I couldn't have asked for anything else

I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.

What happened to the Crocs? I bought these as a relief to my feet after a day of hiking and camping.The sizing has changed considerably. The strap is 1 inch shorter than the actual shoe pushing and cramming your feet to the front of the shoe. Why Crocs, why was this design approved?  I bought two pairs, one for me, and one for my husband. The inside tread on my husband's pair was smooth and soft. The inside tread in mine were lifted and sharp like tiny needles. I could barely walk in them after a day's hike. These are the most uncomfortable pair of Crocs I have ever worn. I am very disappointed in the poor design and uncomfortable quality.

I ordered 2 pairs of these crocs classics, cerulean and pepper. Pepper is a true red (I was worried it might look pink) and the cerulean is very blue, not purple at all. I usually wear men's size 8.5 shoes and an m8/w10 fit when tried on in a store. However I read lots of reviews that said the sizes were very inconsistent. I need these soon so don't have time to mess with exchanges so I ordered m8/w10 and m9/w11. They were exactly the same size. Width, length, everything was the same, it was weird. I think they fit more like a m9/w11 but that's fine. I wanted/expected these to be pretty loose like my old ones from over a decade ago. These are pretty comfy like I remember and hopefully they last like my old ones did. I didn't find them shiny, uncomfortably small/narrow or the nubs inside to be too painful, which were all common complaints. Overall I say try them on in store first especially if you're in between sizes. I have high hopes for these. (These are the made in mexico ones by the way)
Awesome as long as you order a full size up and allow for a short break-in period. Lightweight, waterproof, comfortable & come in a zillion fun & crazy colors! What’s not to love.
I would never recommend the now-a-day Crocs clogs to anyone

I have worn Crocs for years, but the well-made ones that came from the USA (Colorado) many years ago.  These made in China ones are a harder plastic and extremely wide so that my feet slip around in them or the shoes fall off.  They also aren't anywhere near as comfortable due to the harder plastic, even if they did fit properly.  I have already started the return process, very disappointed since after many years, my American made ones are finally starting to wear out and need replacing

I was hoping these would fit like the Classic Clog Crocs I already have but, they still feel too small.  It's the third pair I've ordered lately and can't seem to find the fit I was hoping for.  Ended up donating these and the others to Value Village since I had worn them a couple of times.  None of them seemed as roomy as the ones I have almost worn out.  I love Crocs but am frustrated trying to find the right fit!
I remember thinking "it's just another stupid trend thing, and they look ridiculous"...

These guys are amazing.  For years, I avoided them despite of the hype some time ago.  The funny thing is that I was always looking for a shoe that can work as a slipper because that would be so practical for traveling.

Because of wide feet, I've been afraid of ordering these popular shoes.  Over the years I've had to return or give away shoes I carefully chose, cos only the front of my feet are wide (like a duck). Have to have some sort of strap, or tie on.  My siblings would urge me to try them, so I took the plunge. The 1st pair had to be returned because of a simply mistake at the factory; the wrong size was put in the box.  The replacement arrived yesterday, and I could turn cartwheels, if I could. So comfortable, roomy, and no breaking in period. With regular leather shoes, the little toe on my right foot is still squeezed; with the Crocs, no problem!  And it keeps my feet cool! These are officially my fav shoes. Plan to buy more in diff colors.

Never thought I'd buy a pair of crocs. I've been making fun of them for the past decade but when we moved into a new place with hard floors, I needed something to wear around the house. I stand/walk a lot at work and wanted something that was very comfortable.

Where have these been all my life?  I first discovered a cheap copy of these at Walmart, and I loved how they fit and how easily they slip on and off.  So I was pleased to find the original brand here on Amazon.  I live in the desert, and our home is kept on the warm side too, so I definitely need models (like this classic model) with the holes in the side and top - the one thing I didn't like about my cheap knock-offs is they didn't have those holes, and my feet (with or without socks) were uncomfortably hot and clammy inside the house.  Another good feature is being able to toss the shoes into a bucket of soapy water to clean them after slogging in the mud outside.

These are a cheap Crocs.  They have no arch support like the better Crocs do, the rubber is hard and not flexible and soft like other Crocs.  And they are much too large for a womens B width foot.  In fact, these Crocs actually hurt my feet and legs when I wore them out.  I will never wear these Crocs again.  In fact, I am taking them to Goodwill today and I just got them!

I never thought I would be writing a negative review for Crocs, as they have been my default footwear for many years. I have easily owned 6 pairs over the last 10 years, and I love them for many reasons......until this last pair. Actually I purchased 2 pairs, one black and one blue, as it never hurts to have another color for special occasions (although in this case, it does hurt). After wearing this most recent pair for 10 minutes, I realized my feet were feeling uncomfortable. Thinking a little break-in time might be needed (though that has never been the case before) I continued to wear them but after several hours I had to admit that my feet really did hurt. Upon further examination, I realized that these Crocs were about 1/2" shorter than my old pair. I also noticed that the nubs on the inner sole that are molded into the Crocs were quite a bit sharper than I ever remembered from my older pairs. The appearance is identical with my older pair with the 2 exceptions mentioned above. Now, after repeatedly trying to wear them as my daily driver, I keep looking forward to taking them off after only a couple of hours. Perhaps they were molded from a different material that shrank, or that the forms for the molding process are smaller. Either way, I now have 2 pairs of Crocs that I don't want to wear. I wear size 12. Always have. Do I now have to move to a 13 (no half sizes) and risk them being too big? What I do know is that I am unhappy with my recent purchase.

This Crocs Men & Women's Classic Clog I received yesterday is the exact same as I have bought since they first came out. This one is NOT the same! Even the add/pic on here says they are made in Mexico. (My first clog was made in Boulder, the rest in Mexico.) The one I just ordered shows made in Vietnam. I noticed a diff as soon as I put it on. Much more of a hard plastic feel and a slightly smaller fit. I'm keeping them because it's to much trouble for me to return. I hope they wear ok. Time will tell. But this is FALSE advertising! I am starting to question Amazon's selling practices lately. But straight from Crocs website! It's worth the extra money to get the real thing.

Rare to find this brand at the Amazon price I paid - wanted a clog with heel strap so I could safely drive back & forth to the local aquatic center.  I wasn't excited about the glossy black appearance, but since I only wear them to drive from my garage to the pool, walk about 200 feet across hot concrete, stick them in a locker while I swim, then reverse the process to go home, I can overlook my own fashion faux pas.  The heel strap keeps them properly positioned on my feet while driving, and the drain holes in the toes make them great for poolside.  I have falling arches & these make the walk from car to poolside & back so much less painful than foam flip-flops - and as stated before, I feel confident driving my car (automatic transmission) whereas with flip-flops, I'd change in & out of socks & shoes, while my kids wait for me to get the car started & the A/C going.  If these last half as long as my old Crocs Mammoth clogs (10+ years so far & still have a little bit of tread on the soles), then these are the best deal in footwear for my Fashion Tone-Deaf Curmudgeon Community.  (Life Member since 2013.)

I know, I know... they are the "Given up on life" shoe.  They are ugly as sin.  I know this.  But I also know that when I am in hour 16 of standing for the work I do, they are a lifesaver and I'm not thinking about my feet hurting.  I'm thinking about how much I doubt my career choice at that moment, but my feet are fine.  I'm thinking about crying as the sun is coming up and I still have another two or three hours to go, but my feet are good to go. And when I finally crawl into bed, every part of me is calling me names, but my feet are still my friend.

This was my second attempt at getting a new pair of Crocs that fit. My shoe size is W6.5 so I bought the size W6 Crocs. When they arrived and I tried them on, they were too small. My toes were scrunched together and walking just a few steps was not comfortable at all. I returned them and ordered the next size up (W7), but they were still too small. I compared them next to the pair I currently have (size W6-7/S/M4-5, bought from a shop in Mexico) and you can immediately see the size difference (see attached photo). Haven't decided yet whether to go up the next 2 sizes or just go up 1 size at a time. I am able to return them for a full refund, so that's good. But seeing how much smaller they are, I might jump up to size 9 even though my shoe size has never been that big. If those fit me well, then I will change my rating to 5 stars, as I love my Crocs and wanted to replace them with ones I could wear outside (wore a hole through them that they are now inside shoes/slippers).
My husband has Plantar fasciitis (as I also have) and he has tried different inserts, balls to rub his feet on, exercises, etc.
So my dad had a pair of these years ago and I found myself putting these on for household tasks whenever I went over to his house.
It took me a little while to figure this out:

I've had a pair of Croc knockoffs for at least a decade, and I'd worn them almost completely out. I wore them as slippers around the house, but they occasionally also became gardening clogs, shower shoes, etc. I got a pair of real Crocs to replace them, and the Crocs are definitely an improvement over the knockoffs.
You will not regret buying these!

Crocs has apparently decided to save money on materials by shrinking the shoes. These are a full 1/2 inch shorter and 3/8 inch narrower than the same size ones they were intended to replace. I have returned them. I'm hesitant to order a larger size as they are also narrower, so I guess after 15 years of wearing them, I will have to find another shoe.
I bought these to replace an earlier pair which were just great, and which I wore for two years.  These were the exact same size and style as before (different colour only).
Classicly ugly, weird looking clown shoes that everyone - including me - loves to make fun of.  And yet, within five minutes of getting home for the night, I'm wearing these.

I never have liked the looks of these butt ugly things but my podiatrist told me to get a pair because of a foot problem.  They do offer great support and curiousness for my poor broken foot.  I find that when I walk my heel tends to extend over the inner sides and wants to roll in.  This is because I have such a high instep that my foot does not go all the way in.  I have about an inch of room in front of my big toe and my heel actually sticks out the back a little.  Perhaps I should have gone with a larger size?  The construction of these shoes is great and they are comfortable.  I expect that I will continue to wear these around the house once my foot has healed because of the support they offer.  I like them as slippers but not for walking any distance.

I have two sets of Crocs I've been wearing for 10 years or so. I love them and they're all I wear, all year around. I've been needing a couple of more pairs to match outfits I have, so I ordered two pair (black and brown) last week. They're too small. They're the same size as the other two sets I have, but they're too small. I wear 8 wide, and the size 8 in the past has been perfect. Not this time. I can't return them because I wore them, so I'm hoping they give some over time. If I were to purchase them again, I'd get a size larger.

For someone who has loved wearing the original crocs, these are not anywhere near the same.  They are almost an inch shorter than my others of the same size.  They are also narrower.  Worse, they are not as soft and cushie like walking on marshmallows the way the originals are.  Also, the finish is a cheap looking shiny texture rather than the mat finish they used to be.  I tried to wear them but can only stand them for an hour or two.  Thus, couldn't return them, but sure won't buy them again.

My chiropractor recommended wearing crocs since I started having plantar fasciitis problems. I usually wear woman's size 8 shoes, and got these in size 8. They seem a little big but it's actually more comfortable to wear that way, so I think these fit me perfectly. I like to life up the back holder part and wear them around like sandals. It's also nice when it's cold cause I can just slip them on with my socks on. As for dealing with my plantar fasciitis, it ended up working for me! I wore these every day, and at first I didn't notice that much of a difference and my feet ached in the morning for a while too, but around a year into wearing these, I have completely recovered from plantar fasciitis!! It's like I never even had plantar fasciitis before! I think it took a while for my feet to heal since it's something we use every day. Now I am able to wear normal flat sandals too and my feet are fine in the mornings. I still wear crocs and their brand sandals for my main footwear though, cause I think it helps to prevent plantar fasciitis from happening.

The product I received was not Crocs! I got some knock off brand called "Satihu"  They looked just like Crocs and I didn't notice right away, but I started getting tendonitis pain in my left foot.  This is a recurring problem that is usually improved by wearing Crocs.  I took a closer look at the shoes and was shocked to see that they aren't real.  I went back and checked by order to make sure that the mistake wasn't mine, but the order clearly states that I purchased Crocs.
I try these because I needed  garden shoes and since the black in my size was on sale I wanted to try for myself if they are really all that different of the cheaper copies.

Crocs are crocs, right? I finally, after years, sprung for a pair of classic crocs. I am spending time on the farm, and these are great for gardening, checking on the horses & chickens etc. so easy to clean. And in this incessant rain (thanks Harvey) I need a waterproof shoe. Size wise.... I wish  they had half sizes. I wear 8.5, but ordered 8 as suggested. Maybe I have weird toes (I admit to have broken 2). Although the toe box is roomy, my 4th and 5th toes feel uncomfortably squished. I hope that, with time, the Crocs will mold to my feet. A size up is not an option, they would be floating on me. In short: I love the color (pepper, not too red but defnitely cheery!) and the functionality.

This is my first pair of crocs; never had the desire to own any. But now, can't imagine being without them! I needed something easy to slip into and take off when I'm down at the horse barn, feeding and cleaning corrals. Also nice that they are waterproof, unlike my old leather clogs. Excellent price, too . At first, I thought they were going to be floppy on my feet; I did purchase the size I usually wear. I wear socks with the crocs, sometimes two pair in the cooler months. They still fit just fine. I have narrow to medium width feet, wear a size 10. I like the orange because they're easy to spot wherever I've left them. Easy to clean off the dirt, either brush off or hose off; I understand they can be thrown in the washer, too. And, best of all, these crocs are as comfortable as my slippers I wear around the house. Sometimes, I forget I wore my crocs in the house, noticing sometimes hours later! Love them! And convinced my husband to order some, too! He loves his, too!

I needed some slip-on shoes to wear while working in my garage (woodworking).  I don’t have a lot of shoes because I have long, wide feet and I have trouble finding ones with a comfortable fit. I had been wearing my work tennis in the garage, but then while I was at my job I would look down and notice sawdust under the laces lol. So, I ordered these and they are really perfect:

My husband and I love crocs and have used them for years. I had terrible pain in the heel of my foot and crocs has completely cured it. Fit true to size in my experience. Colors pictured are navy, pepper, neon magenta, camo, purple, khaki

They arrived today and because I wear a 9.5, I ordered a half-size down but with the strap around the back of my foot, my toes are hitting up against the front too much. I'm a bit bummed as I ordered exactly as this site and the Cros.com site said to do with half-sizes....order down!  BUT I have to say that going to a 10 would be ridiculous as I only need about 1/2 size more & I don't want to fall out of them = tripping potential. Now what? Do they stretch out a bit. I hope so as I ordered a white pair in 9 from Crocs.com too as I was so sure after trying on my friend's size 8's. We both agreed to order one size up for me. I can wear them, and will but my idea to order a bunch more in different colors went out the window...

I was so excited to get the cyan blue crocs on super sale. These are the comfiest shoes ever. The dots on the soles massage your feet, they provide great arch support, they’re such a cute color, and it’s finally long enough past the initial croc trend that they’re ironically stylish again. 10/10 recommend for beach days, days at the pool, rainy days, regular days, lazy days, winter days with socks, or whatever else to want to wear them with. They definitely run large, so try on a friend’s or try them on in the store first if possible. But snag yourself a pair, you won’t regret it!
Pros:

With a very wide foot, you have extremely limited choices if you're in the market for a SHOE.  Normally I wear sandals (Olukai or Birkenstock) which are traditionally wider and do not squeeze the width of my foot.  However, sometimes the weather changes and sandals are not appropriate.

Crocs are indeed hideous, but they can't be beat for comfort and convenience in the garden. I keep a few sizes on hand in the garage so there can be no excuses when I ask someone in the family to help out! Easy on/off, roomy enough to wear with socks if you need to, and a blast with the garden hose cleans off the muck. I wouldn't wear these ugly shoes out of the house though!

I purchased these as a replacement for a pair of first generation crocs that were marked size 8-9.  I wear a size 9M American, size 42 Euro, and after reviewing the fit reviews and Croc's sizing chart, I ordered size 9.  The new size 9 crocs are much too big.  While the length was okay, the width was much too wide.  I returned the size 9s and re-ordered a pair of size 8s which are much closer in fit to my original pair but the heels are wider than the originals.  I've attached a photo of the size 9s on the left, size 8 in the middle, and the original size 8-9 on the right.  Note the width of the heels and the overall shape.  The originals fit (me) much better.  The 8s will have to do.

Ordered a W8. This is my first pair of Crocs & I’m not sure whyyyyyy I waited this long to get a pair. Now I see why ppl use it. Very comfortable. I’m flat footed. I was able to wear it barefoot & also w| thin socks (tester around the house). The strap part to keep your feet in, it’s actually shorter than the actual length of the shoe (it’s not lined up with the heel part . Around a quarter of an inch or so from the heel) so when it goes around the back of your foot, it actually pushes your feel more inside the shoe. This isn’t a big deal for me as I’m actually a 7.5 women’s. I always love ordering any shoe item a half size bigger to have the extra room for thicker socks if needed. My Crocs were made in Mexico. I’ve seen some complaints about sizing issues when it’s made in different countries. Anyways, I would recommend a pair to anyone.
I've heard reviews years ago that these might be ugly as sin, but are the most comfortable footwear you can get.

I have a pair of original Crocs that I bought 15 years ago and absolutely love them.  But the soles finally wore through and I needed to finally get another pair.  The size stamped on the bottom says W6-7.  I started looking on Amazon and couldn't believe how many styles of Crocs there are.  All I wanted was another pair just like my old ones.  I saw these Crocs Unisex Classic Clog and they looked almost identical to what I have.  I got a size 7 in Pepper and they are perfect.  I plan on ordering a couple more pairs.  Not for when these wear out (they seem to last forever) but there are so many great colors now.
I love the class Crocs clog.  My feet swell in hot, humid weather, and these are the only shoes I can tolerate.  I also walk several miles a day to and from work, and these are the best.

I wish I had believed the comments about various size differences according to country of manufacture.  The Crocs I've always purchased in the past ran at least a size too large and very wide.  So, I ordered a size smaller than I usually wear; but the Croc slip-on I received is like a woman's size 8 regular (and I wear and 11 wide).  I can't even get my foot into it.  I guess I'll have to branch out to another brand of footwear that's more reliable.  I hate returning things and I usually just take the loss, but these are going back.

I’m using the shoes as houseshoes because we have all tile and as I’ve aged I’ve developed feet issues from the shoes we wear. I researched the toe shoes and zero drop shoes and since I don’t have access to a store near me Crocs Classics were recommended so I bought these despite some Amazon reviews regarding size difference. Mine came from Vietnam and they fit fine. I recently purchased another pair for the street and the back strap on left foot is slightly shorter than right but after walking a couple of days in them I have gotten use to them. My shoes were made in Bietnam. I think perhaps there are some quality differences depending on where the shoes are manufactured so Cros needs to look at there quality control closer I think. I love the crocs classics and have no foot pain while wearing them.

5 stars for the product, 0 stars for the idiotic sizing.  You'd think they'd fix it with all the complaints.  Bought my first Crocs at a yardsale and they're wearing out so I ordered these which I believed to be the same thing, but they're absolutely not.  The bottoms of my old ones say "W10-11  M8-9".  These are "M9 W11" and the shoe is so big my foot is just rattling around in there.  They're going back, but I honestly don't know what size to order now.  My advice is to never buy shoes or hats on-line without free returns, and even then don't do it.

I love these shoes! Crocs are silly looking yes, but that is what I love about them! I'm writing this review mainly just to note that in the description, it advises that if you're a half size to go a size down, since crocs can be large fitting/wide. However, this wasn't the case for me. I'm a size 7 and 1/2 in womens, so I chose a size 7, but I had to return it as I found it too tight fitting. If you fit size 8 converse just fine, then you most likely have feet similar to mine, so I'd recommend going a size up! Even without socks, it was uncomfortable enough for me to have to return it for a larger size.

My podiatrist recommended I wear these Crocs after a broke a bone on the bottom of my foot. If you are having foot pain or are recovering form a fracture these Crocs are much better than walking around barefoot while you're trying to rest your feet.

I have seen people wearing these for years and always thought they look ridiculous and couldn’t imagine how foam rubber shoes could be comfortable or durable. It’s obvious they aren’t stylish. After buying my very first pair of grass green size 15 crocs here for a crazy pre Christmas sale price of under 10$ with the free prime shipping, I’m amazed. After trying them on I no longer care how they look and I now get why they are popular. They are light durable and super comfy without feeling like you’re walking on marshmallows. In fact I was shocked how firm the foot bed is without being hard. I no longer care how they look. Not sure I would wear them to a wedding but for around the house and yard they are perfect.

I was going to buy slippers to wear in my yard and patio since it's been annoying to put shoes on whenever taking my dog outside or to take the trash out. But I went with Crocs since they are just as comfortable while also allowing me to run around if needed (ie. dog randomly feels like running around the backyard).

I bought 2 pair of crocs in two different colors. I wear size 6 1/2 shoes and the crocs are a size 7. They just barely fit, they are almost too small. I have a pair of crocs, this exact size, bought about ten years ago, and they are about a half inch longer and a bit wider. I was hoping the pairs I bought would be that exact size. The old pair says "Made in China" and the new pairs say "Made in Vietnam" and "Made in Mexico". I'm happy with the looks and quality of the new crocs, just wish they were a tad larger, more like a size 7. In the photos, the shoe on the left is the new croc, the shoe on the right is my old croc. Note the size difference.
These Crocs are softer than I imagined, fit a bit wider than I was hoping for, and the arch support is not there for me, but I have high arches.
Crocs are dorky but keep your feet cool, great on wet days, very comfortable, easy to get on and off and last.

I bought these specifically for my rowing club needs. I needed something waterproof, easy to get on & off quickly, and the ability to stuff my foot into while wearing bulky wool socks (and, as I encountered the other day, the ability to actually float). They do provide for all of these needs. The fit, however, is a little weird. I'm a pretty solid Women's 7, with a fairly wide foot. The width is fine, but my toes hit the end of the shoe pretty aggressively without socks, and the toe grip thingy on the sole seems oddly placed.

I ordered these in my size (i have other pairs of Crocs so I know exactly the size I need). That said, these were too small. I can wear them but I can not used the strap or my toes will be scrunched up front and basically they will be so painful that I will CRY!!! So make sure you order these a size larger than you need. Do not be like me and order the exact size you typically wear.
Mostly I wanted to note to others that if left or worn a lot in the sunlight, THESE WILL SHRINK CONSIDERABLY.

These a very light, which was unexpected. I thought they would be like the old, heavy, rubber ones, but these seem to be silicone-based and are pleasantly light, bendable and comfortable. They are good for letting the errant water flow through during gardening, but of course, the open side holes also allow lots of dirt to get in, which is not as easy to get out without taking them off. That said, how hard is it to take them off? They do what they are supposed to.

You expect good quality control from a brand name like Crocs so it’s disappointing to get one with obvious defects. The strap on the left slipper is bent out of round, so it’s not comfortable to wear. I tried stretching it over the back of the slipper overnight to get it back in shape, but it didn’t help. It seems something went wrong in the molding process. I bought this on sale on Black Friday so maybe they were unloading second quality items during this sale, or I just got a bad one. The question is whether I want to go through the hassle of shipping this back to exchange it on Amazon!  It’s a disappointing to have to go through this on a simple order.

Par excellence Crocs. These fit nice and are comfy. This is my third pair which I bought because the Croc company is off-shoring it's production and well you know how re-sellers are. I mean who is going to pay $400 for a pair of Crocs.

I bought these for a trip to wear on the beach.  They are comfy and fit okay but I have to get used to the large fit. I was initially ready to return them after trying them on and seeing that they fit rather loosely. I have a noticeable gap between my heel and the strap if I move my foot forward to wear my toes touch the front.  However,  Crocs classic clogs are in the "roomy fit" line of Crocs which, according to the Crocs website means they should be roomy with feet never touching the sides and front.  My fit matches the description exactly but it takes a little getting used to because I've never worn a shoe so roomy.  Fit aside, they do feel comfortable and the sole is soft and more comfy than flats or sandals.  If you absolutely do not want a roomy fit, I'd suggest ordering a size smaller. I think an 11 would fit me just right despite wearing a size 12 sneak and size 13 shoe depending on design.  I'm keeping mine though because the fit is exactly as Crocs describes it should be.

I've  been wearing the same brand/style for many years -- the Crocs classic. This time when I ordered new ones of the same size as always before, they are smaller. Size 8 (women's) were always just a tad too large, which was perfect because they stayed on well while giving my feet room to expand when they get swollen. My toes rub the font of the shoe a little in the new ones. By this measurement, I need an 8.5, but that is not offered, at least not in Amazon.

I couldn't find the classic ones in the stores around where I live anymore. They all have adopted the newer hard bottoms. I wanted to find these classic ones because I loved to wear them around the house as indoor slippers. Just for some context, I'm Asian, and we don't wear shoes into the house. Partially to keep the floors clean, but probably some other cultural reason that I haven't looked into yet. We have specific indoor slippers. I haven't looked too much into slippers, but I know these are good in the winter time because they can keep my feet warm and are easy to wash if they start to smell.
I had planned to use these Crocs for yard work, however, once I put them on and realized how comfortable they are, I decided to make them my run about shoes.
What happened to the sizing? I wear M10/W12, so that's what I ordered. The ones I got are 1/4" narrower than the one-year-old crocs I'm currently wearing!

I bought these as camp shoes for a buddy of mine, and he floats between a 16 and an 18 depending on the brand. One star off only due to these being nearly two sizes too big for him. They measured at least 13.75" toe box to heel. If you have a hard time finding exact fits in Woolly Monmouth sizes, I would find a way to test fit these before you try them, as they are not sized the same as many main brand shoes. The quality of the product overall though is second to none. The foam is rigid but soft and the shoes feel plenty durable for a camp shoe or a water fording option when backpacking. Amazon, as always, was fantastic in allowing me to exchange them.

I've had a pair like this for years.  I got paint on them so decided to finally buy a new pair - all shiny and new.  I was shocked at how small they seemed.  I compared them to my old crocs - same size - and the bottom of the croc is the same.  The problem is that the back strap is much shorter than the old crocs so it pushes your foot into the front of the croc - very uncomfortable.  They're unwearable. Unfortunately I tried to wear them because I couldn't believe they wouldn't fit like the old ones and thought they'd "mold/stretch" to fit so I can't return them.  Very disappointing - not sure I'll ever buy crocs again. I don't know if this was a quality fluke or if that's the way they all are now.
Our 9 year old LOVES his Crocs.  He is never without at least one pair that fits him.

These are the old original Crocs they've been selling for many years now. It was about 4-5years ago when they started making some newer Crocs with a newer type of plastic, I've bought a few pairs of those and they've all had problems with shrinking, which eventually causes them to rub and blister your foot in different places, to be expected when you buy shoes that fit, which then proceed to shrink! Don't know why they sell those ones, the material is clearly defective imo. These originals might wear out a little quicker but they're comfortable and don't shrink.

Technically, these were a gift to someone else.  He likes the convenience of a quick slip-on, and likes that they are more stable and supportive than any of the verious "flip-flop" type slip-ons, but he doesn't like that he "can't" wear them with socks ((says the socks catch on all of the openings)), and that therefore, his feet sweat.

I bought these because they make perfect, lightweight camp shoes for hiking on the Appalachian Trail. The only drawback is that now, when I log onto Facebook, the advertisements are for crocs. I had some friends over at the time, and now everyone knows that I'm interested in shopping for crocs! My social life is ruined. These were meant to be worn in the isolation of the trail, never to be seen in society. My secret is out. Nobody thinks I'm cool anymore. But my feet sure are nice and comfy at camp. Guess I'll have to live in the woods forever with my crocs, because now I don't have any friends left. Thanks, amazon.
I only wear them around the house or yard.  I would never subject them to hardcore walking about town.

I bought my first pair of Crocs almost ten years ago, back when they were made in Colorado.  They were the most comfortable shoe for hanging around the house or cooking in the kitchen for long periods of time.  My house has tile or hardwood so there isn't a lot of give there.  Those Crocs were made out of a softer, squishier rubber that had a lot of give to it.  These Crocs are made of a firmer material that seems like it has some plastic in it.  They aren't very cushioned.  They are also a lot smaller.  They fit but just barely.  Don't know if that's because I got a pair from Mexico instead of China (and how weird is it to be hoping you get one of the ones from China but all the reviews agree they fit better than the ones from Mexico.)  Also these have anti-fatigue nubs inside.  They are arranged in ridges, higher in some parts than others.  You can see it's meant to be higher above the ball of your foot, under your toes but the weird sizing keeps my foot from fitting perfectly in that area so mostly I'm just walking on uneven nubs.  I don't know if they work for anti-fatigue because they hurt my feet and I can only wear these shoes for about an hour at a time.  I suppose it will be like when I was a kid in the summer and at first it hurt to go barefoot outside but after a while your feet toughen up and it stops hurting.  Not thrilled though to have paid money for shoes that my feet have to toughen up for.  They are also a lot hotter to wear than my old Crocs.  Not sure if it's because of the smaller size or the new material.  Overall, I'm very unhappy with these shoes.  Looks like I'll have to find a replacement for my old Crocs elsewhere.

One of my sons had a neat pair of some inexpensive rubbery shoes and I asked him to get me a pair. Dissatisfied with them I bought myself some Crocs instead. Thinking I'd have them by the front door to slip on when I got the mail or took out the trash, which usually mean walking out in the rain, and the Crocs were a decent no slip foot gear. But I'd no idea that I'd suddenly be hit by major emergency surgery and couldn't bend, and my feet swelled up! The Crocs were very important, heck, are still important in getting to my medical appointments during recovery!

I originally purchased these for my girlfriend for Christmas. We use Crocs to go kayaking in since they're rubber and clearly don't hold water. The only downside to using these for something like kayaking is that when the surface you're stepping on is slick, don't expect Crocs to have a firm grip - they'll make you slip easily (only downside but not enough to give 4/5 stars). We also wear crocs to go out in the spring time when the yard is just mud. That way, we can just hose the crocs off and our feet off before we go back in the house.
I got these as shower clogs, and they work fine, I do find the bumps in the bed of the shoes are a little annoying right after putting them on, but the odd sensation seems to fade.

I use these as my "around the property" outdoor shoes. After 9 mo. the soles still have plenty of grip. I wear them in all weather as the sole is high enough in most cases to keep my feet dry. I was amazed at how different the comfort was between Crocs and aftermarket Croc knockoffs. In fact, sometimes I forget to take them off and leave them by the door! Roomy enough to wear with even heavier socks or just barefoot with no affect on how well they stay on. I always wear mine without the heel strap. When these do wear out, I will buy another pair of Crocs! The hardest decision will be picking a color as there's many choices that I really like.

Believe what you hear about the size being too small. These particular Crocs were manufactured in Italy--why does that matter? Italians are known to have smaller/narrower feet than Americans. Honestly, even with the narrowed width, they still supplied the known comfort of Crocs, the biggest problem of limited length is attributed to the straps not protruding back enough to allow the foot the space you get when wearing the Crocs without the use of the straps.

I bought these Crocs in the very nice light grey.  I almost returned these shoes because the nibs on the footbed felt sharp and prickly and hurt the bottom of my feet.  I used a while 3M abrasive pad to rub down the nubs and I am now happy with the feel.  I have a men's10.5 EEE foot and the size 11 M Crocs fit me pretty well.  3 stars instead of 5 because of the nuns being too sharp.  Otherwise a good looking a comfortable shoe.

Could not do without these shoes.  I had to do a major move from a house that had accumulated over 50 years of junk and without these shoes, I don't think I could have managed such a huge effort.  The shoes provided support and also protected my feet. If I had to rinse an item or plow through muddy dirt in the rain, no problem.  I could rinse off the shoes before going back into the house. Exploring an attic filled with fiber glass insulation? No problem.  The shoes protected my feet and fiber glass insulation was easily washed away. Thank you Crocs for these incredibly comfortable and useful shoes!

I'm a old lady, concerned about falling or slipping outside working on my farm.  I have been told to buy Crocs for years, but as usual, I'm the last one to catch trends.  These shoes are easily hosed off if debris gets inside, and they are light weight and very comfortable.  I call them my new Bozo the Clown shoe because they are so wide, but I wear an 8.5, and the 6 -8 fits perfectly.  I just ordered another pair that may be less wide.  I cannot wait!  I'm a 64 year old lady chicken farmer with a closet full of fancy shoes that are going to be leaving!  I'd rather have Crocs for every occasion!

Either I got a knock off pair, or the quality of Crocs has went way down. The new ones are made much cheaper and smaller, and the harder plastic is more uncomfortable. There is no more padded arch or footbed (insole), and they are just downright uncomfortable compared to the nice soft, thicker rubber they used to make them with. What happened Crocs? PLEASE bring back the Original Great Quality!

Purchased my first pair at an Outlet Mall about 5 years ago and paid almost twice the amount for the same thing.  I used to wear them around the house inside and out.  They finally needed replaced after a small hole got worn into the sole.  They held up very well for a long time.  Probably should have been replaced a year ago but even 4 years of wear and tear is pretty good for rubber shoes.  These new ones fit just like the old ones.  The only noticeable difference is the back heel portion is a bit shorter than my original pair.  Excellent Product.

So far, it's easy to wear 'n comfortable, however I do hope this will last longer for the price I paid versus a similar pair I bought from a Daiso store, made of cheap rubber material 'n easily worn out although things are "Made in China" now a days, still any product manufacturer is responsible in using "quality", "decent" 'n "durable" materials as well as making thoughtful, "experimented", sound design for a product to withstand daily wear with occasional treading on treacherous, rough ground to occasional speedy pace on a walk.

Package arrived in good order, and ahead of promised delivery time. Not sure if these are the "original crocs."  I bought them as a gift, and when I delivered them to the intended receiver, they commented on the little "massage bubbles" on the bottom of the shoe where your foot rests in the shoe. The person wore them for a couple of days and ended up with a blister.  Other crocs she has owned didn't have the massage things on the sole of the shoe, and she never had trouble with blisters from crocs before.

First time croc buyer...pretty much what I expected. Not a ton of support, my feet were a little sore after being on them all day at work, but that is typical with a new shoe. I bought these due to swelling feet during the end of this pregnancy, and these are perfect for that. Lots of air flow to keep my feet cool, but still a closed toe shoe that is required in my medical office job. I bought a 9 US Womens, I usually wear a 8.5 (39 euro size) but my feet have definitely changed during this second pregnancy. Lengthwise I feel like I would want a little more room, but width wise they are plenty big and I know I would swim in the next size up.

I purchased these to wear around the house because I have been having lot's of heel pain and can't walk barefoot anymore.  These shoes are a life saver.  I never owned Crocs before.  My son purchased a pair with the fussy liners and he really liked them.  I didn't want the extra warmth so I purchased these.  I am so impressed.  And I can go outside in them if I want.  Part of the reason for my headline about "foot massage", is the soles have small ridges of dots that actually massage my foot.

My daughter wears these almost constantly. She has extra wide feet & they are one of the few shoes she actually likes & that fit. Her friends give her grief about them but, since she is a strong individual, she has never let that stop her from doing exactly as she pleases.

I’ve wanted a second pair of Crocs for a long time.  I have a pair that’s at least 15 years old and I use them a lot.  This new pair fit perfectly, and I was very happy with them until I stood up. The new design of the insole where your feet rest are full of little spikes molded into the shoe itself.  Perhaps my feet are very soft and sensitive, but I can’t wear these without some sort of insert; I certainly had no intention of wearing these with socks!  Those little spikes hurt my feet!  That’ll pretty much eliminate wearing them in water, which is one of my primary uses for these.  I’ll try to find a suitable insert, but I may just have to return these.  Please bring back the old insole without those pesky spikes!

They provide reasonable support and are slip proof.  The size 7 I usually wear is slightly snug with these; I would be happier with a 7.5 if they had half sizes.  The holes are nice because they let your feet breath.  I wear socks with them because the inside feels slightly prickly (little nubs).  (Note:  I edited my review and gave it a higher rating after a few days because they are very different and take some getting used to.  For standing and doing chores, they are pretty comfortable).

Love Crocs sandals. They're super light weight and fairly durable considering they're just made of foam. They're some of the more comfortable sandals I own, since they have some arch support and whatnot in them. I still couldn't wear them for a whole day, or even several hours at once, but for brief periods, like to run outside or wear at the beach, they're great. I only have 1 complaint, they tend to run about 2 sizes too small. I wear a 9- 9.5 regularly, but had to order a 12 in Crocs so they'd fit comfortably.

If you know what Crocs are then you know what you're getting. Sure, some colors are less garish than others, but at the end of the day these are big rubber sandals that you wear on your feet. It's not going to be the height of fashion, by any stretch.

ugh. I don't find these comfortable at all. They're a  lightweight rubbery kind of  shoe that makes my feet hot and sweaty, the inside is too bumpy and rough and my knees started aching after walking around in them for less than 15 minutes. Walking in them is not a pleasure.

I normally wear size 8.5. Usually when I get footware such as this they only come in whole sizes, so I have to choose between 8 and 9 (US). My experience has told me to go with the 8 (flip flops, muck boots, etc). It held true for these, I ordered the size 8 and fit is just what I wanted. Overall love the design, there is a bit of arch support which I want, very comfortable. I wear these as "house slippers" all the time I'm in the house, I live on a farm and wear boots most of the time outside, so out in the garage I leave these while stepping into my boots, and vice versa. I probably wouldn't wear these out anywhere, but you certainly could. I don't use the straps, just leave them in the out of the way position, forward, but if I did wear them any place but in the house I'd probably engage those straps.

Based on a previously purchased pair similar (but without backstrap) that were a bit snug at the end of the day or on "swollen feet" days, I purchased this, only one size larger. Mistake.  I am SWIMMING in these. I might try them in the fall with socks, but that defeats the purpose of easy rinse off with hose through the holes.  Moreover, since most gardening is done with water, I'll be left with wet, dirty socks each time.  Beware of the difference between ladies', men's, and unisex products.  My former purchase must have been a ladies' shoe (didn't buy online, and there's no indication inside or underneath shoe, just a size number), and these are unisex.  Bottomline, if basing new purchase size on a current pair of shoes, know that unisex is like TWO sizes larger than a current ladies' size.  It would be nice, also, if Crocs would 1.) consider labeling the bottom of their shoes with an L, U, or MN (not just M, or people might think "medium" who didn't know better) before the size number (for ladies, uni, or men) so that  future customers (and current! esp. if received as a gift) know what they own, and equally important, 2.) state how to convert various gender sizing with ordering similar or same shoes--example "Order same size if you want a slightly larger fit, when going from ladies' to unisex."

Well... I never had a pair of Crocs before. Somebody told me they used to be softer. I like the Crocs a lot. They are a tad wide but I expected that. They are my new go to shoes this Summer. I have a size 15 foot. I was just amazed that I could get them in a size-15 for $30. I bought my daughter a pair and they were $10 more for the same basic style. .. Go figure? Glad I got them. They will be a great Summer/house shoes for me. Flip flops are not made for guys with a size 15 foot. These crocs have got to be the next best thing to flip flops..... maybe better.

Just what I was looking for, something easy to slip on when I walk the dog. When it's early in the morning or middle of the night and my canine wants to venture out, sometimes it's not easy to affix my shoes to my hooves when I'm half asleep. I can just slip these suckers on without even trying. They're ugly but in a charming way. They are moderately comfortable, though they do make my feet sweat. Not really a problem though since I plan on wearing them even when it's cold outside.

My husband had surprised me with a pair of this style Clog in black, so I ordered a pair in navy. After mis-ordering one size larger, I just received the correct size that I assumed would fit as my original black Clogs do. Unfortunately, this latest pair is 1/4 inch shorter in length, which results in my toes/toenails touching the end of the front portion of the shoe.CAUTION! Be sure to try both shoes on and walk around carpeted area to make sure there is adequate space before disposing of box/packing.

These are GREAT. Don't know why I resisted getting crocs for so long... I guess I thought they were ugly, but man, are they ever comfortable!! And I've gotten to the point in my life where comfort trumps style. (That being said, they aren't THAT ugly... Or maybe they've just grown on me!) I had an old pair of slides that I used for quick indoor/outdoor shoes (to take out the trash, etc.), but they developed holes in the soles, and needed to be replaced. These fit the bill perfectly! I can quickly slip them on to go outside, then slide them off in my foyer when I come back inside (especially with the strap swiveled up an out of the way, they function like clogs).

Being a Croc wearing family, purchased these as a Christmas gift for my brother in law. Purchased the gray in men’s 15 (he has big feet!)  gave them to him Christmas Eve- he wore them daily in/outdoors for one week....strap on left foot broke on New Year’s Day!!!! I have never had a strap break on my 4+ pairs! Totally disappointed and bummed for my gift! Now he has to wear them with the strap forward....again totally disappointed with this- especially being Croc brand

I swore up and down for years I would never own crocs, but I bought a pair out of FOMO when my sister got these minion ones... These shoes are light as air and so comfortable. I end up wearing them around the house as slippers to protect my feet from the hard floor and I also wear them when traveling long distances in the car. They are perfect slip on shoes if you're in a rush and just running some errands! Would still never wear these as regular shoes, but they're hilarious and serve their purpose.

For the longest time, ever since they came out really, I thought Crocs were the ugliest shoes. I couldn't see why anybody wore them. However, my boyfriend owns a pair, and I had to wear them a few times (granted his feet are quite bigger than mine). They. Are. Comfortable. As. Heck. It took a while, but I finally decided that I needed to buy a pair of my own. My feet hurt all the time, especially my heels because that's where I put all of my weight when standing. Let me tell you: I can walk around for hours wearing these shoes, and I don't feel any discomfort. Even after a 9-hour shift of standing and walking around at work, I can put these on, and my feet already feel better. Do yourself a favor and buy yourself a pair. I wear 8 1/2, so I dropped down a half size as recommended, and they fit perfectly.

I think depending on where the Crocs is made the sizing is a little bit off because I got a white one made in Vietnam and a purple one made in Mexico and they fit differently even though they're the same size but I still love them. I'll just wear it without the band behind my heel.

I don’t know what to tell you. Crocs are dead to me. I have searched high and low for the elusive roomy fit crocs that I first purchased about five years ago. They were made in Mexico of a somewhat softer material than the new ones I find now. After much research, I thought the Classic Crocs were the ticket with their “roomy fit” description. This description is BS. I don’t think Croc makes a roomy clog anymore. I certainly can’t find it if they do.

The cut of these crocs is different than my older ones. It is very tight around the instep and cut is different on the heel. The material is much stiffer than my other crocs. Debating whether to order a larger size, or try to break them in. But the whole point of crocs is that they are roomy and require no break in time. What is going on with crocs now? Why are they shaped differently? I loved crocs and have a lot of foot issues so would like to find a solution.

I know this fad is probably already over, but I just decided to finally buy a pair in anticipation of a cruise. I'm not crazy about the texture that you put your feet on (a little spiky), but I got used to it. I am picky about my footwear, and there are few things I can wear without the soles of my feet hurting. These things are SO comfortable! They are super lightweight and seriously the only footwear I needed for the entire week on the cruise. I wore them in the room, walking around the ship, walking around ports, to the beach, to the pool, and even to dinner. The last is maybe not recommended, but you can definitely get away with it. :) I even tried to continue wearing them once I got back to the Minnesota snow (although that did not work out so well). I like the black color because they blend in a little bit more than the brighter colors. They do get crease marks on the top of them, but there's not really a way to prevent that. You might lose a few style points, but they are so comfortable you will not even care!
Bought these for my husband who had a non name pair of imitations. Sadly our puppy had gotten a hold of them twice so extra holes were added. In addition they had been worn through on the soles.

I have hammertoe on my right foot and have difficulty finding a comfortable pair of closed toe shoes. I stand on my feet for long hours as well so even wider toebox shoes chafe my toe and cause a lot of pain. To make it easy on myself I just stuck with one pair of walking shoes and never tried another one. Through the recommendation of a friend who has multiple foot issues I decided to give crocs a try.  I couldnt be more glad that I bought these shoes. The size is perfect and i wear them and work in my studio for hours standing without ever being reminded of my pain. These shoes are extremely comfortable and I wear them all the time.
I absolutely LOVE the Crocs classic.  They are basically all I wear, whether I'm at work, going to a wedding (YES), gardening, at the beach, I mean:  once you go Crocs, you never go back!!!

Crocs dry very quickly because they don't absorb water as many neoprene water shoes do.  This is important to me because I go five times a week to aqua-aerobics exercise programs and I need the shoes to dry before my next session.  I also like the color selection of Crocs.  I was able to get a color to match my bathing suit.
These are different from the classic Crocs of yore. I'm bummed out, but I'll just use these until I find a new go-to comfort shoe. Probably go back to running shoes for casual comfort.

I had a pair of these that I had worn almost every day for 6+ years that somehow got lost during a hospital stay.  I was so sad ... and immobilized, as these shoes are what I wear around my house every day while I chase my kiddos and do chores!  If I don't wear them my feet hurt so badly.  After a week or so of going barefoot and not wearing them I ended up with a full limp and a sore knee (from walking funny because of my foot pain).  My husband couldn't stand it anymore and told me to order another pair PRONTO!  I did, and within a day my feet felt great again!  I have incredibly high arches, and these are one of the few types of shoes I can wear for extended periods of time without any pain.  I loooove my crocs!!

I know people think crocs are now longer cool, I do not care!  I love crocs, especially in the summer.  They super great at the pool and wash out really well.  I love to take them camping.  I think of them as my camping slippers.  Super Awesome when nature calls in the middle of the night.  When you have more than one color, go ahead and mix and match!

Liked the free return-The first pair was a size too small, the Clogs I ordered as a replacement fit perfectly. A comfortable size for me turned out to be 1/2 size larger than the fit I like for a shoe. When first wearing I thought the loose fit would be a problem with the Clogs slipping off as the back strap is not adjustable but due to good design by Crocs the Clogs are completely secure and do not slip off. My advice is to go for the loose fit as it makes for a very comfortable fit.

I have worn these since I got my first pair for 50¢ at a garage sale! The price on Amazon was not quite that good, but it was on the low side. I did have to return mine though because my size was not available in my desired color of khaki. Zappos had them (free shipping and free returns). As always, Amazon is my first choice, but even having to pay $6 more on Zappos.com I got the color I needed. Crocs sizing can be confusing: the bottom of each shoe list two sizes:  M (men) W (women). So when looking for your size, look for your gender size. The shoes should fit roomy at the toe and at the heal - do not let them rub anywhere (as advised by crocs). You will get used to the loose fit after a while - or just use the back strap for more stability. I ordered M 8/ W6 and it was to small (short: toe & heal touched ends) My normal shoe size is women's 8 and on rare occasion 8 1/2. My foot is narrow to med. width. The size I needed from crocs was M7/W9 (so the women's 8 was too small/short). Amazon showed my size of US7/9 (way down at the bottom of the scroll down drop-list), but did not have my color available. Thought I'd take a chance (to save $6) and try women's 8. Zappos, like Amazon, delivered quickly and the shoes in the proper size 7/9 fit!

To be honest, I really wanted the Purple Classic Crocs to replace an older, worn-out pair, but I wasn't about to pay three times the price just to have that same color of Crocs. I have no idea why the pricing is so varied depending on the color you select, but I am happy to say that these hot pink, "Neon Magenta" Crocs are working out just fine. The fit is perfect and true to size, and the same quality and comfort is there, too. Plus, they barely put a dent in my pocketbook. I still miss my purple Crocs and will continue to monitor them here on Amazon. I just hope they are soon offered at a reasonable price. They must be an extremely popular color choice if people are willing to pay $60.00 right now just to have purple feet! (I must have started something years ago when I purchased my original pair...)
The gold crocs are perfect! They are SO PRETTY, if you were worried about the color on these shoes - worry no more! They also fit very true to size.
Worn these for years as house shoes. Happy they still make and sell these. I developed neuropathy in my legs and it effects my feet too.

I have two sets of Crocs I've been wearing for about 10 years and they've been great. They're the only shoes I wear, year around. I love them. Or I did. Recently, I ordered two new sets (black and brown) and they're too small. Very small. They're the same size as the two sets I've been wearing, but they don't fit the same. I wear a size 8 wide and the Crocs size 8 has been perfect. Unfortunately, I've worn them so I can't return them, but if I were to purchase more I'd get a size larger. I hope as I wear these two, they'll loosen up.

This is my third pair of actual Crocs. The other two pair were a women's flats in two different colors, and I love them, but at my age, I need a little more padding for long shopping trips. So I got these classic Crocs. The Navy color is perfect, and true to the image shown. I ordinarily wear a 7 1/2 M and followed the advice to order the next full size down, so a 7M, and they fit very well except for one issue that might only apply to someone like me who has a long second toe and who wears a size 7M. There are holes at the base of the front around the edge, as clearly seen in the photo. The holes on both the left and right shoe line up in such a way that my second toe ends up sticking out of the hole. This is less than optimal. The shoes are otherwise very comfortable and have plenty of padding. I wore them on a recent shopping trip, and except for the issue of the toes sticking out, were just what the doctor ordered. I wore ankle socks to see if that would stop the toe from poking out, but it didn't. I did have to subtract one star from the rating, because of the toe issue, and I'm open to suggestions on what might be done to plug up those holes so my toes don't poke through. I want to keep the shoes, because I was far less fatigued after the shopping trip than usual, but my second toes were a little sore on the sides where they rubbed the shoe after poking out. I don't think one of those decorative plugs they have would work, because they would take up too much room on the inside of the shoe.

Let's face it. Crocs are ugly. Having said that, I bought these and wear them constantly - they are like walking barefoot with rubber bumpers. I had to re-learn my natural gait after hip replacement last year and Crocs were my go-to shoe during that time. I've recommended Crocs to friends having knee surgery for the same reason. These classic style black Crocs are the same size as purple classics I've had for years but these fit the way shoes should - I didn't realize how loose and big the older pair were. I believe they were manufactured in different countries which seems to make a difference in sizing. Go Crocs!

These are my first pair of crocs after years of making fun of people who wear these shoes. I wanted a pair of shoes I could slip on and off quickly for letting the dogs, taking the trash out, etc. so I decided to give them a try since they are so affordable. I love them!

These are not the "same ol' thing" that I was hoping for.  The material is NOT the cushy comfortable foam that I had hoped for - it is much less rubber-y and much more plastic-y than the old ones and the sizing is also way off.  In comparing the two, the new ones are about a half inch shorter in total length than my old ones of the same size.  I had another pair that I purchased about a year ago--same problem, but gave them away in hopes it was a fluke batch. Apparently not and I have returned the shoes and am searching for a replacement--anyone know of any OLD stock Crocs for sale?

The baby blue color was pretty. I bought it in size 9B (W)/ 7 B(M). My daughter wears a size 7.5-8.0, and I am a size 8.5-9.0. The shoe was too long by a thumb and a quarter length for me and even longer for my daughter. I based the purchase on an older croc that was labeled 8-9 and which fit her just fine but touched my toe. I tend to like to purchase a half size up, so I ordered the 9. Because the length was too long, the ankle strap was useless. The width was too wide for my medium width feet and extra wide for my daughter's narrow feet. If you are a size 8.5-9.0 like me, I'd order a size 8. But beware that the width will still be big in general and especially for folks with narrow feet. The little nubs in the shoe were more pronounced in the toe area and hardly felt in the other areas of the shoe. I have flat feet, and the shoe did not have any arch support which works fine for me since my feet tend to hurt when shoes have significant arch support.

I got these for me and my husband to walk the dog, and we absolutely love them!  They are super lightweight, provide perfect stability and comfort, and you can stick them under a garden hose and they look brand new.  Honestly never had crocs before, but these are truly something spectacular.  I like the look of them, my husband thinks they are ugly, yet he wears them everywhere so that must tell you something about how comfortable they are :)  We have not had them for very long yet so I cannot speak on the durability and longevity of these shoes, but I will definitely be back to update.  Thank you!!

I can't believe I waited this long in life to finally muster up enough courage to buy these and wear them in public, but it's the best and most comfortable decision I ever made! They arrived on time, color matched to a T, and they're the most pleasant shoes to wear that I own! I can wear these all day and sometimes even forget they're on, save for the bright color I ordered. I will definitely recommend and even buy them as presents in the future! I also recently discovered they make charms for them now...

I have a slightly wide foot, size 8 men's, and they fit comfortably in the size 8 US Men's Classic Clog (the standard size, not wider model). It's roomy, but not to the point where my foot flops around feels insecure, and there's enough room to wear the clogs with socks on. I like that they're easy to slip on and off and have good traction on wet surfaces. So now I just have to see how they'll do over time. They're replacing a pair of sandals that I bought in Hawaii thirty years ago and are still wearable, but I like the fact that the Crocs have a little more toe protection.

If you've never owned crocs before I really highly recommend them. Don't get me wrong I do not wear these to work or to social events. I don't buy them because they're cute. I buy them because they're practical. I can wear them in the river or when I'm gardening. They also are great to take hiking in case you don't want to jam your feet into your tennis shoes when you have to get up and out of your tent in the middle of the night. I imagine if I lived on a beach I'd wear them there too. They are super easy to clean and I honestly could wear them for days on end I think they're so comfortable.

DO NOT buy these crocs if you are looking for the real deal, they are huge and the holes are the wrong size/ in the wrong places. They look fine on their own, but compared with real ones they are obviously fake. Spend the extra 5-10 dollars on real ones from the store or Crocs website.

Great fit for my size 10 feet, and the best part is that these cost MUCH less than they do at the store. I've purchased cheap knockoffs that cost almost as much as these, and they werent half as good. I've worn these every day and the soles dont show any wear. More importantly, they are soft and comfortable, while the knockoffs are stiff and uncomfortable. Some people like to wear these barefoot or with socks, while I prefer to place "Oder Eaters" or some other foam in them.  Very good quality and price!

I used to have heel pain --  plantar fascia.  I stretched a couple times a day and that mostly kept the pain at bay.  Then a friend suggested crocs.  Pain gone.  It has been 10 years since I have worn anything else -- or stretched.  I used to these shoes direct from Crocs.  The website is nice and there are all kinds of options.  Almost all of the styles that I tried were narrower.  My 'real shoe' size is 11 EEE.  Crocs Mens 12 work in this style.  If they feel a little tight at first, keep wearing them.  They stretch and, like fine leather shoes, mold to the feet.  Amazon Prime means free shipping, so I can buy one pair at a time without paying shipping and for the same price as the Crocs website or the local box store.

I love Crocs especially after breaking a bone in my foot. These have the extra space I need for my wide feet so that they don't hurt that sensitive part of my foot. Even with thick socks, these are the most comfortable shoes I own. The cushiony sole has always been a positive, as well as the deep tread for traction even on a wet sidewalk. If they're a bit loose in bare feet, the strap helps hold them on without worry. The ultraviolet color could be called grape, a lovely shade of purple.

I work for an FDA controlled facility, so street shoes are not allowed on the floor and work shoes are not allowed off the floor. I bought these to keep at work so I can walk around in the non-production areas without having to put my street shoes back on every time. They're fine, they're just about one whole size larger than my regular street shoes (Asics and New Balance) which makes them awkward to wear. I might spring for another pair for beach shoes, as they do slip on and off nicely and they're comfortable to walk in.

I only wear Crocs. This is my 5th pair in about seven years! I use them in ways they were never intended. I ran a 5k in these, hiked up Mt. Washburn, cleared heavily wooded land, etc. I am not exaggerating. I always wear Crocs. They are tough, fit comfortably, are completely waterproof, reasonably priced and look great. I get a new pair about every 14 months. That's pretty long if its the only shoe you ever wear, like I do! Love them!

The ideal user for this product is any person boy or girl who is looking for a comfortable, durable, and water resistant shoe. These shoes are perfect slide on shoes for any quick, pick up situation. Whether that be running errands, taking the dog out, or anything else. These shoes are made for all ages, come in a variety of colors and are made for both sexes.

I was hesitant to buy these for a couple of reasons.  First, they're...you know--rubber? Plastic? Something like that...  Second, they're...you know--not masculine? Kind of sissified? Finally, the picture makes them look flimsy. So okay. Yes--they are some kind of man-made rubber/plastic/neoprene/something, but that makes them waterproof meaning you can leave them out on the deck after you've been working in the yard and you don't have to worry about them getting soggy and ruined. No--they're not the most masculine shoes I've ever seen, so you have to be pretty confident in your manhood if you wear them out on the town but I got them for yard work which is a fairly macho enterprise. And no, they're not as flimsy as the pictures look. I don't know how long that heel-strap thing will last, but I don't use it half the time anyway and for some reason, your feet don't slip out of the shoes without it, so if it does break--Super Glue and duct tape. THEN they'll look masculine!

In south GA, winter lawns can get soggy. These plastic shoes allow for outdoor time keeping my feet dry from wet grass and aired out via breeze holes. Very sturdy and durable, i have even walked the dogs with them and they are comfortable after a mile walk. We have a section of the yard that floods, requiring me to set up a pump system to drain water. These shoes stay on my feet as i wade the waters to place the pump in the center. They are easy to walk in thru the water.

I've never tried Crocs until last week. Always wore thong sandals out around the house, when I was too lazy to put on real shoes/sandals. These are easy to slide into...are pretty darn comfortable...fit is good! I wear an 11EE shoe, with a high instep. My foot actually measures 10.5, but 11 fits better. I would say this fits true to size (unisex mens 11). I probably have 1/2" of space at the heel....which is fine. Plenty of room in the shoe. Came in a Croc bag with their tags on the shoe....so they seem to be authentic. I would recommend!

When I took these out of the package I noticed a tag that said “Roomy Fit”. I had not seen that on my other pairs (I have about six pairs that I wear in place of going barefoot). Hey, I really like the extra room. They are wider and seem to have a little more room around toes as well.  I like the khaki color a lot. Like all crocs, these are comfortable and tough. I have already ordered a pair in “denim”.

So I was the guy saying "No! Never doing Crocks!" I will tell you man I love those things! They are so comfortable and great for camping and trips. Wear them with socks when its cold and not when its hot. Water? Dew on the ground? NO Problem... Don't get me wrong, Flip-Flops have a huge place in my heart but I just took my crocks on a 7700 mile motorcycle camping trip and I was so happy I had them. They were a great component to what I needed to be comfortable. Just give them a try but just don't start wearing them to work. Just not acceptable..

I wore these at least once a day for 9 months on my last military deployment. I highly recommend them if you need "shower shoes." I wore these in the shower, in my berthing, and even walking through the Kuwaiti desert to get to the bathroom. They've been folded, smushed, and packed multiple times in my pack and they don't seem to show any signs of breaking. One thing a lot of people might not realize is that they're thicker than regular flip flops and will protect your feet from bacteria better. I seriously think everyone should use these instead of those cheap, black $1 flip flops you get at the PX. I wear a size 11 in most footwear, but these were maybe a half size too big. I didn't really mind this because they were easy to slip on and off.

I ordered a size smaller than usual based on the reviews, and the shoe was still too wide and big. These are not like the old Crocs. The material is hard, the little bumps on the sole are no longer large enough to massage your feet when walking, and there is no arch support. I don't know what has happened, but don't waste your money on these if you want a comfortable shoe.

I have ordered the Unisex Crocs from Amazon before and this Pepper red one looks just like the tan pair that I have and both were made in Mexico. But this pair is slightly smaller and the arch support does not appear to be the same as in my older pair.  I love the color as it was exactly what I was looking for, but I do think the size it a bit smaller that my old ones.  I can wear these (7w/5m) but would have liked the slightly larger size better.

I was never a fan of the look. I bought some for boat shoes. I am a fan now. Pretty comfortable and easy to slip on when needed. However, I left mine in the sun one afternoon and the fit completely changed. No longer comfortable on my feet. So caution everyone, the sun will shrink them! This wasn't dashboard, summer heat, nor Arizona searing exposure, just Wyoming summer afternoon. These are priced more affordably now too, so that helps.

Almost all my Crocs come from AMazon. They fit perfect, arrive in good timing and wear well. All my present Crocs are 5 to six years old and still fiting fine! Easy to wash off non - fading what more can I say?  Still have two more pair I want. For coming year.  The hot chili peppers print and yellow omes.btw mine are womens9 which are a men's 7..  Crotcs and Amazon are both great companies!!!

I wear a 7 women's and ordered this size however, the fit was too large width and length wise.  Had to return it and ended up ordering the same size from a different Crocs order (not sure why there was a difference if it's the same size but will place the link for the one I finally got that fit as expected per size).  When I ordered a size 6 in these, it seemed to fit well but soon after I realized it was too small and was actually pinching the small toes.  These crocs are suppose to fit roomy.

I bought these shoes for work. Let me start by saying that these are the first pair of Crocs that I've ever owned. They were delivered right on time and I was anxious to put them on.
