I can't lie, I was a little put off by the appearance. Big, bulky, clownish looking shoes. That all went away by the time I put them on my feet. It felt as though I was walking on water. I usually come home limping from work from standing on my feet for 8 hours, but these give me just enough support and cushion to where my feet feel fine after a long days work. They are also a breeze to clean. My feet sweat heavily and this was a major problem when wearing sneakers. I could never quite get the smell out of them. With Crocs, all it takes is a wet cleaning wipe and these babies are like brand new. They are surprisingly lightweight, comfortable, and I'm even starting to like the way they look (lol) I plan on buying more in different colors in the near future.

These are great and so comfortable.  I wear them to walk the dog through the wet grass and I don't slip and my feet stay dry.  I purchased the khaki and they fit perfectly (I wear a 7.5 or 8 shoe and bought the crocs in an 8).

They must have changed Crocs which is not a good thing. The last 2 pair I have bought have run smaller although I'm ordering the same size as always and the material is harder and they are No Where near as comfortable as they used to be. This is distressing since I depended on the comfort. I WON'T be purchasing again. Only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because the color was correct.
i ordered several crocs (diff styles) - all clogs

wear crocs all day home and when out, they are the only shoe I can wear w neuropathy in feet and plantar fasciitis in "my left foot."  easy to clean and last for years.  I find the inside nubs that "massage" the feet wear down over time-  so I reorder every few years for the massaging effect these provide - a great shoe that a nurse in an ER w similar problems  turned me onto 6yrs ago.  they do run a little big,  so the W12/ M10 size fits my  10.5W foot.  last pair bot 12/2016 was a little more narrow than previous pairs .. overall great shoe and value.

These are terrible Crocs. The heals are so low, they won't stay on my feet. I am returning these for a refund. I further asked the manufacturer, Crocs, to recommend a version of their shoes that would match the ones I have. While they were very responsive, they we not able to recommend the correct model, even after I sent them pictures of my current Crocs. I had to do my own research to find a comparable style/version.

These shoes are huge for their size.  We ordered 10s at first and they were gigantic and had to be returned.  Downsized to 9s and they are still at least 1 size too long, and kinda loose height and width wise.  If you plan to wear without socks the. Order 2 sizes smaller unless you have a really wide, thick foot.  Upsides are that they are lightweight and comfortable if you order the right size

I may like these even better once I get used to them. This is my first pair of Crocs, and so far they are just what I needed. The sizing assistance was very helpful and appreciated. Since I need a wider size, I was directed to order the Unisex men's size, and it worked!  They are "roomy" and not "somewhat large".

Bought these to wear to my part time job working at a pool. I wore flip flops for the first few weeks and everything hurt. A coworker recommended Crocs and I'm so glad I listened to her. They are super comfy and allow me to move quickly on the pool deck when I need to.

XXX wide feet, widened even more by bunions, RA and three bone-fusing surgeries.  I've been paying big $$$ for Drew shoes and orthotics and lost the ability to walk barefoot at all.  Wearing there the last three weeks I have increased my activity, lowered my pain and foot cramps, and felt my toes spread to their natural width and length.  I also have high arches, and tend to develop bone spurs on the top of the midfoot (Danskos HURT!), but my feet still feel great in these crocs.  Only the classics fit this well.  Buying 3 more.

This is a great price for crocs. I bought a pair of these when I didn't have comfortable shoes with me while visiting family and they were so great that when I got home I ordered a pair on Amazon for home. They're a comfortable shoe for taking walks, and when I happened to be without lake shoes one day, I used them in the lake when I was swimming with my toddlers. They were excellent lake shoes.

I love these shoes. I work 12 hour night shifts at an assisted living facility, so I'm on my feet a lot. I've bought expensive shoes in the past which were not as comfy as these. And best of all, my feet no longer sweat. In other shoes my feet would sweat which would make them cold (not good in Wisconsin winters). Not so with these. Definitely will order more.

I love these for winter shoes. I get overheated easily but I can wear them without socks in the winter so I can tolerate visiting places that are too warm for my comfort. I could wear socks if needed but for me in Florida in the winter I haven’t needed to. I like the classics because I have very wide feet. The color is a neutral type of blue that goes with a lot of things.
I've had to recant all the insults I've leveled at friends for wearing crocs in public...  They are super comfortable.

Probably my fault, as my other pair fits perfectly, as I think that one is more like size 8.5 mens. I ordered the new ones in size 9, not remembering that I don't wear socks with Crocs, so the 8.5 would have been perfect. Next time I order them I will remember this! Other than that, my old pair of Crocs (which I still wear) are holding up extremely well and are super-comfortable. I am impressed!

My husband, who swore to never own a pair of crocs, thinks these are the greatest shoe EVER.  He can quickly slip them on to go outside or run a quick errand.  I ordered the khaki so they would go with pretty much anything.  Overall, he loves the comfort and convenience and I cannot imagine this will be his last pair.  He wears a size 13 and they fit true to size.

Comfortable to wear all day.. We have several pairs in our family!  Some seem to run a little large...but not so much to pose a problem.  My hubby has narrower feet, so a little wide, but not sloppy feeling.  I have wide feet and mine always fit fine.  Slight arch support, probably enough for most people... I have plantar fasciitis - so no, not enough arch support for me, I wear an arch pad in all my softer shoes...  Wear in yard, on dock, around town etc...  Do watch..as heel tread wears off, can be a bit slick when walking on wet wood or metal docks...(time to buy new ones, as with most shoes/sneakers).

I have worn Crocs for over 10 years and as my aging feet have gotten tired of uncomfortable shoes the Crocs have been a blessing.  I do make sure I check the tread because it does wear down and can be an issue on slippery surfaces.  I have also gotten Crocs for my sister who has Parkinson Disease and it has increased the surface area of her step to make walking easier.  I will definitely continue to order Crocs as needed.

My daughter & grandajghters have worn these for "years", but I was reluctant because of the ribbing on the inside and I thought they were plastic-----WELL, let me say I was so wrong.  These are the most comfortable shoes I have worn, except for my berkies ( but they take time to start fitting  right ). But these fit immediately AND my daughter said that she throws hers in  with clothes in the washer.  How nice ! I love these and they arrived on time.  So, what's not to like ?

My kids live in Crocs since they were little, mainly because it doesn't matter what you encounter throughout the day, these shoes can handle it. Mud, sand, water, rocks, grass - you name it. Every season too, even winter, because we don't wear shoes in the house and they're great for the garage or unfinished basement since they're easy to slip on and off. I never have to say, "Hey, don't get your shoes wet!" or "Stay out of the sand!" Just be aware that they WILL shrink if you leave them in the sun for more than a few hours.

Don't know where they are made but they are made properly as a size 15 D.  I had to return a set of sandals marketed from Great Britain that were way too narrow.  It is a pleasure to get shoes that were made to the proper size, as per the way they are labeled.  These shoes are very comfortable and I am very pleased.  I had a hard time finding Crocs in my size.  They aren't sold in the regular shoe stores and many online shoe stores have a very limited selection of 15 D shoes, as well.  Now if they will just be strong and hold up for a while.  I'll update if they self destruct to early in life.

I love the Cayman croc.  They look the same as the regular croc but are much softer and comfortable.  The difference is amazing!  Of course, they still don't last more than a few months before the soles are smooth and slippery.  But they are so comfortable to wear!  At least until you slip and fall and break your body!  If the soles lasted longer, I would give them 10 stars!

Good except fits small.  I have other Crocs shoes that are size 7 and they fit way looser.  These fiot more like a 6 I have to push the ankle strap forward on these size 7 Crocs in order to feel more comfortable  They are a bit short.  i like the color its cool looking but I think the Baya Croc clogs are sturdier and better quality and the 7 fits way looser in that style.  The material on this Croc is softer than the Baya so not as sturdy for outdoor walking etc.  in my opinion.

I have wide feet and these are medium width, so they are a tad snug width-wise. But for me it's not uncomfortable. I've had many pairs of Crocs over the years and know the feel. These are typical. I wear Crocs until the treads are worn off then get a replacement pair (worn down Crocs are dangerously slippery on wet surfaces).

The materials used in the new made in mexico classic crocs mule is awful! plastic slippery, no give uncomfortable unlike the origianals that ive had for years made of rubblery materialin usa & boulder which are comfortabell have give and dont slip when walking . i will not purchase any more crocs until you go back to the origianl materials.

It's about the ease of donning & doffing and general comfort. It's not about any aesthetic appeal, which it is perhaps not particularly high on. I found my first pair (of the original Crocs--new in box) while dumpster diving several years ago. I brought them home to show my wife just how absurd a pair of shoes can look. For a lark, I tried them on and--what do you know? Those goofy-looking shoes were extremely comfortable! I have worn them near daily ever since. Interestingly, after they started getting popular and appearing on lots of other people's feet, they stopped looking quite so goofy.

My orthopedist diagnosed me with a severely bruised heel bone and nothing he told me to try was working.  Crocs work.  I have 3 pairs of them now and they're the only shoes I can stand to wear at the moment, but they're actually letting my heel bone heal up unlike everything else I'd been trying.  Yay for Crocs!  I still think they're ugly as homemade sin and they make my feet sweat and stink, but at least my heel is getting better!

When in doubt, I went with the loudest possible color I could find for these. They are a bright pink! These are unattractive in my opinion, but comfortable. They're slowly growing on me. I like the adjustable strap so you can wear it as a mule as well. I used the "custom" size helper and it suggested a nine. They are about a half size too big. My toes can wiggle freely in the top with a medium-thin/thick sock on. I may order another pair in the 8 women's. I have read that there is a difference in sizing if it is made in Mexico or China. Mine state "made in Italy", so I guess that's another place these are manufactured, if this helps.

These things are so ugly and so comfortable. They are the perfect dad summer shoe. My kids are always telling me how cringy I am because I wear them, so naturally I wear them a LOT. They cause them to be completely embarrassed of me, but I don't care because it's like walking on squishy foamy goodness. You should get some, find the worst color possible, and wear them to your children's next party. They will avoid you like the plague and you'll get some nice peace and quiet. :-)

These are what you expect; waterproof, easy to clean and pretty darn comfortable. Great for yard work, gardening and for slipping on and off when you need quick foot ware. In other words, shoes when you're too lazy to put on regular shoes. Better than flip flops when you need some tootsie protection.

... and counting.  Years ago, when I got my first pair of Crocs, I was dubious and totally unconvinced they'd live up to expectations.  Boy, was I mistaken!  Today, I have a pair of originals for warm-weather outdoor use, and another no-holes, fuzzy-lined pair for cold-weather outdoor use.  These are replacements for a worn-out indoor-only pair.  Crocs have essentially become my go-to house slipper and, used with a pair of plush socks, provide daylong comfort.  The arch support is superb and when I'm at the workbench, standing on a bare, concrete floor, my feet are happy!

This really was a bummer. The sizing isn't consistent. I had purchased other Crocs with the Classic clog fit and fit well. This pair ran small and the straps did look a little short that it made my feet roll to the tips of the clogs. I had a much better experience with the Crocs Unisex Specialist Vent Clog. They have a more relaxed fit and the straps neither too short or long.

Crocs are ugly. We all know it. Nobody buys crocs to be a fashion icon (I hope). This aside, they're a good utilitarian shoe. My husband has to wear close-toed shoes to his work, and tennis shoes were killing his feet (they're big and not made to fit inside confining shoes ha).

I really didn't think I'd ever own a pair of Crocs let alone write a positive review about them! I bought a pair at my wife's urging because I have some foot problems...achy feet, plantar fasciitis, etc. The Crocs are incredibly comfortable to wear and bring immediate comfort and relief when I wear them. I have them next to my bed and slip them on first thing in the morning. I normally wear a size 13...when I get another pair I will be getting them in a size 12. The 13's are a little long and wide...not a problem, but I think I'll go one size smaller next time (and there WILL be a next time!)

I love these and wear them a lot. They have the typical Croc roomy fit which feels almost like you're barefoot.  You think that they would come off your foot when you walk but they don't.  They feel sort of gel-like on your feet with their cushiony rubber. I really like the option of using the heel strap or flipping it up so you can slip in and out of them easily, like slippers.  You get used to their quirky appearance, if not, get one of the more traditional looking models. I have three different styles which I wear exclusively as casual shoes.

I had always thought Crocs were rather unattractive shoes and didn't understand how and why people would wear them. Then I retired, bought a power washer, and badly needed some outdoor shoes that could handle the water and still give me the traction to push the mower. (I did NOT want to get my nice athletic shoes all wet and green from the grass.) A shoe store associate directed me to the Croc. I knew the Croc was a wider shoe and only came in whole sizes. So I ordered an 8 even though I wear an 8.5. This shoe fit my wide feet perfectly and was very comfortable. I love, love, love that I don't have to worry about getting dirt, water, soap, grass stains, etc. on these shoes because I can just wash them off with the hose. In the meantime, my athletic shoes stay in pristine condition. THEN, I started wearing the Crocs around the house while cleaning and running up and down the stairs doing laundry. I am even considering wearing them when I run to the grocery store or gym!! Another bonus is that these shoes come in a variety of attractive colors,

There's something about these Crocs that are just different than the pair I had a few years ago. It might be the little knobs in the footbed or something, but they're just not as comfortable out of the package like my first pair. Plus, they're just slightly more narrow. Not so much that it's a problem, and they do give more with time, but it's noticeable. At least to me. I'd probably give this more like 3.5/5 than a 3. I'll kick around in them every now and again I'm sure.

Finally gave in, and I love them -- I have resisted crocs for many years, because they look, to be brutal, stupid.  But we spend the winter on the beach, and I got tired of ruining at least two pairs of white sandals a year by getting them wet when I was totally sure I wouldn't.  So: crocs.  The reviews left me frightened of mis-sizing, so I shot an arrow in the air and ordered an eight, which fits perfectly.  They are comfortable on the beach, comfortable around the house, and comfortable when we go out on errands.  Mine are white, and they have stayed dazzlingly clean looking.  On the downside, they do accumulate debris, and the do look -- stupid.  But noone is asking me to wear them on Madison Avenue, and for a beach community, they are just great.

For the longest time, I used to make fun of Crocs. Not sure why. Maybe it was my immaturity at the time. But something finally snapped and I decided to give them a try because of the sale Amazon had on them.

It's official, I hate crocs. Granted I wear a half size, and Crocs only come in full sizes. But the tow width is cavernous and the arch over the foot is wicked high, rendering walking in them awkward and painful if used to walk significant distances. If you're looking for a practical comfortable shoe that isn't hideously ugly, these aren't for you.
My first Crocs! I have never worn Crocs because I thought they were the ugliest shoes ever. I still think that, lol.

Had to return. My husband has worn Crocs for years in a size 10m/12w but this pair in the same size was significantly smaller. His toes hit on the end and comparing then to his old ones, these were probably 1/2" or more shorter and narrower. Also noted, on the bottom of these new ones, is printed made in Mexico, where the old ones show "boulder colorado." Very disappointing. Would not recommend.
and then the plastic piece broke... for no apparent reason. I'm wondering if Crocs stands behind their product, if we attempt to send them back to them directly...??

I spend 40 hours a week on my feet on concrete floors. And I walk a lot. I have a very difficult time finding shoes that I don't ache to take off before a couple hours have past. I have wide feet, tall feet, and have a heel lift I wear in my left shoe (which creates its own shoe criteria). I need slip resistant ventilated shoes. These classic crocs fit the bill. I will always be wearing these with socks. They are wide enough for my feet, tall enough for my instep (even with the heel lift) and are quite comfortable to wear all shift. These are not fashion shoes and I don't expect them to be that, but for all the rest of the times, these will be the shoes I wear. My only caution would be that these shoes have little cushion. The rubber does have some give but it is not the same as a well padded shoe. For me this is acceptable because they don't hurt my feet to wear. Other's may find that to be a turn off.
Good buy. Shipped promptly. Thanks.

The first pair had the heel loop come off. The plastic part which secures the loop to the shoe came off. Luckily this was after just 5 minutes. Check this part first before wearing it outside. Other than that the second pair arrived and seems to work well. This are my first Crocs so we will see how much I like them as time goes by. Note - I usually wear a Wide shoe and the 11 M seem a bit tight when I wear socks. The similar Crocs offered on the Crocs website say that they are roomy, but I beg to differ and these same shoes don't seem to be.You might try a larger size if you have a wide foot. Note - if I don't wear socks the Crocs are fine - so I guess it depends on how you are going to wear these. If you plan to wear them with socks, get a larger size. On the beach, these would be perfect for me.

I find Crocs clogs so comfortable for anytime when I'm doing a lot of walking.  The only complaint I've had with Crocs is the inconsistency of the sizing.  This time, I was lucky and chose a size larger - thanks to those who reviewed this shoe.  They for perfectly.  I like to wear these with socks for the cold Arizona winters and these will be great.  (I normally wear a size 7.5 shoe and chose the size 8.....a size 7 would've been too small)  I have about 15 pairs of Crocs.....and 4 are the clogs of different. colors.

Ok to be honest I had never worn this type of shoe and was told each style although doesnt look much different they all fit differently. So, I ordered these and another style/comfort. For me the others fit just a little better. But there is absolutely nothing wrong with this style. I loved the color and the fit was good but others just a little better. I would still order these again at some time. Easy return.

I love these shoes! I haven't worn them for a long period of time yet but they are comfortable. I am normally about a size 5.5 in women's but it didn't come in that size. After reading reviews that said they ran small, I gave the size 6 a try. They would probably be too small if I was actually a 6 but I was hoping they would run small. So far I love them. Although if not wearing socks, my feet do sweat in them and they kind of slip around So socks are a good choice

I purchased these Crocs Classic Clogs last Aug 2016.  I wore them through the summer and fall. They fit as expected, very comfortable.  This May I would wear them to do yard work. They became wet. I put them out in the sun to dry, like I have done with all my previous Croc clogs. After they dried I tried to put them on, to my surprise the clogs had SHRUNK. I couldn't put my forefoot into the clogs. What a disappointment!!!!
I originally bought these so that I didn't have to put on socks and shoes just to check the mail (rocky driveway). I had no idea that I would love them as much as I do.
this is a comfortable footwear.

Bought a pair of these from another source and sized up to the nearest whole size since I wear a 9 1/2. Wrong move! Fortunately, another family member could use them. Amazon to the rescue again! Ordered the size 9 I needed and got them very quickly. Very happy with the fit and comfort of the correctly sized Crocs. They are now going to put a lot of miles on in my garden.
I have Croc sandals and love them...but these shoes were not as soft as my sandals are.  Hard as a rock and did not feel good on my feet. I returned them. Very disappointed.

The crocs arrived by Christmas. I could not have the person try them on because they where a Christmas present. What I was the most disappointed about was this are crocs, the same shoes that my children wore 12-13 years ago. I didn’t see anything different about them other than they are more expensive and now they don’t fit true to size. My daughter wears a 6-7 in women’s. I bought the women’s 7 (37W) and she loved them but she is only able to wear the with the strap up. They are too small if she were to put the strap behind her foot. Disappointed based on the dozen or more I have bought through the years and she is unable to wear them both ways.

I have resisted these shoes for years! Finally tired of ruining my regular shoes by wearing them in the garden or accidentally stepping in something I should have picked up earlier, I have finally found a shoe that I can wear and wash--and is TRULY COMFORTABLE AND LIGHT. You don't really think about how light shoes are until you put Crocs on. In fact, I liked them so much I bought a second pair to wear out and about. I never thought it would happen but I am truly a Crocs lover now!

Bought these for my husband for Christmas 2018 as they were on sale very cheap and he has always wanted a pair of Crocs. I've never heard that their sizes were not true to size but my husband has small feet at a size 7 in mens and the 7 in means I ordered him were too large. He can wear them but he has to move the strap behind his foot to ensure they stay on.

Okay, so, let me get this review started off by saying I hate the way the original crocs look. I know, I know, so do a lot of people, but I really hate the way they look. I have always had large feet for a woman (10/10.5), so I really don’t like shoes that emphasize the fact that I am walking around with feet that could double as water skis at a moment’s notice.  As many of you have observed, these shoes are not very good at minimizing the appearance of the size of feet they are on.

It was suggested that I try Crocs after falling and injuring my ankle. Regular shoes hurt because of where they hit in the back of my ankle so I ordered some to give them a try. I ordered a size 8 and they fit well.  Arch support is there and they are open in the back so I actually walk more comfortably with them on.  I have also discovered that they are very comfortable on wood floors.  I have only worn them inside partly because because it's winter but really because they are kind of ugly. Think I'll keep them as "inside shoes".

These shoes are made from some strange space age material unknown to mankind before this.  Despite hiking miles upon miles through the Himalayan mountains of Afghanistan for years on end, there is so far no signs of wear.  The tactical nature of the color scheme of this pair in particular will without a doubt protect my feet from being discovered by ISIS-K or the Taliban during my trek through the Afghan arid mountains and beyond. I bought this second pair not to replace my current Crocs but to bless some random Sherpa who needs a solid shoe whom I came across during my travels.  He's a good man and helped me during a time of distress and need, this is the absolute least I could do.

This shoes are far from fashionable and I *never* wear mine outside the house but they are great comfortable footwear. They were recommended to me by my orthopedic surgeon when I was struggling with plantar fasciitis that was aggravated by the hardwood floors in our apartment. He recommended a pair of Crocs to wear as house slippers since they have great arch support.
Got these for my dad who is 89 and cannot wear regular shoes because of swelling in his feet. He loves them. Good and sturdy. Bought a smaller size and had to return the first pair. No problems.

They were NOT size 6 shoes for real. I normally wear a 5 1/2 and this size 6 was so small my feet touched the end of the shoe and NO they are not a classic clog as the classic clog has a wide front. This shoe has a narrow toe section and that also made them too small. Unfortunately, because I have moved and could not get them to the post office, I cannot send them back.
The sizing on Crocs seems rather variable. Makes it hard to shop them.

I am one of those people who swore they would never wear a pair of Crocs.  In fact I am one of those people who will still make fun of you for wearing Crocs. To me Crocs have always been the ugly step sister of the shoe world.  Never has it been so easy to say "I just don't care anymore" with your feet.

I like these shoes, got these for myself and a black pair for my husband. For both of us they are a bit large so I would say go down about half a size. We like wearing them after a shower at the gym (where flip flops for the shower) to air out or feet. Sometimes we where them at home however, they attract dog hair like nobody's business. There are people who have videos and instructions on how to remove pet hair from your carpet with these things. So on carpet and wood floor they are great for them but that is not my purpose.

if your a size 9 for men and you want a perfect fit order 10m 12w.9 for me is a little to tight and no room,a 10m is perfect.i love crocs,i need to ware something on my feet for around the house I could not find anything for this need,crocs is the perfect find,i ware these all day and night for home use.i will buy again in the future,for the value and how well they make these you cannot fail.plese crocs keep making these shoes.thanks.
The size 9/11 croc made in Mexico sold in this store, is 2 sizes smaller than the size 9/11 made and sold in US.  Same product, same numbers and big difference in size!!!

Crocs will never be the most comfortable shoes.  They are an utility shoe for those of us who like to go barefoot around the house and need something to slip on to check the mail, grab the paper, put out the trash, or brave the harsh and hateful sun long enough to yell at the little jacktard from down the street who is letting his dog crap in your petunias for the 3rd time this week.  No, we don't wear them because we love the way they feel, we wear them because they are cheap and get the job done, and aren't all furry on the outside which attracts hair from the shedding freeloading bastard laying on the couch.

I never though about getting crocs until a good friend, who hikes days at a time in Yosemite every year takes crocs with him strapped to his trekking backpack. When I went with him this year I soon realized how awesome the crocs where. Whenever we camped or stopped by a river he would switch out his shoes and socks and slip on the crocs and off he went into the stream, river, or lake with no worries of stepping on rough rocks, sticks or whatever was underneath or rocks and boulders that are above the water. I didn't have any crocs at the time so I had to walk with my bare feet if I wanted to go in. They also made great camping shoes when setting up camp and just relaxing. Needless to say I was convinced and bought some for myself and my wife. We used them on a recent overnight hiking trip. Amazing shoes!

I have had a pair of Crocs that have lasted MANY years.  These were purchased as a replacement.  Listed as the same size as my other ones, but these are smaller than my old ones - a bit shorter and quite a bit narrower.  They still fit, but much tighter so I wish I had bought one size larger.  Still a great product, you just may possibly may want to order a 1/2 or 1 size larger.
I like these very much and was surprised at the support and massage feature in the inner sole.  I have had other similar to the real things and these are higher quality.

You would think that with these shoes being made completely of rubber they would last a very long time.... not the care for me. It may have been a fluke thing but about a week in I was walking normally in my yard and my right foot glanced my left as I was stepping forward and snapped the plastic rivet that holds the strap and allows it to rotate. Now the strap is flopping all over....
I'm using these as house shoes mostly. I am supposed to always have shoes on after an injury.

I bought this for my daughter in her usual size for Christmas and it was WAY too big! I went to exchange it and the price more than doubled--I couldn't evenly exchange it so I had to return the pair I bought for $9.99 and re-purchase a new pair for $26.21! If she wasn't so excited about getting them (Her swim team wears them on the pool deck) I wouldn't buy her the new pair. I wish they offered an even exchange or explained that they didn't. Good product but bummed about being out an extra $16.

I will give these 5 stars bc they are amazing, but I want give 4.5 bc they do run small BUT ONLY BC the band makes it that way. I've always been a women's 9 in the classic fit, but I guess feet grow. I ordered a 9 and the band makes them too small, should have ordered up one size. If you wear them without the heel band than the fit is no issue.

You really need to try some of these on at a store initially,  to get a sense of what your shoe size will be. Authentic Crocs are great, comfortable and durable. Buying them through this vendor cost about half what we paid for our initial pair at a "shoe boutique". I'd recommend the Crocs and this vendor as a great combination of dependability and quality product.

I purchase these enough that the sizing is what I expected, but for the first time I ordered a different color, the Khaki, and while it looks like the photo to the left of this review, it is not the same color that is shown in the original ad so the color I received is darker than expected, more closely related to the chocolate color than the lighter color I expected.  So this review only gets three stars because of wrong coloring.
Let me start by saying one thing: I never thought I would own crocs.

they’re great for sports, just running an errand, or to an outdoor pool party. WHATEVER YOU WANT! the colored ones are great and very close to the pictures for anyone wondering (I have friends who ordered colored ones from here) but I personally got black. one thing to be careful about...if you leave them in the sun they might shrink!!!

My daughter suddenly has a Croc obsession.  She has about 7 pairs, all different colors.  She loves their fit and how comfortable they are.  She has been wearing them to school (high school) and seems to be starting a trend.  She also wears them to the softball field and in between games. (Camo is her field color)  She referred her friends to Amazon as the shipping is free AND they have a great variety AND they are cheaper than at the outlets.  I think I will even be getting a pair or 2 for Christmas...  :)  BUT WE CANNOT FIND PURPLE FOR A LOWER PRICE!  That is her high school color...  They aren't as cheap as the other colors for some reason.  :(

So my dog chewed up my old crocs (they were cheap knock offs anyway) so I decided to go w these bc I liked the color. These are awesome. Fit is good. I wear an 8 and bought an 8...they are a little rough on bare feet, but not unbearable. I'm sure to get many many years out of these...as long as I keep the dog away!!

I wanted to replace an older pair of Crocs with these, but they are not the correct size compared to the size of my last ones. I guess they are a different style and the size doesn't translate as well.  Not a fan, would rather find one like my old ones and the size that fits better (despite being the same number).

I had always heard terrible jokes about Croc's  and heard they were not comfortable. Then one of my granddaughters came over wearing a pair and told me that they were super comfortable. I checked them out, felt how cushioned they were and decided to try a pair. OMG I just LOVE LOVE LOVE  them. I have worn them every day since they got here.
I’ve had several pair of these as probably many of you have and really enjoy them.. I’ve also worn them fishing many times.

I got this particular pair for my son, and he likes to wear it. He is size 6.5 or 7, and he wears the shoes with the strap up, so they fit him very well. He outgrown several pairs of crocs over the years, and always like them.

Everyone wanted to take them from the Birthday guy. He said the fit was great. I thought they would be cheesy, but the only thing cheesy was the pkg. It came in a sucky bag that hangs open, not even resealable, no slide closure, no handles etc & Crocs deserve better. I just ordered generic slippers & they were immaculately bagged ijs.

Crocs rock!  Get them while you can, as heard they may stop making them.  They are comfortable, durable, and great especially in the summer as I use them A LOT when going to the lake or the beach.  They are also the perfect shoe to wear when flying as they are so easy to take off for airport screening.  Get them now.  :-)

These crocs were for a gift for a friend.  She wears 6 1/2 normally and reviews said they run a little big.  I ordered size 6 for her and they are perfect.  She had never owned crocs before and she says that she lives in them now and wants to order some for her husband.  Good gift choice!
I just wish they were a little bit darker up in Evergreen color. Otherwise they’re your typical Crocs.

Probably the ugliest shoes I've ever worn but the most comfortable. I was starting to get hip problems walking on my wood floors so I tried to find something I could wear indoors. I got a lot of recommendations for the Crocs, I figured it wouldn't hurt to give them a shot since I'd be wearing them only inside the house. They were so comfortable I've been wearing them outside while walking the dogs and to the grocery store. I definitely wouldn't wear them for anything besides that though lol.

There seems to have been a cut-off when production was moved from one country to another where the molds changed.  My first pairs were just L.  Now they are trying to base it on the shoe size.  I wear a 10.5 normally.  When I ordered the 11, they were 1-1.5 inches too long.  I had to send those back to get the 10.  Now these are a little short and rub against my heel.  I'm so bummed that I can't find the size I had before since I wore those so much I literally wore holes in the bottoms and had to replace them.  The good news is that they are wide enough for my foot.  (All sizes mentioned are women's)  I don't love these as much anymore mostly due to the sizing- but if you can get them in the right size you will love them.

Okay, I just got my first real pair of crocs.  I've been wearing knock-offs for years and have been trying to find more of that brand, but to no avail, so I went with the crocs.  They are rock hard and the soles have little tiny spikes that are not so pleasant!  I wear size 7 1/2, but decided I wanted them a little roomy, so I went with size 8-9 and was surprised that my feet barely fit in them.  I'm dearly hoping they break in because they are really hard and tight on the top.  At least they are super wide (and I have REALLY wide feet, so that's saying a lot!).  Just had to put in my two cents.

I absolutely love crocs. They're so lightweight and they are the easiest shoes to wear during the summer as either just a casual shoe or if you need shoes that are waterproof for the pool or by the lake. The only problem I saw was the Neon Magenta color was much more purple in the picture than what I received. But I love the color either way!

I bought these shoes to clean up after my 2 two big dogs in my back yard because the shoes looked like they can be hosed-off easily (for obvious reasons). But once I put them on I realized that these were going to be permanent my walking-about-the-house shoes and I would need to find some other shoes for cleaning up outside. I just love the comfort and convenience. Likely I will be buying these again.

I don’t care that people think Crocs are ugly. This is my second pair, which I bought because the first pair were practically indestructible as well as being extremely comfortable. The only downside for me is that they can make your feet hot and sweaty if you wear them for too long. You could wear socks with them, but for the love of God, don’t do that out of the house.

I have been a fan of Crocs for a very long time. While they are not the most attractive shoe ever, you just can't beat the comfort. I have some issues with foot pain, and my Crocs are the only shoe I have found that completely alleviate the pain. I have tried quite a few of the styles over the years, but this was the first time I have tried the clogs. They are a little snug around the tops of my feet because of my extremely high arches, but I got used to it pretty fast. I wear these almost constantly and i am very happy with them.

The shoes themselves are fine hence the 3 stars BUT I started with a black pair of size 11 taking a gamble because I wear an 11.5 in all my shoes. They were so large they looked like 13's on my feet. So I thought okay I will return these and get a size 10 which at the time was not available in black just in orange (for colors I liked) so I got them today and my foot barely fits in the shoe my toes are jammed into the front rendering them unwearable. So back they go, not trying a third time.

So easy.  I have a 3-year old and a 4-year old.  They are crocs, so they are not stylish.  But I often find myself getting the kids ready to go, and then one wants to be picked up after I have them ready and before I can put my shoes on.  That guarantees I'm wearing the crocs, as they just slide on so easily and therefore I can just step into them while holding one or two children, which I couldn't do with sneakers.  Extremely comfortable, and just wear them out of necessity.

I bought these for my husband to use while moving irrigation pipes in tall grass fields.  The seeds don't stick to them like they did to his regular shoes.  They can be washed off easily.  The reason for one less star is that he wears a 9 1/2 shoe and these don't come in half sizes so I ordered a size 10 and they are a little large.  But they still work well and he hasn't had a problem with them falling off.  It would be great if Crocs would make half sizes for all.

I had tried 2 other plastic type clogs and they didn't work well for me at all.  These Crocs do.  They don't push down on the tops of my feet.  They are comfortably roomy but stay on my feet fine.  And they provide some cushioning and support for soles of feet, which I need.  I am very happy with them and will order more when these start to wear out.

My old crocs have lasted about 7 years and were starting to look a little ratty, so I decided to get a new pair, exactly the same but a different color.  I just wish there had been more color options available in my size, but that's ok.  For an old hippie who would prefer to go barefoot, these crocs are perfect, like no shoes on at all.  My old ones are still in good shape, so now they are just for around the house, my new ones are my "dress crocs" for going to town!

bought these for my 17 year old daughter who really likes crocs.. she loves them.. so that's what matters!  I think the fit is about right. but it was a little bit different than a different pair of crocs she has.. her black ones that I bought at the store are a womens 8 so I ordered that in the white and they were way to huge.. and bigger than her black ones. so we sent them back and got her the womens size 7 and they fit her perfectly..

This is my second pair. My first pair is maybe 8 or 9 years old. I'm not replacing pair #1 I just got tired of having to come in after working in the yard all day and having to wash the dirt off of them before I went somewhere. Now I just change into my new pair. At the rate pair #1 is going I should not have to buy a new pair for maybe 10 more years. F I live that long!

My wife loved the shoes but they were smaller than she thought they would be. She has other shoes the same size that fit her well. Hated to return them. I gave them 5 stars because they were as advertized. Under normal circumstance, she may have been able to "break them in" by wearing for a while. She has sever neuropathy from chemo and the shoes cannot be tight because of the pain. Amazon was great to work with us with the return.

My daughter has worn crocs for 4 years in a row. I buy one new pair a year, one size up. This year apparently the shoe manufacturing changed because the next size up was in fact an entire size smaller than what she wore last year. Attached is a photo. She wore a 7, I bought an 8, it is smaller in length and width than the 7.

I've had these crocs for 2 years now and I still wear them around when running errands etc.  it may not be the most glamorous thing but it sure is comfortable.  These crocs are so durable.  If I had a pair of regular flip flops, I would be on at least my 5th or 6th pair. This crocs have paid for themselves many times over.  I've worn them walking over rocks, stones, in showers, in the house, to the store, camping EVERYTHING.  I loved these things so much I bought a pair for my husband in the REALTREE camouflage and he now likes his. (Plus his old flip flops where there is material really starts to stink when he's walking around so crocs don't smell) Hint hint ladies, buy these for your husbands as well! :)
I wasn't allowed to have Crocs as a kid (my mom thought they were ugly) so I always wanted some as an adult.
I can't believe I actually have a pair of these odd looking shoes. Trust me. If you garden these are fabulous! I love them.

You don't wear Crocs for a fashion statement.  Well, maybe in some places, but not most places.  They're the flip-flops of the regular shoe community.  So easy to slip on.  So easy to wash off.  When my kids were little, they were "big kid" shoes they could put on themselves.  Now all of my big kids have a pair right outside the backdoor.  Slip them on to do everything year round (we live in Arizona.)  So far nobody has ever accidentally stepped in dog poo, but it could happen and if it did - easily washable.  They wore these shoes at at sleepaway camp for everything from showers to fishing to hiking.  They're durable.  Over the last 6+ years we've owned MANY pairs of Crocs brand originals and think they're all fantastic.

Shoes fit well, and I believe are helping my heel spurs. The only problem I have is that they have a series of small protrusions over the entire sole of the shoe.  For me it causes considerable discomfort.  Maybe I just have sensitive feet, but I almost can't wear them.  Socks help and time wearing them does too.  Because of the low price I wouldn't send them back.  Again, it might just be my sensitive feet. I guess I'm just disappointed and expected they'd be like wearing pillows on my feet. After thinking about it and looking at other reviews, I've decided to take away a star.  Not that it matters much.

I love Crocs and had a pair I had worn out so I bought this pair.  When they arrived I couldn't get my foot in them.  After double checking, the old ones were made in Mexico and these are made in Viet Nam.  The return and reorder was seamless, but if I were to order again I would go up 2 sizes instead one 1.  These pair I ended up with seemed a little more narrow but I'm hoping to stretch them out!

Love them.  Because of a botched surgery, my foot is deformed and I cannot wear normal shoes. I lived in Crocs for a long time.  I've been unable to walk without assistance for a long time, and it occurred to me that I needed to replace them, but the pair I had was purple, and it matched a lot of things in my world, clothes, my car! So I just knew that I had to replace them. I couldn't even read the size on the bottom they were so worn.  I couldn't find them in the size I needed due to swelling in my feet so I had to order a larger size.  Luckily they were available in my second favorite color.  I'm walking so much better!  Happy Mother's Day to me!

Very comfortable clog.  However, the turquoise croc (Item # 10001-440) shown in the amazon.com online picture here more accurately depicts what the Electric  Blue Classic Croc clog (Item #10001-404) looks like in person.  I know because I now own both colors.  I had purchased these turquoise crocs for my husband and I.  We ended up keeping the turquoise crocs from amazon.com which are a darker blue green color than shown in the picture.  I fortunately found the two pairs of "Electric Blue" crocs that I was originally trying to find in the size needed (USA Size: M8/W10) on another website.  I had to pay a lot more than I would have liked (bought them internationally). The international shipping cost was $45 alone and was more than the cost of 2 pairs of crocs!  Happy to have found the electric blue classic Croc in size M8/W10 because this color has now been discontinued.  Attached is a photo of the 2 colors:
My husband wears Crocs all year now.  Lined ones in the winter.  He hates flip flops and loves that you can just slip them on and off!
I had to return it as it did not fit right.

Super comfortable and lightweight. I normally wear between an 8-9, and purchased the 8 after reading the details saying they are made to be very roomy. I planned to wear them without the strap, so they were perfect. I think I would've needed a 9 if I wanted to wear them comfortably with the strap or thick socks. Sadly, my cats got ahold of them a couple hours after they got delivered 😭 so I won't get a chance to see how they feel worn in.

My husband needed some shoes to slip on when our dog needed to potty or take a stroll in our neighborhood.  It's a task to even find shoes to fit his large feet. I ordered the size he wears and they fit just fine.  Helpful, honest, informed comments are the path to purchases.

I bought these shoes for my daughter to wear to the beach and pool!  She loves her Crocs!  The color, size, everything.  They're super comfortable. They're the perfect shoes to wear to an amusement park or water park.  Truthfully, they're not very stylish, but they are very comfortable.  I'm at the point in my life where I choose practicality over style sometimes!  As ugly as these shoes are, I think I'm going to myself a pair for the beach too.

I had crocs a long time ago and they must have been too big because I didn't enjoy them as much. Maybe the sizing has changed because I absolutely love them. Definitely size your feet as i did and they fit perfectly. I wanted something I could quickly slip on around the campsite getting in and out of my tent. It's cold out so I am actually using them around the house and they are so comfy!

Excellent price (I scored a great holiday deal).  Exactly what my daughter wanted.  Minimal packaging in shipping, i.e. no shoe box and then the shipping container.  These were just in plastic bags and then the outer shipping box.  No big deal to me but if they were a gift, you'll need to plan for that.

I've had a couple pair of Crocs.  Previous pair was a little big and sloppy.  I ordered the next size smaller and these are a bit too tight.  I could slip on the larger ones without touching them and they'd stay on most of the time with the strap slipping into place.  The smaller ones require a quick finger to pull the strap and then they're a little too tight at the toes.  I wish they made half sizes, but I just fall between that jump in size.  Otherwise, they're good as a slipper and a deck shoe.  They require no care and last a long time.

Great comfort in these Crocs!  I don't wear them a lot because I have custom orthotics but when I do (evening for about 15 minutes) I'm in heaven.  I ordered a size 8 and have a wide foot. These shoes let my foot spread out comfortably even more than my shoes with orthotics.  Since I have foot issues, I checked these out on lots of shoe review pages and Web MD as well.  They are highly rated for comfort and fit although I think I would need more support for a 2 mile walk.

These are so comfortable.  I said that they do not have good arch support, but I have an extremely high arch and I don't feel it if it's there.  The shoes are contured and someone with a lesser arch may feel the support.  I can wear them all day w/ or w/out socks.  They are also extremely light-weight and that is a bonus!  I have now purchased a pair for my husband which he loves and wears all day too.  I have also purchased two more as gifts... want to share the comfort!  I definitely recommend and they do not run in 1/2 sized... I am at least an 8.5 and usually a 9 and the 8 fits me perfectly.  Hope this helps.

No matter the stigma about Crocs, they don’t make a more comfortable shoe. As a big man with size 13-14 shoes depending on the brand, these have been great for work. I spend 13 hours, most of them on my feet, as a nurse, and have yet to come home with my “dogs barking” since wearing these. Yes, I’ve gotten a couple jokes about my styling, but I always counter with how comfortable and functional they are. Also, bedside nurses: when you get some body fluids on your Nikes or leather clogs, you probably can’t just hose them off, eh?
I knew what size to order because I bought a pair locally, so the ones from amazon fit perfectly. My old ones looked too shabby to wear away from home. I wish you had BEIGE/TAN in my size...

I love the Tropical Teal color of my replacement Crocs - very dramatic. I wear a size 8 and the Crocs size M6/W8 fits perfectly. I can wear with or w/o socks (which I'll wear with my Crocs around the house when the weather gets cold). I have both Achilles' and plantar facia pain and the Crocs give my sore feet a break. They last a long time, too - years.

Sadley Crocs only makes this Classic style in the really cool colors.  For me, the classic is not a proper duty shoe.  Its great for me to do food shopping in. Quick errands. Not for seven or eight hours on my feet. They make great house shoes because it offers support and protection of toes when walking in the dark.

I wear these clogs to work, at home, to the store, etc.  They are comfortable and lightweight. They survive weekly washing in hot water and color has not faded. I bought these in several different colors. My only complaint (really not a complaint), is that the shoe has several openings, so if I go outside to sweep my porch the dust will get into the shoe and under my feet. For this reason I also wear a lightweight pair of socks.
I bought these while I was in the hospital recovering from an ATV accident. I was at the beach with my family and friends and had to be life flighted, in the process - my shoes were forgotten.

I where these every single day to school, these are literally the most comfortable shoes I have EVER owned. I bought a pair for my brother too, and  he loves them, he also wears them everyday to college. And if you wanna be cool, go with the white crocs. They honestly look fantastic and are comfortable. I will definitely buy these again in the future. Like seriously, BUY WHITE CROCS. I promise you, you will love them. Just don't get the wrong size like I did (I sold them to my brother so it's all good, he liked them that much). I tell everyone to buy them, including my math teacher.

I was used to purchasing Crocs in the "from-to" size range ( 9-10, etc.) so the size setup on these was a bit strange for me. The shoes are fine and I should be able to wear them for quite some time with no problem, but they are a wee bit narrower than my other crocs and since my feet tend to swell a bit in hot weather the narrower width might be a problem. Don't know yet. Otherwise the shoes are great--lovely color (Khaki) is a perfect neutral.

I got my pair in mid April of this year, and have worn them over the summer, and now, just past the 90-day period for the warranty, all of a sudden, I can't fit my feet into them. They shrunk! They seriously shrunk from a size 10 to like a size 6!!!! Looks like I'm out some shoes, and the neighbor girl just got some new play shoes. Don't buy!

I got these on sale as I've always heard about Crocs but never wanted to pay a lot for them.  Overall, I like these for gardening and doing things outside.  I'm a 9 1/2 and sized up to a 10 but they definitely run roomy and big.  I should have gotten a 9.  Make sure to size down if you're a half size.

First off I just wanna say that I think Crocs are amazing and super comfy. I'm a 28 year old male and recently found out from peers my age that these "are for old people" or "hospital workers". I replied with "what...?" haha. I honestly don't care if people want to rag on me for wearing these... they are so comfy and I think they look dope! They fit perfect and I have wide feet and 10" size.

The color (khaki) is not great, but that was what was available when I ordered. These are for in the house, so who cares? These are replacements for some Crocs I have had over five years. Hard to tell when they wear out, but these new ones support my feet much better. On the arch support question - better than bedroom slippers, less than good athletic shoes. NOTE: Occasionally I will see an adult were Crocs in public - please don't! These are house shoes only!

I honestly love crocs but the ones I was sent are defective. The strap is attached too far back on the shoe so it does not stay up. At first I though it was warped from shipping but after many attempts at warming and trying to reshape, the strap is too short. Not the worst problem to have, but the strap sticks up vertically at the top of the foot and  with frequent wear causes irritation on the foot. It has made he shoes unwearable for me

I bought these because I am a recent Crocs wearer and my favorite color is red. I do not like the nubs inside the footbed because they are too sharp and hurt your feet. I guess I'll have to wear socks with them all the time but that's not what I want to do in the summer.

I believed that when I purchased these croc's that I would be ordering size 7 women's according to their size chart. And the color black. When the croc's arrived they were a size 13 men's but they were black. I called Amazon to find out what happened to my order. I really feel I got the run around with them. They hem-haw about the size and then I was told that they did not come in black. He did tried and give me another type of croc that was suppose to be in women's black size 7. That also was a joke because there was no such number. This is the first time I have had this type of problem with Amazon and I hope that I never do again. I have shopped at Amazon many times before and have never been treated like this before. I suggest if you want croc's some place else.

These are great shoes......I wore my previous pair for about 15 years...They finally got ragged and i had to purchase another pair. They fit just right, but being new, the little bumps inside were a bit irritating. To solve this problem, i took a drill and used a wire brush attachment to grind them down a little. That made them better. I'm sure in no time they will be just as comfortable as my old ones!

I got these so I could have a black pair. For wearing to church where I am the pianist...I wore them for the first and only time two days ago and the strap just...broke. I was just sitting there and the strap gave way! Not very well made, me thinks! I am expecting to be given a second pair as a replacement. If the next pair breaks like this, no more crocs for me.

I am positively SOLD on these! I had tried another style of Crocs, and even though they fit well and were comfortable, (I'm keeping them btw!) the Crocs Classic is now my go-to shoe. I have "special needs" feet and the wide, roomy foot-bed of these are so stable and SO comfortable....right out of the box!

I have bought crocs many times on line with great fit. However this time the actual crocs inside the package were a 6/8 instead of the 7/9 that the bag was labeled. Since I had these shipped to my 2nd home where I don't have internet for the info on returning them, they are here starring at me wondering what shall I do with them.

This is my third pair of Crocs clogs. I personally think they're ugly and I can't figure out how they ever became fashionable but so it goes. The thing is, I have fallen arches (pes planus) and I my feet kill (I used the word "kill" to describe pain) me sometimes! These are far and away the most comfortable things I can put on my feet. They're light as air and they kind of form-fit to my arches. It's like getting a mini-massage just by walking around. I wear them whenever I'm lounging around the house or doing chores but I don't wear them outside at all. Something else to note: They don't stink. At least not for a long time. I think that's pretty remarkable. When they do start to smell, I couldn't really figure out an effective way to clean them so I just threw them away and bought new ones (they also lose their form a little after a year or so). I figure I can afford a pair every year or so so that I can have happier feet.

I can't believe how comfortable they are.  Perfect for slipping on and off throughout the day to go in and out of the house to the yard.  Good enough to get the mail in the snow.  I never want to take them off.  I was a shoe salesman for a year once, and am darn impressed with my first pair of crocs.

I can never say crocs are "beautiful shoes", but they're very comfortable and excellent to wear around the house. I buy a pair and wear them for many years until the bottoms are completely worn out. I've never had a complaint about my crocs. I do suffer from plantar fasciitis so I put inserts in them for additional arch support. It would be awesome to see a pair developed that would make the additional insole support unnecessary.

How come if I were no socks and leather sandals then I am a great guy "showing off" my humility etc. But if I wear the most comfortable shoes in my 70 years then I am a creep?  Well, it's said clothes make the man, so I it must be me that is creepy, no?

I will always love crocs and idc who disagrees lol. They are comfortable and the perfect shoe when you just don’t know if your feet are gonna get wet and you don’t feel like wearing flip flops. Comfortable. I got black, can’t go wrong with black. Goes with everything too!

Very comfortable! I have concrete tile floors so it helps my back. Bought a less expensive pair to see if I like them and if the size was right. Since they are Unisex shoes check the size chart. For example a Men's size 10 is a Woman's size 12. I wear a size 10 in a sneaker so a size 10 in a Croc was plenty big enough as they fit slightly larger. I wear them as a clog with the strap folded to the front. Great for a slip-on to run to the mailbox. I will get another pair.

I purchased a pair of crocs  as a GIFT.  I just found out that they don't fit.  bought them according to chart.  went online to EXCHANGE THEM.  only to find out too late to return.  So there they set unworn.  All I saw when I ordered was they could be returned  no  time frame.  She likes the way they look but that isn't anygood if they don't fit !!  All I WANT TO DO IS  EXCHANGE  TH.EM FOR THE CORRECT SIZE.  Not a Refund

What can I say? They're Crocs. My husband and children are obsessed with them, and they thought it would be hilarious to buy me a pair for Christmas. Ha ha. Well, I DO like the color, so there's that. They'll be good shoes to wear IN the house, but never ever out. Never.

Until a couple of weeks ago, I would have given these shoes 4 or 5 stars. However, I found out that if you leave them out in the sun (on a deck, for example), they *shrink*! I can't wear the pair I bought in December, as they no longer fit on my feet. I bought another pair earlier, and loved them. The tread on the bottom had worn down after a couple of years of hard use, so I replaced them with the exact same item. I will still replace this pair with the same thing again, but I certainly will not leave them on the deck when I bring my dogs back in the house..

Have ordered these Crocs in many different colors. I’m hooked on Crocs. They’re so comfortable and cushiony specially if your home has hard floors like ours. Buy with confidence you won’t regret it. I ware an 8 1/2 and sized down as directed to size 8. They fit perfectly.

Got these for casual & beach wear.  Thick sole gives a little with each step, supremely comfortable!  And, the back-strap actually keeps them on your feet far better than other sandals.  Even to the point of necessitating you to push down on it a little to get `em off.  They've been around for a few years but this is my first pair.  Love `em. :-) Mar`18

I usually wear a size 10D, and ordered these in size 10D.  If I wore these with socks, they'd be a perfect fit.  In bare feet, they're just a little loose (surprise surprise).  I wish they'd been available in my size in another color.  My only option was Khaki, which looks like rice-fed doggy poop.  But I don't wear 'em to look at them.  I wear them because they feel great.  And for the price (under $20, delivered by amazon Prime, go amazon!) I can't complain.  They're great clomp around clogs, keep your feet warm wet or dry, kick out irritants through the many open holes, and are very comfortable on my feet.  I have yet to use the heel strap or take them for a significant walk, but that's not why I bought them.  I wanted super easy on and off, comfortable enough to run errands in, and secure enough on my feet that I didn't have to think about where I put my feet when walking in them.  They fit the bill quite nicely, thank you very much.

Love these Crocs, but had to return them, just way too big and wide.  I got a smaller size and couldn't be happier with them.  They are comfy and fun to wear. Got them in pink and I'm going to buy another pair in green. I got a 9 but replaced them with a 8.  My regular size shoe is 8 .5 I don't know why but wearing Crocs put me in a good mood, ready to have fun, maybe because they look so silly and feel so comfy. This is my first pair, have been wearing them everyday since they arrived, they make my feet feel gooooddddd. I think you should try them!

Specifically regarding the black pair: they feel harder than the tan pair I bought.  Also, the strap broke off within a few days.  The rivet with the crocodile cartoon printed on it simply fell off.  Are these genuine Crocs or cheap knock-offs?

Ordered these just as a little joke, but I have worn them multiple times because they are very comfy. Unfortunately the sizes either run big, or I just ordered wrong. I ordered a size 10 and they are very, very big on me but the strap on the back does help hold them on pretty well which is the only reason i did not return them and exchange them with a different size. If you want to order these and are not sure what size to get, an example of my shoe sizes might help. I wear a mens 9 in converse, mens 9.5 in adidas, and mens 10 in vans. Hopefully that helps you understand what size to purchase.

I am a little puzzled by the sizing.  I had previously ordered a pair in 9W/7M.  They were way too big for me so gave them to my son.  He wears a 9 1/2 men's but they fit him fine!!  So this time I ordered a 8W/6M and they fit me fine!  This is my 3rd pair of Croc's - I love wearing them in Spring and Summer - so light, cool and easy to wear!

I love these. My feet are very wide and very flat but I can wear these with great comfort all day. I take long walks in them and work out in them, too. I always laughed at the aesthetics of the these things but once I tried them I don't care how odd they look. My biggest fear is that they will change them or stop making them.

I wear Crocs Classics exclusively.  I mean all the time.  Summer and winter.  Home, work, and church.  With socks and without.  I have foot and various arthritis issues and these are the only shoes I can wear comfortably. The shoes do wear out - and worse for me because I somewhat drag one foot.  I generally go through a pair a month.  It's important to replace them once the sole is smoothed out to avoid slipping dangers.  It seems expensive but over the year it costs the same as one expensive pair of orthopedic shoes that I'd otherwise have to wear.  I've tried many similar clogs but have found none better than Crocs themselves.

These are comfy and cute BUT the snaps that hold the strap break very easily. One of mine broke almost immediately. Some internet postings say that Crocs will replace the snaps but that is not true. Don't pay extra for the Crocs name. It is no guarantee of quality or customer service.

I love the color, and they are wide, meaning they fit me well that way, but in some manner that I can't explain, they feel slightly too large but about a quarter inch too short. Anyway, I'm pleased with them, but haven't worn them yet, obvously--it's winter!

My 15 year old does alot of hiking and has never worn a tennis shoe in her life. I don't think she will ever stop wearing crocs. They are comfy, great colors, and sturdy enough to keep her hiking everywhere. They are easy enough to clean and don't develop odor even with constant use.

I was so disappointed by the fit. I've owned dozens of Crocs and these dug into my feet where the circular connectors are. I'm not sure whether they're counterfeit but I'm at a Field and Stream store now trying on an authentic pair and they fit perfectly just like they always did. I should have returned them. Buyer beware at these prices.

Love my crocs. They fit great. I use these as house shoes. One thing, among a few, that I love about these crocs is that you can totally scrub them clean and they will dry out within the hour. Great for house shoes or even garden shoes (if all your doing is weeding and not shoveling or digging, lol). I love my crocs and will always have a few pairs.
Somewhat smaller.  It is really complex picking out a size. I know my foot's not narrow, but it's not really why to either. So I can get having three different with but not 4 or 5 different choices.

Found the shoes to be rather large, even though they are my size.  Found the sole to be thin--when out walking I can feel stones, etc, through the soles of the shoes.  Like the support the shoes give, and liked the holes along the top and sides.  I wouldn't recommend them for folks who live in the country and walk along rough roads, though.

I never thought I'd buy Crocs. They're ugly. But they were recommended by a friend and I love them. I have Plantar Fasciitis and I needed a pair of shoes I could wear everyday without pain. I would recommend Crocs for anyone with Plantar Fasciitis who wants relief from the condition who can't get into the doctor for some reason or another. They provide relief and my feet are not sore by the end of the day.

These Crocs are extremely large and don't appear to be sized properly. They are sized and mens' 9 and women' 11. My husband wears a 9 and his feel were swimming in them; same for me, and I wear a women's 11! They would only work if you wanted to wear "boats"!! Would not recommend purchasing these.

I have worn Crocs for years.  Most comfortable thing I have ever had on my feet!  This is just another fine pair of crocs.  Can be worn outside or as an inside slipper.  I wear mine outside mostly walking.  I usually walk over 5 miles a day.  Have bought expensive walking shoes over the years.  Anything I buy usually needs replacement after 2 to 3 months.  I am very hard on shoes.  These Crocs last just as long, yet only 1/3 to 1/4 the cost.  I can stand for hours in these too, without legs, hips, or feet aching.

I know some people think they have arch support, but I don't feel any.  Then again, I need a really high arch in my shoes.  So take that for what it's worth.  I usually wear Birks, but I like to wear crocs around the house so I don't have to switch shoes if I'm gardening or washing dogs outside.  And when I bruised the bottom of my feet I needed to wear softer shoes for several weeks and crocs fit the bill.

I was always critical of crocs because, in my opinon, they are some pretty ugly footwear, but I thought I would give them a try. Being in Afghanistan and having to use public showers, you really dont want footwear that is going to fall apart on you. These things not only do the job when it comes to showering, but they are just extremely comfortable. Waking on gravel back and forth from the tent to the showers, you cant even feels the rocks under your feet. As assumed, they breathe really well and just good shoes to wear around and kick back in. The only thing is that they ran rather big and I had to send the first order back. I wear an 11.5 and a 12 was absolutely gigantic. I ordered a pair in 11 from another site later on and they were perfect. yes, they might not be the most visually appealing shoe on the planet, but they are amazingly comfortable and durable.

Honestly, I was confused about the sizing. I have bought many of these shoes over the years for my son but always found that the ones marked from Mexico to be far too small. So I naturally bought them bigger thinking that the same issues in the past would still be true. I was wrong. My bad.

I have a pair of Crocs I bought at Dicks and wore them to and around Maui, Hawaii.  The bottoms were very smooth and comfortable, but for some reason one of the straps tore and came off so I ordered the pair I'm now wearing from Amazon and they are extremely uncomfortable with nibs so long on the insoles that they hurt and make my feet ache.  Being a diabetic I can't risk the crocs causing problem.  I wondered about the crocs so I took them to an actual croc store in Myrtle Beach and the sales lady assured me they were authentic saying that it depends on what country the crocs are made in as to how the nibs are on the insoles.  She suggested sanding off the nibs with sandpaper saying that is what her Dad did,  The Croc employee was so nice, helpful, and sweet especially when I fell in the store.  She only had one problem:  her name wasn't Amazon.  I wish I had sent the shoes back but for a swap-out but I didn't.  I hoped the nibs would wear down.  They haven't.  In researching this particular order, I discovered the straps on the new crocs are removable, so I am going to look at removing them and placing them on my original pair of crocs.  Croc Corporate is trying to help me and they have been extremely nice just like the Amazon employees with whom I have dealt.  I  guess I am just a balding, fat, Southern old coot who is too set in his ways about what he likes or doesn't.  I look at my wife of 35 years and then at Amazon.  If I was told I had to make a choice between the two, well I just I hope Amazon will be real understanding when I park my motorhome in their parking lot.  Love the place.

I wish they were a half size longer. I wear 9.5 and this is 9. Half sizes are not available. Otherwise it is a comfortable shoe and seems good quality. I bough a cheap Chinese-made pair in a different color, much cheaper - but not comfortable.  You can tell the difference.  This is a good pair.

My daughter has been begging me for crocs. I finally caved in and bought these. She’s been wearing them ever since. She even sometimes puts the straps around the back of her feet when she goes into croc extreme mode. She’s happy, which makes me happy.

Since I am firmly a half size, I had to order a size down (which was recommended). It fits just fine, but my toes are a little close to the front. But I got these for gardening and walking out on our deck, so I don't mind since I won't be doing any serious walking or wear with these shoes. I usually wear them without the back strap, which makes my feet fit better I think. The strap I think forces my foot forward a bit. I haven't tried a size up so I can't vouch for how that will fit.

Love these.  Awesome  for arthritis and bunions. I wear Brooks running shoes most of the time but wanted these foe easy things and home wear. I wear a 7 and buy 7 1/2 in Brooks and bought  an 8 in these. Tried a 7 on inthe store and much too small with Socks.

Purchased for my grandma who has an assortment of foot problems/pain. Surprisingly this is her first pair of crocs and she absolutely loves them. Not only does it help her with her foot troubles but it also helped her with a mild case of sciatica that comes and goes.

This size was the second pair.  The first pair was a men's 9.  It was too large and the second pair, a men's 8 was too large also.  My husband has three other older pairs which fit properly in a size 8 with the instep and length correct.  Something changed in the manufacturing of the shoes.

I wore my last pair of Crocs for about 15 years!  Yes!  That's a really long time.  They finally punctured through the sole when I was stomping around on turf never meant for Crocs.  So finding the very same pair for a mucho cheapo price was just a killa find.  Same Croc, same fit, same ooo-baby-these-are-gonna-last-till-I-croak!  Thank you!  Couldn't be happier.

This is my first pair of Crocs, and I was ambivalent because they are about as unflattering as a shoe can be (and I've seen some ugly shoes). I bought them as a lightweight camp/river crossing shoe for backpacking on friends' rave reviews. I first ordered a 6M8W, and it was long enough without the heel strap on, but the heel strap was so short it pushed my foot forward so my toes were crammed against the front of the shoe.  So I returned it and ordered the 7M9W.  Same problem! See pic. These shoes are boats - long enough and certainly as wide as an ocean liner.  I can't wear them without the strap, or they'd fall off my very narrow feet, but this short strap issue takes nearly 3/4" off the length and crams my toes into the front of the shoe.  Really disappointing, and uncomfortable.  I know they want the strap to fit against the front when not in use, but it wouldn't take an engineering genius to make the shoe body and strap proportional.  At least the color is cute...

I bought these 8 years ago because my crew coach recommended them. I was embarrassed by the style, but have grown to love these durable shoes. They're still going strong, haven't shrunk in a hot car, and I wear them every day (one has developed a slight dent in the sole). I've worn them to the beach, (accidentally) to the store, and would probably wear them everywhere if it were more socially acceptable. You have enough room to wear super thick socks in the winter, yet it's not like your foot is flopping around. The arch support is pretty dang good, too. Note: I've tried Crocs in their store, and they were nowhere near as comfy as my own, so not sure if this review is that helpful anymore.

These shoes are great! I normally wear a 10, the 10 is a little big but comfortable. Great quality. I have ordered pairs for both my little ones as well as my husband. I ordered these in the bright pink color for something different and they did not disappoint!!!

It seems that the size and toe space is different depending on where the Crocs were produced. The ones from Mexico seem to run smaller with a narrower toe space than the ones from China. This makes it difficult to order because it is not clear as to where the product being sent to me is from, Why should there be a difference in size for the "same" shoe? Are the templates used different in different countries. It may need to be stated in the order guide where the product being sent is from, or it would be best if the buyer of the product can choose the manufacturer of the Croc. All of this is moot if there is still a difference in fit between the same products from the same country much less from Mexico vs China. That's why it is so confusing when I read the critiques of the product where some one would say the size is 1/2 to 1 size larger than stated and someone else says it is 1 to 1/2 size too small. The comparison must also state whether they were discussing a Croc produced in China vs Mexico or where ever.

My teenage daughter loves them she bought to Wear with her scrubs  for when she had to wear professional clothing for her biomedicine course but has been using them to wear comfortable shoes after long days of sports practice or games .. they fit her to size and says they are the most comfortable shoes she owns

I got these in white and i absolutely love them! I ordered a size women’s 11/men’s 9(i think my actual size is a 10/10.5) and they fit more like an 11.5 but it’s perfect for me! Not only are they super good quality, they’re SUPER comfy as well!

These run big!!! I wish I had ordered a size smaller. Although they are comfortable,  the little "nubs" on the inside of the shoegets to be really irritating after a short while wearing them. They are perfect for an afternoon of yardwork, a day at the lake or a quick trip to the grocery store.
