It makes a great house shoe, for example for taking out the dogs, lawn work (easy to clean), etc. I don't have much use for the strap, so I just move it forward and forget about it. Sometimes I forget I have them on, then find myself at Lowe's wearing bright blue Crocs. Pretty embarrassing!

I am not normally a Crocs fan because there is zero arch support, but I needed a pair to accomodate the compression wraps on my feet, which I had to wear for over a month. I ordered up a couple of sizes, thanks to the handy measurement guide provided. They have worked out fabulously, and the price was just right where I was comfortable, considering I won't be wearing them for long. And surprisingly, I've not had any back issues or a flare in my plantar fasciitis, so mabye the arch support is sufficient enough after all. I'm actually considering ordering a pair of the wooly style for the winter!

Purchased the silver Croc and fell in love with them (did not see that coming!).  Sprained my ankle pretty badly a few days later and fortunately had these which were the only shoe I could wear with all the tape and the ankle brace. (Felt fairly stable, too!) Decided to buy some more, so got the khaki. Weirdly tho, the khaki are the same size (per the chart, 10"=9 women)...BUT, the size label on the new package had "roomy" on the size label and the Croc is way larger than the same-sized silver purchased before and had fit just dandy. As I pointed out to Amazon, the "roomy" designation's explanation was nowhere to be found in the description on the web page. Of course (and I may yet do exactly this), I can keep ordering them and hoping I will get a non-"roomy" shoe.  But, it does seem a whole lot messier (more work and time) than the seller being clear about the sizes or at least noting that some of the sizes come "roomy".  Why was there no description on ANY of the Croc shoes I looked at (studied the size chart on every Croc I looked at, so that wasn't the problem) delineating the "roomy" sizing.  It just seems to be common sense.  I know nothing else sized this way and am glad for that.  Imagine a dress or pants that come in a size 9 and a size 9 roomy, but you can't know by the description...  I mean, even then there's designations like "relaxed fit" so you are aware of the difference.

I have Crocs that are about 10 years old, wanted a second pair.  The size is still visible on the bottom. 7/9.  The new 7/9s I just received are about 1" shorter than the old 7/9 - can't even get my foot fully into them.  Had to return.

I wear these crocs around the house.....I have a foot issue so need to insert my orthotics inside.  But I love them.  I never wear them outdoors so they will stay clean and not dirty up my abode.  I know they're great for outdoor use also but I don't have a yard anymore so for me it's not necessary.

I didn't purchase these for their looks-lol!  I have achilles tendonitis in both legs and it is extremely painful -- I bought these to wear around the house as my slippers, and after 5 minutes of walking around with them I realized I wasn't in any pain.  I love the little massaging insoles in the shoes as well as the stacked heel which helped to alleviate the pain/pressure I feel when walking barefooted or in regular slippers.  I normally wear an 8/8.5 and bought the 8W/6M and they fit perfectly.  Glad I purchased these.

They are way big.  I ordered the size suggested here on this website.  Otherwise they are crocs.  If you have ever had a pair, you know what to expect.  If yiu haven't, then crocs are durable and comfortable.  I cannot use the heel strap on crocs, because then the shoes are too inconvenient to remove.  If you walk across lawns or on trails, you will get lots of pebbles and twigs and such in your shoes.

Crocs are my favorite go to slides. Super easy to put on and pretty comfortable to walk around or wear when you go to the store to do some shopping. I usually go a size down so they fit a bit snug so they don’t slip or are loose but other than that it’s a very good show to chill around in!

These shoes arrived and fit as expected, however last week during a Southern California heat waves, the shoes where on my porch ( along with several other shoes) and they shrunk and curled up . I have never seen a shoe do this, and I have owned other Crocs before . Needless to say they do not fit now and I am 4 weeks past the "return policy " window. Crocs should put a label on their shoes to inform the consumer of this problem>

Difficult time getting to these crocs without going through Amazon Fashion but I eventually found them.  Also no wide widths only normal and medium.  That is why they only get 4 stars.  Wore them yesterday and my feet felt good.  Extra size bigger to get a wider shoe.

My sister worked in a pair of crocs..and she stated how comfortable they were.  I thought they were to ugly to wear.  One day I snuck them on when no one was looking and I could not  believe how wonderful these shoes are. I now wear mine every day.

Fit just right for my 12 y/o daughter. Size 6 seemed to be the same as her Nike shoes. Who knew she’d want Crocs, I thought there were no longer a thing, guess I’m wrong. Then she needed to dress them up with shoe jewelry, see photo.😂

Originally ordered the size 10 but it was way too big. Then returned the size 10 for the size 9 and that's a little too tight. It actually is very difficult to wear them with socks. Also the holes in the toes allow dirt and moisture in as you're walking; a solid front would be better. I won't order these again.

I love looking at people's reactions when I step out of my 2001 chevy malibu in style. Dare to clunk around in these comfortable crocs that honestly look like you've shoved your feet into two fish's mouths! Love these things. They make me smile.

I have been wearing Crocs for years and recently had to replace the ones I have (even though they are pretty much indestructible!) Their comfort and waterproof/mud proof nature makes them perfect for working in the garden and can be easily hosed off to wear again. When purchasing, I would recommend buying them in your exact size, and if a half size: size down. I am a women’s size 7.5 and the size 7 fit perfectly.

These just aren't quite the same as the Crocs I've been wearing for years. The material is a bit "harder" and does not have the softness that I'm used to. And the size is slightly smaller. With this pair, I can wear them with the strap moved forward but if I put the strap around my foot, then my toe touches the front of the shoe. In all my other crocs, I've had a comfortably loose fit even when using the strap.

Bought these for my son and the strap broke after a few days of wear. Disappointed with the quality. Crocs are usually more reliable. I like how they have size 4, as my son is in that in between size of child and adult. Maybe this style isn’t made for the activeness of a kid.

Unfortunately I purchased these and set them aside while I continued to wear my other garden shoes. I find these short and cut off in the toe box. I can feel my heel pressing on the back lip. Sorry that I am now stuck with them and no option for return...

Is Crocs, son!  You either love em or hate em.  Obviously my 5 stars means I love them.  I wear the slate grey for an understated, refined look, and the grass green for funking around!  I'm nuts and like to nut so what can I say, Crocs all day!

My wife hates them so I promised her i will not wear them outside our 20acre property. Aside from that.... i love Crocs. This is the first pair i ever bought (Nov2018) since it was on special for black friday. Probably my last pair too haha

Not sure what is going on but I ordered a size 11 for my husband and an 8 for me as we've worn before (from Zappos). The size 11 fit like clown shoes and the size 8 are short. The cushioning and texture isn't the same. I just ordered an 11 from Zappos and they are the correct size and quality. Will donate theses. Buyer beware.

These are the perfect garden shoes.  I just wish that I had gotten a pair a long long time ago. They are so comfortable and durable and water flows through them so I can rinse and keep working.  What can I say? They are perfect for the garden.

I'm very pleased with these Crocs. Never had Crocs before, and I was hesitant about looking goofy, but these are the best knock-arounds I've had in years. I struggle finding slides that will stay on my feet, but these are great—they have the strap thingy in the back that also rotates to the front if you don't need it. Even without the strap, these stay on my feet better than any other slides I've owned. And the support is terrific—the first time I wore them I took a 2.5 mile walk and they were extremely comfortable. They run a little large. I usually wear a men's 10.5, but they don't have half sizes, so I got 10s. They fit great, and if anything might be a bit large. Inexpensive, durable, easy to clean, great for doing yard work, shopping, or whatever.

Crocs are great for those of us with foot issues.  They aren’t the prettiest but when your feet hurt you don’t care about fashion. I have owned many pairs of crocs. This style isn’t my favorite (the Mary Jane style is my favorite) but they serve the purpose. I am on my feet all day. In this style I should have ordered an 8 to have room for thick socks. I am keeping them and will wear thin socks. In the Mary Jane style a 7 is fine. I normally wear a 7-71/2. I recommend them if you are looking for comfort.
The nubs on the inside sole are different than on previous Crocs. They’re sharper and there are more of them. Not too comfortable at first but hopefully the feet will adjust.

My daughter fell in love with them as soon as she saw them and wanted them. We ordered them that day and she paid for over night shipping, which was only around $4. She rarely shows excitement but this excitement lasted for days! Now, this is all she wears except on P.E. days.

Love these! I wear them as slippers around the house. They are very comfortable and fit exactly as expected. I wear between an 8 1/2 and a 9 in women’s and the 9s fit me great as long as I wear socks with them. They are a bit loose without socks.

Way too small. Like 3 sizes too small. Tried to exchange them, but it would cost more to exchange than we originally paid for them. Super disappointed. I think they were sized incorrectly. Now we have shoes no one can wear.

Great shoe, feels nice, but definitely recommend going down one shoe size. I'm normally a 10 but I think a 9 would've been a much better fit. Still, the strap on the back of the shoe prevents it from falling off and I only use these indoors so not going to make a big deal out of it.

I love my crocs! I never thought I would buy these because I never thought I would have any use for them, but I sure was wrong. I needed a pair of shoes to just throw on an wear them around my dorm. My friend convinced me that crocs were the perfect solution. I ordered them and they came on time for a pretty reasonable price. I also got some jibbitz to accessorize them and make them unique to myself. The jibbitz also help me to know which ones are mine when distinguishing them from other pairs of crocs. I now have power ranger jibbitz and a really cool alligator jibbit that looks like it is swimming. The purchase of crocs was one of my best decisions and I get a lot of compliments on them. The other day I saw someone with hot pink ones and I think that might be my next purchase.

I got the crocs and tried them on.  The heel area was my biggest concern because I go to the wound care department at the hospital to get my legs wrapped due to lymphedema issues.  And since they wrap my foot, my heel gets uncomfortable after a while in the wrappings.  So the house slippers that I have don't work out for me.  The heel area was fine, but the length was not.  I am in the process of getting them exchange for a smaller size.  The wideness I will have to take care of that on my own.  With the wrappings on my feet, I will have work on the crocs so that they will fit properly.

Initially I thought they seemed a little tight, but when looking, my other Crocs are size 12 and these are an 11.  So, my mistake in ordering them "tighter".  They are the standard Crocs clogs, light, easy to slip on, comfortable and should be as durable as my 10 year old ones.

This shoe is lightweight, comfortable, and very squishy. However, my dad thinks this shoe is rather fancy and too fashionable for his taste lol. He prefers the simpleness of Crocs Classic Flip-Flop or Classic Slide. Although the color looks a little different compared to the one shown in photo (the one my dad received has a greener tone to it), but it is still acceptable. Crocs shoes are divided into three types: roomy fit, relaxed fit, standard fit. This shoe has a roomy fit and it fits my dad as expected. On top of that, I got it on sale, so yay for me!

great all around slip ons that are comfortable and practical. i hesitated to buy this brand but after going thru thru the wallyworld pair quickly these are worth their expense. the order fitting selection process is a little more complicated than i thought was necessary
Really glad when crocs came around. On tile a lot in AZ! Not the best for support, But at the end of an 8 hr. day my feet feel best when I am wearing crocs.

I read a lot of reviews here before purchasing the crocs. My boyfriend has crocs that I slip on and we both love them so had better get my own! His are comfortable and made in china. Many reviews said the mexican manufactured croc offered less cush, uneven heel straps, and pretend nubs on the footbed. Reviews compared this shoe to the chinese manufactured croc, which was more cushion-y, had even heel straps, and nice nubs on the footbed.

Warning, despite having this exact pair from a Crocs store, this pair arrived very small for the labeled size. My son loved his last pair so I ordered one size larger for his growing foot. They arrived and actually measure smaller than his last pair. Took them to a Crocs store because the difference was so shocking. Sales associate at the Crocs store was perplexed as to why they were so off. They are a pain to return because they arrive in nonreusable plastic shipping envelope.
I thought she was joking when she came up to me and asked me for these.  I laughed in her 14 year old face when she uttered the words, "lemon yellow crocs", I mean, surely this was a joke.....

They're Crocs.  What else needs to be said.  Perfect around the house shoe.  We each have a few  pairs at this point.  Inside "clean" crocs, barn crocs, and deck crocs for making that winter trek  across the deck to the hottub.

My wife hates them, but they are so comfortable.  I wear them all around the house and for short trips to the store.  I have a wide foot and they have plenty of room in the toe of the clog.  My only complaint is that my feet sweat pretty easily in them and then they make a squeak noise with each step.

These have a  cushiony sole and are well made. I got them to wear while I work in the yard and they are perfect for this because I can just rinse them off with the hose when I'm done. I ordered the Women's size 9. I usually wear an 8.5 but I listened to the reviews that said they ran small and boy am I glad I did! My toes just touch the end of the shoe. I would say they are about a 1/2 size too small. If I had to wear them for long periods while standing, they would be uncomfortable pretty quickly. So keep that in mind, if you're going to wear them for 8 hours at work. Overall I'm very happy with them.
Could be greater, but the size seems small for the size I ordered.  (Then again, I did place insoles in them.  Maybe that's some of the feel-small problem.)

I got a pair of clone Crocs many years ago, but the soles were worn to the point of being unsafe on wet surfaces.  I received these as a Christmas gift.  They fit and work well.  I use them almost exclusively as house shoes.

Can crocs shrink? I ordered 2 pairs in the same size and color. One pair for me and one for my daughter. She kept complaining they were too small. When I switched with her they were too small for me as well. The other pair fits both of us fine. Perhaps one pair is a knock off or they somehow shrank.

Ok first, I looove crocs! I even ordered a pair for myself and they were perfect but this pair that I ordered (for my sister) was completely weird. The pair contained one size 9 women’s shoe and one size 10 women’s shoe instead of two 10’s. It was so disappointing, but I’m just going to return then purchase again.
People either love or hate Crocs and we love them! My husband needed a new pair (after lots of miles on the previous pair) and once again was completely satisifed with these.

My friend has very large, wide feet for a women. She had purchased a pair of knockoffs at a discount store, same size, and had to return them because her toes bumped/rubbed the front of the shoe. This was not noticed at the store, but she gave them a good workout on carpeting (to protect the shoes in case she did have to return them) at home and found them to be uncomfortable. She gave the Crocs the same workout and was delighted by the fit and comfort. And as a bonus her favorite color is blue. And the knockoffs only came in black. So I gave a great gift, my friend has happy feet, and we had a great birthday party.  It has been several months since her bithday, she wears them every day after work. Still very happy with the Crocs.

Gf said she’d leave me if I bought these. Said my soul would escape through the holes. I’m going to miss her. I enjoy wearing them with socks on. Minimizes the soul loss. I will update my review when I try them in 4WD (aka strap down).

Recently purchased 2 pairs of Crocs Classic Clogs, both men's size 11, in different colors.  The Red was made in Italy and the Blue was made in Mexico.  The Red Italian fits perfectly, the Blue Mexico is smaller, ok for bare feet but not socks.

Its the same comfortable Crocs shoe you have always worn and are used to.  The shoes were factory fresh with all of the tags on the shoes.  I normally wear an 8' to 8'.5" US in a normal shoe.  I ordered the 7M - 9W size Crocs and they fit perfectly.

I have made fun of these clogs forever but needed something to quckily slip on to keep in the garage. They feel AMAZING on, I take back everything I used to make fun of them for. I now get it, years late. Will always have a pair moving forward

These run a little big just like Crocs from the store so I ordered accordingly. They fit my daughter perfectly. She wears size 5.5Y or 6Y in Mens and I ordered her a size 5 Mens Crocs and they fit perfectly. Thank you

For years I made fun of people that wore Crocs... I tried them on and now I won't take them off. They are fantastic. I do everything in these. My wife won't take me anywhere because they are hideous but at the end of the day my feet are comfortable so I don't care.

Not comfortable at all. If you buy this thinking that you gonna use it to stand all day, you are gonna be disappointed. The shoes is hard, not as hard as a concrete, but hard as car wheel. It is not cushiony nor soft.
True to size, classic, authentic crocs! I ordered mine in a 7 in the magenta color- they were only $19! Shipped fast! I even ordered some cute charms to put on mine as well :)

If I hadn't owned a pair of original Crocs, I would have given these 5 stars. And these are fine. However, the originals were softer and had a longer strap. I like to wear the strap pushed forward and now the strap is too short to stay forward. If you had the originals, know that the sizing is different. My old ones were women's size 6. These are a size 8, which is my actual size. All that said, these are good for my plantar fasciitis.

I have been wearing Crocs for years.  They are the most comfortable, versatile, sturdy and convenient shoes I have ever owned.  I bought several pair of the classic clogs so I can have Crocs for years to come.  Sad that they are going out of business.

The shoes are very comfortable, though a bit large, since they only come in whole sizes.  They're fine for what I want though, which is something to wear around the house.  The price was great for crocs - better than any of the other colors. The quality is good, so they should last well.
Not sure what exactly happened, but I'll try to describe it. Sorry if it would sound weird :)

I'm so disappointed with Crocs - these I got are made in Mexico, and they're so different from my favorites, which were made in Colorado. Those were (and still are, after many years) soft and comfortable. Because of the reviews, I ordered up a size, and they're HUGE. Because I'd thrown away the wrapping, I won't return them, and I might order a smaller size, just to see. But they're hard and shiny - not at all what I want...at least the back straps seem to be the same length, unlike others that were reviewed. I ordered online because the stores are full of other styles that also just don't fit the same. Very frustrating...

I've always been a Crocs fan and was ready for a new pair.  I bought two pairs around black Friday when they were on sale and they appear to be irregulars. The pair I got, the heel on the shoe is misshapen/deformed and the support band is quite a bit shorter/tighter on that same shoe, making it a bit uncomfortable. The other pair I purchased was not bagged or on a hanger and had scuffs all over, possibly a return. For the price, I'm not too upset but still - I've never gotten this low of quality from Crocs before, and would be much happier with a pair that fit correctly.

Good pair or real crocs I ordered off Amazon because they were the lowest price I could find . Be carful leaving these in ur car in the Texas heat for weeks because the sun will cause them to shrink this is my second pair of crocs super comfy house shoes , lounge shoes with socks or without  regardless very comfortable !

My daughter had been asking for a pair if crocs so she got some for Christmas.  She likes these a lot, they fit well, and are easy to clean off.  She likes buying the jibbets to decorate the front of them.  Overall, a good buy!

i love crocs when i have to stand for any length of time cooking, etc. When I come home from work i change into them right away in order to relax and get into my evening routine.  I would wear them all the time if I could.  They're wonderful!

These are the best things since sliced bread!  They are great to slip on to takeout the trash, run to the store, and after dance class.  Sweet relief after a long day in heels... Cool points with the students in my school!
Crocs are awesome, and these are genuine, nothing more to say

Classic Croc. Quality seems as good as previous crocs. The fit was perfect. If you are unfamiliar with these shoes they are great shoe for gardening, errands, hospital stays, boats, beaches, and any situation you need a cleanable slip on shoe. Every pair our family has had has been very durable.

My favorite summer and lake shoes. Very lightweight and comfortable. Easy on and off and no problem if they get wet. Very quick drying and don't carry dirt in the treads. Easy to clean and rinse off. Great for keeping by the door to go in and out of the garage as well. My wife wishes they got way less use then they do!

I shattered my heel 3 months ago and I’m having a tough time finding shoes I can wear without terrible pain. These are as good as I’ve found. Brooks running shoes and New Balance are what the ortho recommended. These feel much better than both those.

I bought the shoes for my son with special needs. He is very picky about his clothes and shoes. However, he loves the shoes. He usually wears a size 9 in sneakers. The 8 mens in the crocs is a perfect fit for him.

I bought four on special or something. I have one for indoors and one for outdoors in my yard. I find crocs to be comfortable plus I can just just slip my feet in them. No fussing with straps or anything like that. Just super easy and comfy footwear!

Excellent squishy slip on shoe. The back strap keeps it from falling off, and you don't have to work too hard to keep these on as you walk. They are lightweight and flexible. Great for leaving by the door and slipping on to run down to the mailbox or step out into the yard.

Nothing fancy, just a comfortable, breathable, waterproof shoe.  Great for people with very wide feet, like me.  For the price (less than $30), this shoe is a real bargain.  The only shoes I wear anymore are Crocs and Skechers, and I have about 10 pairs of each.

When I first saw Crocs on somebody else's feet, I thought they were the stupidest things I'de ever seen. Fast forward, several years, and I love these things. They cannot be more comfortable, and lightweight. When I burn through this pair like I did the last pair, I will get another pair.
I am a size 11 so I decided to get a size bigger (size 12)  and I'm soooo glad that

I love my crocs! I wear them everywhere on dry days and even in the shower. I bought one pair in yellow and they were so comfortable I bought another in brown to wear out. The brown ones were different sizing than the yellow ones since the yellow beach ones were size 8-9 and the brown ones size Women's 8M. Both fit fine but the brown ones fit best with thin socks if I wear socks.

Good product. I deploy to bases with "public use" showers that everyone uses and this keeps your feet off the ground and clear of the mildew and other unmentionables on the shower floor. They turn white after a while a crack with constant hydration and dehydration of actually taking them into the shower but after 4-6 months of use, I would probably throw them away in that environment anyway no matter how they looked. Very comfortable to wear and just the thing for deployments. Sandals flop around too much.

I have never wanted Crocs, until my foot doctor said some patients like to wear Crocs to help with plantar fasciitis.  So I figured I'd try them.  I actually love them!  I wear them around the house, because with plantar fasciitis you're not supposed to walk bare foot (I cant stand shoes) but these have helped.
Shipment arrived and one of the straps was not attached correctly.  Reported issue, was sent a replacement, returned defective pair, happy ending.

I absolutely love crocs, I first started wearing them during a deployment to Iraq and keep at least 3 pairs handy at all times. I have my winter paid with fur, my house pair which are new and my yard pair which are worn out crocs. I love how comfy they are and the ability to allow water to drain when needed. The option to rotate the strap from front to back is a great design feature.  I will continue to buy crocs as they are perfect for my needs.

BE CAREFUL WHEN ORDERING FROM THIS COMPANY——They are ACTUAL CROCS and THE PRICE IS CHEAP BUT I ORDERED THESE FOR MY DAUGHTER’S BIRTHDAY, I GOT A SIZE 7 IN WOMEN’S AND INSTEAD RECEIVED A SIZE 8 IN MEN’S WHICH IS A SIZE 10 IN WOMEN’S??? VERY AGGRAVATED!

Crocs are awesome. Super comfy. I stand all day at work and they keep my feet from feeling as horrible as they do otherwise. I didnt realize they had different fits for looser or more fitted so mine are a little bigger than I would have liked but that's my fault. I still love them though and will buy again.

My husband loves these. Great quick on and off shoes. Durable as well. He has wide feet so he did size up but they still rub the top of his foot if he wears them too long and makes a sore spot. Overall good shoe!

I bought mine a bit larger so I can wear sox with them when it gets colder...they hare hard at work in the garden and being red, I don't lose them if I take them off! The peekaboo holes  keep my feet happy on hot days, easy to wash off the mud, too....

After recently fracturing an ankle I am on the road to recovery and this is the only type of shoe I can fit into. These are roomy, but could use more arch support and padding.  They have permitted me to walk.

The sizing is ridiculous - it's nowhere near a women's 10 and I can't even squeeze my toes into the shoe.  I'm annoyed that the return window just closed and I've been too busy to pack them up.  Now I'm out $25.  Think I am done with Crocs and will go back to the cheap CVS imitations.

My roommate and I got these matching crocs on Cyber Monday, super cute! I’m not a big croc person, but I wear these in my dorm causally. I’m usually a size 8 and they’re a little bit large for me, but I deal with it

The shoe itself was on sale. There was a defect in one of the snaps where the handle meets the shoe. It would not stay closed. Also, when my foot (which fit the shoe) was in the shoe, it did not look very good on me. They were returned for both reasons. I have had a Croc shoe before (different style), and I can stay all day in them, so I am sure had I kept the shoes, I would have worn them all day. It fits my wider foot just fine. There is a very slight arch support.
I like the comfort of these crocs.  Fit my feet male feet fine.

OK. I'm 61 years old and thought to myself, I'll never wear a pair of those goofy looking shoes. Looks like something an old Hippie would wear. But after seeing so many people over the years wearing them, and not hippies, mind you, I thought, maybe there's something to these things, so I bought a pair. The classics in khaki.

I wanted some house shoes to provide padding for my sore feet. I went with Crocs because I heard from someone who is on their feet all day that the shoes help with foot pain. I was skeptical, but decided to give them a try. I purchased a size 14, and at first I thought they were too large. However, after wearing them a few days, I find this size to be just about perfect.
I live in Florida and wear these most every day. Incredibly comfortable but can be expensive for what they are even at the outlet store. Great price on a product I use every day. Strongly recommend.

I absolutely love the weight/comfort ratio of these shoes!  They're the perfect backpacking shoe to wear around camp and even cross a stream if you need to keep your boots dry.  They weigh nothing but feel wonderful when the boots that have been stuck to your foot for 15mi and 5,000' feel like a million pounds at the end of the day.

They fit perfectly! I needed relief for really bad calluses on my feet. These are an excellent shoe indoor and out, but I solely use them inside. The magenta color in the picture is off. They really don’t have any fuchsia or purple color in them at all, they are almost strictly hot pink.

unisex must be more mens sizing.  I got these in bright pink, guess my husband won't wear them, they are big!! even tho bottom says m7 and w9, which i wear i other crocs, but they are big even when I wear super thick sox.  but I just wear them for quick trips outside to the garbage, studio, mailbox, etc

Went through Europe and the Holy Land on a pair of these.  Only problems experienced were losing the plastic "rivet" the backstrap pivots on and eventually the bottoms become slick and provide no stopping on slick surfaces. Fun story: took the Crocs to a sandal maker inside the Old City of Jerusalem. He studied the broken Croc, surveyed his available repair materials then using a metal rivet provided the needed repair.  He guaranteed another 1,000 miles.  Almost got it,too!

Bought these for my teenage daughter who loves crocs! She was very pleased at the color we chose for Christmas and has added them to her collection now totaling 13 pairs! Yes she matches them with her outfits!

This is not a color I would normally have selected, but it was half the price of the other available colors. As this was my first pair of Crocs I figured I had nothing to lose at such a bargain price. What I didn't realize is how much I had to gain! I really, really like them!

My daughter loves Crocs. Sizing for 9 year olds is tough. Most go up to kids size 3 then you pretty much have to jump to women's size 6 (men's size 4) unless you are lucky enough for the very limited J4, J5, or J6 sizes, which I could not find. So she'll have to grow into her's now.

Wanted something for working in the yard. They're classic Crocs. Mine were labeled "Roomy" which works out great for my 11-4E feet. After a few weeks of use, it appears that they will wear like iron, but they fit comfortably.

When Crocs first were introduced back when I was a kid, my mom and I would constantly call these "the ugliest garden shoes we'd ever seen." However, fast forward to when we got our first puppy who has to make countless potty runs at all hours of the night, and these are the most appreciated shoes! They slip on and off without having to lift a finger, and they are incredibly light weight. They are the perfect shoe for roaming around the yard, where no one can see your silly "garden shoes"! But really, in all honesty, we love our Crocs for making puppy potty runs!

This is my second pair of Crocs (the first ones wore out).  I wear these shoes on the weekends (around the house/yard and to the store).  The size was a little larger than expected, but not unreasonable.  I'm actually glad they are a little larger in hopes that the added size will help improve airflow.  I've owned this pair for about a month and they seem to be holding up ok.  I was much happier to pay the Amazon price as opposed to what the store was asking.  I just hope it's the same quality; only time will tell.

Actually, I bought these for my husband who needed a pair for a vacation where he'll be at the sea.  We could not find a pair of men's that fit him because they were all too big.  When I looked on Amazon, I was pleased to find that the sizes are for either men or women, so I took a chance and bought him what's considered to be a woman's size.  When they arrived, he immediately tried them on and found that they fit perfectly and felt good.  Amazon, thank you.

Sizing is ridiculously inconsistent. I usually wear a size 10 show. I had a size 9 pair of crocs for many years that fit well. I bought another size 9 and they are HUGE. They fit my roommate who wears a size 11 perfectly. Very annoying.

I usually wear a W-9/M7 in Crocs. However, the newer Crocs are not the same size as the ones a few years ago. I have to order a size larger now to get the same "size" that I wear. Other than that, these are the same quality as past years. Love them!

i have had crocs before, so knew what to expect.  this pair is indeed standard, fulfilling my expectations.  word of warning about crocs in general.  do NOT leave them in a hot car.  they shrink about 2-3 sizes when overheated.

There is no longer any uniformity in Crocs Classics.  I have several pairs of Crocs Classics in size 11W/9M which fit fine.  I recently ordered two additional pairs in the same size, and they are markedly smaller - close to a full size smaller - though they are marked as 11W/9M.  All pairs were made in Mexico, so it is not like different molds in different countries.  There is simply no consistency, and my tendency now would be to NOT buy Crocs online from Amazon or any other retailer but to buy them in a store where I can try them on before buying.  Very disappointed in Crocs as a company for not maintaining uniformity in molds for a shoe that has been around for many years.

I bought my first pair of Crocs around 2007.  I still have them even if the tread has mostly worn away with use, the rest of the shoe is in great shape.  While they are not the most attractive looking footwear (I think a comedian made a joke about people wearing Crocs having given up on life) they are sturdy, protect your toes, stay on very well, float and dry/ clean up a lot easier than sandals with nylon straps.

Somewhat larger than he expected for a size 17, but for the price, my size 16 shoe boyfriend said they are fine and easy to throw on when he has to go out with the dogs. There is about an inch of space between his heel and end of shoe.  At the time of ordering, the size 16 clogs were more money.

Fit is fine, very comfortable as normal for Croc product.  Durability is mediocre as normal with most Croc products like this, as the tread/bottom tends to wear fairly quickly when worn/used on paved surfaces. But still a decent deal for the cost.

Decent price for for very comfortable Crocks! Was so disappointed when my old pair broke after lasting for over five years, true Crocks were too expensive to warrant purchasing a new pair until I finally just came across them on Amazon!!

On a whim I decided to pack my new Crocs for a trip to Africa. They ended up being one of my favorite trip items. Easy on/off on airplane and comfortable on safari. Back home they double as I my slippers and provide a lot of firm cushioning for my feet that suffer from second toe capsulitis and bunions.

Crocs should go back to making their crocs like they used to years ago.  I do not like the new composite material used and they run small.  These are no where near to the quality of my old pairs and the size runs small even though I ordered the same size as my old ones.  C'mon Crocs - you can do better!

Nice product, comfortable sole, but way too wide for a woman unless you have exceptionally wide feet. You can kick the strap up over the top to wear as a mule. I ended up sending these back for a quick refund.

These Crocs are simply awesome. I had to replace my main pair after our new puppies chewed them up; I also keep a spare pair in the RV. Great foot support around the house or campsite. Great with or without socks. Cannot imagine my closet without these as an option. Roomy enough for warm socks. The holes provide ventilation. These are true to the original design for you long-time Croc fans. Plus, this is my favorite color so far!

I got these as a (gag) gift for my brother but he absolutely loves them he wears them around the house all the time and they are perfect to slide on when you just need to take the garbage out or grab the mail. The perfect shoe!

I have very wide feet so I usually wear 10.5 to 11 3E shoes. I couldn't find any Crocs that come in a wide size so I ordered a size 12 medium because these would usually fit the width of my feet even though they would be too long. This shoe is very tight around the bridge of my feet, where the top of my feet connect to my ankle. Wearing them would pinch my the top of my feet so I stopped wearing them. I'm going to give them to somebody that has size 12 feet.
I wear a size 8 and the Crocs fit perfectly. The strap keeps the shoe securely on my feet. The plastic is comfortable and soft. I can wear them with socks or barefoot.

I bought these because I have hot feet. I thought the many air holes would keep my feet nice and cool. They unfortunately do not. They do stay cooler than when wearing moccasins but still get a little sweaty.

I bought these for my husband (although he's always hated how original crocs look) because they'd be useful for yard work and the pool. He still doesn't love the look, but says the comfort largely makes up for it. He wears them all the time now and loves them. He says they're so comfortable and he now understands why people love them so much!

Replaced a similar pair from 10 years earlier.  Fit is a little different, but still can wear the same size without going up or down (but still over-sized compared to my usual street shoe size).  Now has more  vent holes at the very front of toe, which unfortunately lets in water when walking through dewey grass or shallow snow.  I may tape one or 2 of those vents closed.

I've got a high arch, and I've heard croc's are bad for people with high arches but these shoes are incredibly comfortable. Most of the pressure on my feet are the heels and the very end up of my foot, and with these shoes my feet feel great all day. I understand where people are coming from now when they say how comfortable they are. Other than that don't expect a fashion statement these shoes are fugly and are specifically comfort and convenience. (Looks good with scrubs, you might want to buy the crocs with a flat top though since most Hospitals won't let you have shoes with holes in them).

I was disappointed in the fit. actually too wide and a little short. I ordered my usual shoe size. Out of three different Croc shoes that I have purchased recently, this was the worst fit. It would help a lot if when ordering, there was more to go on to select a proper fit. Then there is the chance that you did not get the same manufactured shoe as was described. From reading other comments, I feel that my experience in buying  Croc shoe is very similar. Thus my three stars. I love a Croc, when it fits as described. I feel that I will no longer participate in this Croc hunting game in the future. I, unfortunately, do not live near any Croc shoe stores.

My foot lays in a position where it feels like the croc may slip off, unless I use the heel strap. Super comfortable, I actually wore them to Rolling Loud a couple weeks ago. I was standing for around 8-9 hours, and I typically do for work as well, but was given the same level of comfort as my work shoes. Very nice.

I read the reviews suggesting to order a size up and ignored them. I wish I didn’t. I am usually a size 6 in women’s (4 in men’s) shoes so that’s what I ordered, but I wish I ordered up even a half size. It is very close. Will probably exchange for a larger size. Besides that, I love them! Super comfy and convenient

I had bought another pair of crocs before for my husband to work out in the garden. He LOVED them and wore them till they fell apart. These are a new, different color but same style as before. They are amazing! We have tried other brands before as well, but crocs are great, non slip when pavement is wet, comfortable, wearable inside and out... GREAT! Love these and will continue to buy them each time they wear out.

I rated these 'somewhat large' but the sizing is the same as another pair that I love - there really is no problem in wearing jthem.  This contrasts with other brands where  an 8M ( my regular shoe size)  was a full 1 1/2 in too small.  The strap iin back keeps them anchored with no problem (a real consideration since I'm just recovering from a broken ankle).  I love crocs and wear them througout the summer with no socks.

I bought these for my girlfriend as she’s been wanting Crocs for work for so long! She works at a daycare and they are required to wear clean shoes inside the rooms. Rather than wearing and tearing gym shoes, some of her coworkers invested in a pair of Crocs dedicated to work only. She finally got her own pair, and now all of her friends at work went out and bought their own pair as well!
Perfect fit, and are super comfortable. They are easy to take care of and they don’t generally bite...their diet consists of socks mostly but every once in a while a pinkie toe might feel a nibble.

Unfortunately these don't fit my feet and I'll be returning them. I think the problem is that they are a Unisex style which may be wider than a normal ladies medium would be. Also, when trying to use the strap to keep them on my feet, my toes were shoved into the toe of the shoe which was painful when trying to walk.

I usually wear a size 7 shoe. I had a pair of crocs that I got 8 years ago that literally stood the test of time! I bought a size 6 womans and they fit perfectly. I love these shoes! They are super durable and perfect for the Florida lifestyle with the rain, beach, heat, etc. They shipped super fast and I was happy see the they were minimally wrapped bc Amazon LOVES to be wasteful with its packaging.

Super comfy! I normally wear a size 8, but the size 7 I got fit great. If they were any smaller though I would have to go to an 8. It depends on how much room you like. My toes do not touch the end so it is a good fit for me. Would recommend!
Fit great!  I used my old pair so much for practically everything that they became 'outdoor' Crocs.  I ordered this pair for my 'indoor' Crocs.

I received this shoe but they run at least a size large. The color is exactly as shown, very awesome. In my opinion, the material the shoe is constructed from is a slippery plastic and the bumps inside (on the sole) were rather sharp feeling as well. My friend had purchased some last year and they had a finish that resembled a plastic microfiber surface (much softer, non-slip and bumps are not noticeably uncomfortable).
With tile floors throughout our house, these crocs have saved my feet, back & knees. Purchased a few pairs extra for me & a couple pair for my husband. Work well for older arthritic bodies! 😂

These are so comfortable! I thought they’d feel like hard pieces of rubber, but it is a relief to step into them. I bought a half size bigger because I’d be wearing them with soccer socks, but with the strap around the back of my foot, it fits perfectly to my normal size. Love them!

When choosing a size, I am usually 8.5 shoes. Bought size 9 from Crocs which was too small. Then bought size 10 from amazon because the return policy is much better. The shoes fit this time. There is plenty room in the shoe for your toes and the strap at the back keeps your foot in the shoe if you decide to use the strap,  otherwise you can turn it up and use the crocs as sandals. The color is vibrant and price is great.

I am really impressed with these shoes. i had a really hard time deciding on which color to purchase, and I eventually went with the lilac and it is very beautiful. I would hands down buy every color if I could. These are the perfect shoe to throw on when leaving the house and running quick errands.

I ordered three pair of crocs, all with the holes as seen, in three colors. Of the three, this was the only pair that more or less fit my feet. The other two pair were far too tight across the instep (top of the foot) and I ordered bigger than I should have needed. I'd ordered these because friends and co-workers couldn't say enough good things, but I'm not convinced at all. I'm returning the other two pair.

I bought these for my son to wear when he does outdoor chores for me. He really likes them and says they are very comfortable. He likes the fact that if they get muddy he can just rinse them off in the outdoor faucet.

I bought these brown Crocs to replace a pair of black ones that were becoming slick on the bottom after 10 years of wear. I use these for rain shoes, gardening and beach shoes. The older ones, from the day I opened them, were sturdy yet felt like walking on clouds. The new ones are made of completely different material. Its plastic, but not much give or flexibility. They do not feel like clouds, but they will serve their waterproof purpose. Sized exactly the same as the old ones. The brown color kind of faded-looking.

These are a pretty noticeable color. These are so ugly I had to buy them.  They run true to size.  I wear a shoe size 16 5e, 16 fits like a glove.  Also,  the price is amazing.  I might buy another pair.

My feet and shoes don't live together very well.  With that said, I love my Crocs....especially in red.  They are my ruby slippers.  I like that I feel grounded in them.  I feel secure that I won't lose my balance.  My first choice is bare feet.  Since that is not always possible, Crocs are my second.

Love crocs! My old pair is getting smooth on the bottom which makes them unsafe to wear when it's wet so I bought a new pair. Love the color and they last forever. My first pair is over 10 years old and I still wear them!

I've recently had problems with plantarfaceitis and crocs seem to be an inexpensive solution to the problem. They have a major problem with inconsistency in sizing, however, and their "fit guide" is not particularly helpful. There is not croc store near me so online is the only way to go but it is so frustrating to order two pair of identical shoes and not have them be the same size.  I hate returning things, so much hassle and nothing to show for my efforts, so I am keeping them for winter wear with heavy socks. Wish I could count on consistent sizing and a helpful fit guide.

I have to admit I really find the classic Croc unattractive, but incredibly practical under the right circumstances.  I dislike it for an everyday, all day shoe, but great for the beach or gardening.  Of course, my kids love them.  I have slipped on my son's from time to time (we wear the same size) and they are comfortable to walk in, but slippery if the inside gets wet.  The back strap doesn't really hold the heel the way I think a back strap should.

fit like flip flops with the ankle strap in for forward position and they stay on solidly when the ankle strap is in the rear position, comfortable, light, breathe a lot better than the full clog models.

Too big for me. BUT - when my sister came from church to visit us, her feet needed a rest from her high heels, so I (intending to keep them for myself and wear with thick socks) loaned them to her while she was with us, and she loved and kept them! (smile) I should have bought one size smaller. I bought a women's size 8 and should have bought women's size 7.
I bought these for my Grandaughter for Christmas, she was so excited when she opened the gift.  She immediately put them on and loved them she wore them the next day to her basketball game.

I love these Cocs. The color is just what I expected. Even my friends at the grocery store noticed them. When guys like your "shoes" they must be good! I am already thinking of what color I will get next..:)

These are very nice crocs, my daughter loves them. Easy to slip on when you need to run outside, be in the garden, or whatever you are out and about doing. We love that we can rinse them off with the water hose and they will be ready to go next time.

My 13 year old daughter asked for a pair of these and I thought she was kidding.  Evidently the Croc is coming back in style.  She and several of her 8th grade friends have all gotten them.  Now she has asked for some jibbiz/charms to go in them.  She loves them and absolutely loves the grey color.

I usually wear a size 10.  Ordered 10's but they were far too big.  Exchanged for 9's.  They're a tad bit small but not uncomfortably so.  I wear them without the strap around the heal.  The couple times I tried they were too small because the strap pushes the foot a little forward.  They are a very comfortable shoe that I will never be caught wearing in public!

Don't know what I would do without my Crocs. I live in these.  I can walk for miles in them with no foot pain.  My husband has them too and he is diabetic which causes all kinds of foot problems, but he can always where his Crocs.

These clogs are absolutely fantastic!  I only wish I tried them sooner. They're light as a feather; it feels like I'm wearing nothing at all except for the foot support. I have really worn them almost everyday.

Yes I wear crocs.  Have you ever worn them?  These are my house shoes.  I wear work boots all day so when I come home I take the boots off at the door and slide on my crocs.  They are comfortable and light.

I have a great amount of difficulty finding comfortable shoes being one of my ankles is fused with pins & screws holding things together so not only is that foot a bit oddly shaped but because of all the trauma to my right leg, I am subject to profound swelling issues.  I am actually not sure about the arch support, but I also can't claim there isn't any, but since there was no option to be non-committal, I opted for the yes.  I do have a brace to wear on that leg with sneakers, but it becomes uncomfortable after a few hours and the clogs are light weight enough for me to use as an alternative both for several hours but also as a quick way to slip on to go outside to get the mail etc as I am mostly barefooted while at home.
So my cheaper camp shoes busted out after a year. Everyone I know uses these, so I thought I would jump on the band wagon. They are comfortable and easy to slip on. Sturdy feel.

I know Crocs are hideous but they are so convenient in the winter time when I have socks on and need to go outside. I ordered these as a replacement pair when my dog chewed up my originals. They're exactly what I expected. I will continue to wear Crocs with socks in the comfort of my home.

These Crocs are so comfortable, this is my second pair.  I ordered the first pair for gardening in the yards and loved them so much, I ordered a second pair to wear whenever.  I can stand for long periods of time and my feet nor legs get tired when I wear these shoes.

I got size 8 (normally wear 7.5-8) and normally get wide, if available.  I feared getting size 7 would be too small, but 8 is bigger than what I thought it might be.  Haven't really worn them for an extensive period of time but anticipate that they will be fine based on the previous ones I had.  The little nubs on the sole being new take some getting use to and may soften or I may become accustom to after wearing for some time.  My previous Crocs did not have this.  They will suit my needs for around the house wear.
Haven’t had a pair in years and almost forgot just how comfortable they are!  Got them on a Black Friday sale (4 pairs for the whole family) for $10-$14 a pair, what a great deal!!!

Finally got a new pair of Crocs , I would not pay that price they sale them for, but they were on the lightning deal for $ 18.00 that was awesome I would buy another pair if I could get them for that price ....... comfy  and that was just Sept of 2018

Unfortunately, I had to return this purchase.  I had ordered a men's size 9, which is is what I received.  Over the past 5 years, I have worn 3 other size 9 crocs of the identical style, and they all fit fine.  With the new pair, my foot was slipping all around and the crocs felt like they wanted to just fall off my feet.  When I held them up to an older pair, I could see that they were about the same length (maybe slightly longer), but they were clearly wider in the heel.  As a matter of fact the heel exterior of the old croc nested beautifully in the heel cup of the new one, but not vice versa.

I normally wear a 5.5 in women’s and ordered the women’s size 6 based on other reviews, they fit I would just personally prefer more room when the strap is down, if I wear the strap too long it starts to get uncomfortable. The quality is very nice though.
I love Keens for whitewater, but a kayak trip in Baja on the Vermilion Sea convinced me that these are the best choice for that kind of trip--ALL the guides and staff wore them.
Great clogs for the kitchen. I got them for my wife and she wears them every day when she does anything in the kitchen.

What can I say? They're my outdoor slippers, right on the front stoop, let me wander around the yard and even to the park and not track dirt into the house. And they're the same price as my old ones bought 5 yrs ago plus

I always like to have a fresh pair of these ready to wear when my current pair are reaching end of life. these are a must have for me during the summer months. Fit great and feel comfortable right out of the box.
Pros:

It is hard to rate these according to size, because the pair I received were defective. One shoe felt somewhat small, while the other was impossible to wear, because the strap was too short to stay behind my heel. Like other reviewers, I noticed these were made in Mexico rather than in China. I'm a loyal Amazon shopper and am hoping Amazon will take care of this, because either Crocs has a problem with their merchandise quality online - or these were knockoffs! These shoes didn’t feel right in general, so like other reviewers, I may decide to shop in a Crocs store instead of online.

These are super cute but huge! My current crocks are sized W 8-9 and fit beautifully. Since that size wasn't offered, I went with the 9, which I often go with in other shoes. These things fell off my feet! Way way way too large!!
I broke down and got a pair.  They're comfortable for stuff around the house and gardening, but I'm still not ready to go out in public in them.

Beware.  Fit appears to vary depending on the color you pick.  I bought these crocs in Navy last year and the fit was perfect.  This year I bought the same size crocs only in Khaki, and they are way too small.

I couldn't survive without my Crocs. I wear them all the time. They give fantastic arch support. My Orthopedic doctor wears them, too, and commented on how good they are for anybody who is on their feet most of the working day. I even wear them in the swimming pool. What a great invention. The only gripe I have is you never know what size you are really getting since the company lists the sizes in a number of different ways. My last pair were listed as size 12-13 M. This pair is the same model but did not list that size so I took a chance and got size12 M and they are a bit snug. They need a uniform sizing boss in charge.
These are my first pair of Crocs.  I have short, wide feet with a high instep.  The size fit perfect.  They're not as squishy as I was expecting.  Next time I'll try the 'Lite' version of Crocs.

My husband bought these for me after I have been stealing his to wear in our basement.  These are so comfortable to wear for hours every day and are even better on my feet that they are actually the right size!  Part of our basement is unfinished and where our washer/dryer is and also our woodstove so we head to the basement quite frequently every day.  It is great to have a pair of shoes that you can slip on pretty quickly and go.  My feet are ALWAYS sore at the end of the night as well and these seem to have good enough support that my feet aren't as bad by the time I go to bed. Very happy with this purchase!

Clogs beat slippers hands down! I wear them with socks most of the time I'm lounging around the house in winter and know I can wear them outside for brief errands and not have to change footwear. With the socks they're warm in winter; without socks in summer, just right. I even wear them boating and swimming! They float in the water if they come off. Great for when the water's bottom is slimy, pebbly or mucky. Virtually no maintenance and wear like steel.

I have a pair of crocs that I got as a gift. They're a couple years old now so I thought I'd get a new pair. The old ones were a size 7 and so are these ones that I ordered but to my surprise these were very snug in comparison to how my old ones fit. They had fit my fit exact with not much room move around. I had to return these for a size up.

I've seen people wear Crocs for years, but never considered buying them for myself. But, I need shoes that can get wet, and so purchased this pair. They fit perfectly and are very lightweight and comfortable!!! The bottoms have traction, so no slipping and sliding.  They provide the arch support I need. I would recommend them to everyone!

I bought these for my brother who is going to HAWAII and has always enjoyed his crocs--black and dark brown. Thought the Khaki would be nice for the warm weather. Unfortunately one of the shoes has an ankle band that seems to belong to a much larger size croc and it looks silly. ARRGH. He left for Hawaii without them.

Bought these for our daughter's birthday (weird, I know). She wore them the day they arrived and the strap broke on the left shoe in less than 3 hours.  Our kids have worn crocs for over a decade, and this is not normal.  Really disappointed.

I have neuropathy and ned larger shoes. So these are a good size for me. It took a day or so for me to get used to them, but now I love them. The inly peoblem I have is that my socks get pulled down into the shoe but I think that is because they are big on me.

My husband had a pair of these and he particularly liked them for feeding the cows and cleaning their stall because he could just rinse them off.  When we lost our home in a fire last year, we didn't grab his Crocs, so I just reordered the same style (thank you, Amazon, for making the reorder process so easy!  Looked up my order history and clicked "order again" and I was done).  My husband likes them!

Good price, nice color.  I was never a fan of these shoes until someone bought me a pair.  I had them for about 6 years until the bottom was so thin that a rock made its way through to my foot.  I walked my dog in them.  When the yard was muddy, I wore them, and after a quick rinse off, they are good as new.  Quick and easy to put on and take off.  Great shoe.
I love crocs because they are very comfortable. I have worn them off and on for years. I’m so happy I purchased a new pair as my old ones wore out but they gave me lots of use over the years.

My husband has worn out his black pair and needed some new ones.  I had to find the exact style as he has in the black to replace (same number of holes) and it was easy.  YAY for Amazon!  He loves these chocolate brown ones and finally agreed to retired his black ones.

The ugliest shoes, but really practical for camping, especially for a Boy Scout. Lightweight, dry quickly, can wear with or without socks. Perfect shower and campsite shoes. Roomy (and airy) for after the hiking boots come off.

Fits majorly large, last time I wore a size 9 men's shoe I was probably 12 years old. I understand they are meant to be worn with plenty of room for your foot, but I don't really like that setup...too floppy.
I usually wear a Women's 9/9.5. I ordered a size 9- they were to small, but the 10 fit perfectly and they are perfect shoes for after practice or school. I want a pair of Crocs in every color!
Crocs are some of the most  comfortable shoes on the market.  I teach middle school so when the students started wearing Crocs, I jumped in immediately and bought me a pair too.

I finally got to buy some real crocs thru Black Friday deal and was surprised my $6 knockoffs from Big Lots were way more comfortable! I wear US 7.5 and the instructions said to go down to a 7 cause they were quite roomy. My toes touch the ends.

These are better than the classic there not as soft but i still wake up with them on my feet. They dont squeek on vinal floors. The bumps on the inside really hold your foot from sliding. And being not so soft they last longer. And are only $2 more than 20 years ago. This is an honest product

These are great to keep by the door when I'm home in my house slippers and need to go out to pick up the paper, get the mail, etc. They're actually more comfortable than my slippers; so sometimes I leave them on inside the house. I've never worn them outside or for long periods of time; so I can't evaluate how good they wear or feel for all-day use.

I wish they made 1/2 sizes, but the size 11 works fine.  I really like how thick the sole is compared to the knockoffs I had before.  Night and day.  We recently hiked 32 miles in three days with backpacks on the AT (Appellation Trail) in the smokey mountains.  One of my friends wore Crocs the whole way.  I couldn't believe it.  I thought he was "the man".  Finally we traded, and I understood.  His sole was easily 3 times thicker than mine.  Until then, I couldn't understand how he could walk over all those rocks with just Crocs.  Now I understand!

Crocs are about the only shoes I wear due to my wide foot and particularly high arch. My last pair of crocs were a different style and they were considerably narrower. I was delighted that these were the comfortable width I was used to with previous pairs. I held back one star because the footbed feels thinner than it used to be... walking on a gravel path these feel more like a year old pair than brand new. Still, very happy.

There is a reason these funny looking shoes have been around for a while, they are really comfortable. I bought them to wear in the house, as an alternative to barefoot or traditional slippers. They are super comfy, with or without socks. Considering wearing them to work.
I use these for slippers in our Florida home. Walking the tile floors barefoot was killing my feet. These were recommended to me by my orotho doctor since I have a very high instep.

I just got new laminate flooring.  Wanted something I could put on and dump trash in alley and then kick off easily to enter the house.  These are perfect.  Glad I bought them and will be back for more.
You know, I’m not real particular about my shoes. However, they really should be roughly the same size at the end of the day as when you put them on in the morning.

The crocs were used but not marketed as “used.” The crocs have noticeable wear on the bottom of the soles indicating that someone else has previously worn these crocs. The bottoms were very dirty and the rubber was worn down were the heel strikes the ground. The tags were in the bag, but ripped off from the crocs. Very disappointed.

I have bought a lot of Crocs before from many different stores and these are the first defective ones I've received. The defective part was actually the sole of the shoe. Normally there are these little raised bumps all throughout the sole which allow for air flow under your feet and helps prevent sweating. But these Crocs I received had very very short ones almost like as if the shoe was heavily used or defective. Felt completely different than any other croc I've ever bought and like I had sweaty feet the whole time.

I prefer to wear shoes around the house; but I have "outside" and "inside" shoes.  These fit the bill for "inside" shoes.  I can wear them with socks (winter) or with out (summer).  They are great for using in the kitchen.  I  cook a lot and it's not out of the norm to get something on them.  A quick scrub in the utility sink and they are good to go.  I usually get a new pair every other year (they do get worn out).  Love the Garnet color!

I got rid of my ergo mat at my standing desk (I'm a telecommuter so no dress code issues at home) after discovering Crocs (and their knockoffs). These are nice and comfy. Love the neutral navy color. Fit was as expected, wider on my foot since unisex, but as advertised and ok since I wear with socks.
I ordered 1/2 size down from my usual size and they fit perfectly. Lilac color is very pretty but still fairly neutral. They look better than expected with jeans and are super comfy.

My fashionista granddaughter has decided that these are fashion forward and wears them everywhere. We got them to use as pre and post soccer practice and meets but they are going to the movies and out for wings and pizza too. Comfortable and easy to clean. Needless to say we are happy with this purchase.
Totally not the size it says they are. Not impressed

I LOVE these shoes and I liked them so much I bought my husband a pair (which he too loves and wears everyday!) ... Down side:  the little bumps (not sharp ones, they are little raised bumps) inside the foot bed bother him (even with socks) ... not so much that he won't wear them, but enough that I have to hear about it every day - lol ,
They fit perfect and as expected. They are not made of cheap material. My teenage daughter uses them daily, apparently CROCS are in style again, who knew.  They are durable and clean

My girlfriend had a pair of Crocs that I loved slipping on, so I decided to get a pair.  I wear an 11 1/2 or 12 in shoes normally, but she had size Women's 11 / Men's 9 and they didn't seem too bad on my feet so I ordered the Women's 12 / Men's 10 size thinking they'd be one size bigger and be perfect.  They weren't, they were too small.  Thankfully it was no problem to return them and order one size bigger.  I picked the tan/khaki color and haven't regretted it for a second.  We even use them for stream-crossings while we're backpacking, and they were fantastic!

First time trying Crocs and while they are super comfy, this pair is mega-huge!  I wear a 14 shoe but this thing fell off my foot, it was literally an inch too long, had to be a 16 or 17 size.  I had to send it back and buy their size 12's.

I was a little bit unsure about purchasing these because of some of the negative reviews.  I normally wear a women's 9 - 9.5 & although instructions for sizing said to go a size down on half sizes, I decided to go up.  (Personal preference - I just prefer a roomier fit.)  Very comfortable and not too roomie.  So glad I decided to go up on sizing instead of down.

Bought these to walk the dogs throughout the day (usually for 20 minutes). Also use them when watering plants/shrubs outside, getting mail, or throwing out trash.  More comfortable than flip-flops as they provide no arch support and you can't really walk fast in them.  Have not worn them longer than one hour.  They fit as expected b/c the description does say they run a little large.  I normally wear a 6.5 so I purchased the Women's 6 US.  You have to get used to the cushioning/padding inside.  They're textured with little plastic nubs that massage your soles as you walk. B/c I don't wear socks, when I take them off and walk on the carpet, there's a strange sensation on the soles of my feet. Not really a complaint, but I can see why it might not be ideal for all-day wear.

I love the Crocs, I have been wearing them for years for sore feet. I first saw them being worn by a chef on TV and thought they were rather unattractive but decided to try a pair anyway. Boy am I glad I did, they're super comfortable and with the fur lined ones I'm able to wear them year around. They are especially light weight and they do have arch support. In the summer I wear ones with vents in the top and sides, they're as light as flip-flops but offer protection for my feet.

There was a time when I might have been embarrassed to be seen wearing such a gawky shoe but having achieved the ripe old age of 66 those times are past. These shoes are very very comfortable, with great support for the entire foot. They do run a bit large so I think I could have gone down a half size. Since they are a clog, however, with the grippy bottom, I have not felt like they would slip off. A bonus that they can get soaking wet with no problem. Wish I had discovered them sooner

This is a roomy, comfortable shoe that I'm proud of so I gave it a 5-star rating. It's also easy to slip them on and off. I liked the price and free shipping which allowed me to save without waiting too long for them to arrive. These CROCS were made in Mexico and are a good fit as I expected. I recommend these to anyone who likes comfort and good fit.  My granddaughter works in an electrical plant which requires her to wear these shoes, so I recommend them to anyone who is required to wear them for work also. BTW, I don't believe these shoes are good for working outdoors doing yardwork as the soles are not intended for that purpose.

Crocs have become difficult to find locally and after a few years mine became slick on the bottom and dangerous to walk in on wet surfaces.  I fell twice stepping on painted parking lines on wet days.  I was happy to find a new pair on Amazon at a good price.

I bought these recovering from surgery, one of the only comfortable option after an achilles repair, still wear them around, not the coolest looking shoes but really comfortable on your feet. I don't like the strap across the back but they are easy enough to just pull off and could be re-attached.

Love these and love the hot pink color. My husband kept wearing my black crocs "on accident" - he wears out shoes quickly - so I decided I needed to buy a pair that would be obviously mine. They're exactly what you expect from crocs - comfortable, easy to clean, and pretty durable. This is my first pair in a vibrant color, and I really like it. It's fun and easy to find!

First Pair of Crocs I've ever owned. A little late to the party but omg are they amazing. The sizing is a little big but it's quite comfortable and I prefer it to be big rather than small. Very pleased with my purchase.
Paid $24.83 for a black pair that arrived within 2 days, in a factory Crocs plastic “ziplock” bag. Quality is impeccable. Couldn’t be happier!

Standard Croc - comfy and do the job they are designed for. Had to return the first pair as the straps looked as though they belonged on a pair several sizes larger. Exchange was made quickly and with zero problems.

I purchased these to replace a pair of these I got about 8 years ago. Obviously, these things last forever. These cost 4 times as much as they did back then, but who could complain about that when you figure the lifespan. I, finally wore the bottoms completely smooth, which becomes hazardous on wet cement. I don't remember the insides being this bumpy as the new ones, maybe I wore those off too. Fortunately the size imprint was still on the sole, making ordering new ones simple. Size 10 is still size 10.

Great color. Comfort and ease. Great for my plantar fasciitis! Wear in yard, during bad weather, and as a slipper. I have these in several colors. I'm a Croc fan. Knock 'em if you must but they're truly versatile. Lite Grey with hints of silver. Love the color!!

They're crocs....lightweight, waterproof (don't absorb water), but hideous.  These were the cheapest color available in my size.  If you're going to go with these ugly beasts, might as well rock the most ridiculous color available.....

I always made fun of crocs. Well now I'm eating my words because they are amazing!!! I bought them just for gardening but now I wear them for all things around the house/yard. I haven't tried running errands in them but I imagine they'd be fine because they are surprisingly comfortable. I am a size 8 1/2 & bought a 9 which is perfect. I couldn't wear smaller. My feet are very narrow yet somehow, the wideness of the crocs is not an issue. I will definitely buy them again in other colors.
I always hated Crocs... until I got my first pair, and now use them almost exclusively. The lazy person's daily shoe. LOL!!

These Crocs are very practical. I keep them by the back door to slip on whenever I go outside when the ground is wet and for washing the car. These replace a pair that I wore for over 10 years and they still were not worn out, so I am impressed with the durability of Crocs. Comfort is another issue - for all Crocs I have tried. I find them uncomfortable when worn without socks. With socks, they are OK, but without socks they rub my toes.

At first I did not think that I was going to like to ribbed inner sole, however it is very comfortable and messaging to tired feet.  I wear mine as a house shoe so I cannot comment on how these would be out on pavement or any other terrain.

My first pair of crocs.  I got them to work in the garden this summer so I can just hose them (and my feet) off before I go inside.  But I have been wearing them all the time.  I really like that I can have a heel strap when I want one, or not.
My niece wants us to take our shoes off while in her house.  I bought three pairs of different sizes of crocs which stay in her entry closet.  Whoever wants to use them just puts them on.

I love the classic clog. It has become my house shoe of choice. In the summer it's great because there are holes that keep it cool. In the winter, I wear thick socks to keep warm. I am a hairstylist and stand all day at work, so I need good support and something very comfortable to wear at home.  I usually get black ones, but got the cerulean blue this time. I love the color. I don't wear them out often, but they do look great with jeans when I do.
Bought these for my Mom. She has bunions and they fit over them. As well, she likes frogs, so got these and frog charms for them! Fun for her and comfortable!

The sizing on these is not consistent with other Crocs I have.  I ordered the same size (W9-M7) and pair I received was much smaller.  My old ones are a few years old, so I don't know if they've changed their sizing or if it was just this pair.  Other then the sizing, I really liked them and will order in a different size.
Love my crocks and more when they are on special! Great for living the pool or while cleaning the house. No more slippery sandals or shoes. Love it. Very sturdy product.
Much better than Flip Flop Type sandals. The strap helps to keep the Clog on. Intended use is the Gym Pool area and locker room.
Great quality good for house shoes better than slippers and also work great for road trips for my oldest son since he takes for-ever to put his shoes on and off in the car lol

As a person who loves crocs but only owns 2 pairs, these are so much fun! I love the bright color and how comfortable these are. I’ve been considering bringing them on vacation but I think I need a different color. My biggest complaint is I wear a size 10 in women’s and they’re always really pricy. Big footed women shouldn’t have to pay $50 for neon shoes, or any shoes.

Crocs are for some reason known to not be cool. But i wanted a good shoe to go fishing with that could also go into the water. Once I got them in the mail I put them on to see how they fit. 20 minutes later I still had them on. They were so comfortable! I dont know why people hate on them, but they are great! I will be buying another pair.

I've been looking for something easy to wear around the house and patio garden for quite some time and have always ended up settling for flip-flops which provide zero support. I've wondered about Crocs but have never tried them before. A friend mentioned she used them to garden in and I decided to order a pair. I'm very satisfied. They're comfortable, easy to slog on and off, and because of all the holes, my feet remain cool. The 9M is on the roomy side, but my feet are more wide than narrow. Still, they stay on my feet without use of the back strap. Good purchase!
Why a kid would want white Crocs I don't know, but surprisingly my kid has taken good care of these and they still look white. She wears them all the time!!

The quality seemed good.  However, the size was altered.  We ordered these to replace the exact same crocs we bought a year ago, but this pair was a half inch shorter in length.  We had to send it back and reorder a larger size.
I have a pair of crocs just like these Except for one thing they are 6-8....  WELL these are 6-8 and they are to small. I am hoping they stretch.

Of the size 8’s I ordered, the right shoe was noticeably smaller when wearing. Weird, because other crocs ordered in the past were fine. What to do? Order a 9? Wait awhile? Naturally the yellow was not available in size 8. Good grief I despise 1st world problems.

I bought these crocks for my 17 year old son. At the end of every school year, I bought my kids an end of the year present. When they got older, it was harder to figure out what to get. He said this was the best present ever! Yay me’

Needed a slip-on shoe as a gift. The heel strap on the Classic Croc flips up over the top of the shoe making them perfect for those who can't bend down to tie shoes. Perforations and Croslite material allow feet to breathe.
I'm very happy with my first pair so far.  The fit is big but I think that's the point, others have they will shrink a bit over time.
It's a pleasure to wear these, indoors and out. Surprisingly secure and stable. I often wonder how the price of a pair might compare with production costs.

Unfortunately I paid attention to all the reviews that said to order "up" a size. Well for me, that was way off.  I returned these today and ordered and already received a replacement pair in my usual and correct size; a woman's size 7.  LOVE them just as I do all of my Croc sandals.
I recently fracture my sesamoid bone and It was recommended that I do not walk barefoot around the house, so i purchased these.
