Husband loooved these shoes! He used it during Army training when he needed to shower and before bed. When he was done training, he loved it so much he would wear them outside as everyday shoes. My husband is 28 years old, usually wears Sperrys and basketball shoes so this tells you a lot about how comfortable these shoes were and how much he loved these shoes. I almost thought of buying a pair for myself =D

very comfortable. Not sure if got a size slightly too large, but from what i've read i guess they're supposed to be a loose fit (with the feet not touching any of the sides except the bottom and part of the top as you walk). Got these for wearing after long hikes but i think i'll get more use out of them than expected.

I love these shoes so much! They’re super comfortable and pair well with jeans, sweatpants, and athletic wear. I slip them on for running errands, primarily. They are very comfortable after playing sports or going on long runs. Just slip out of the cleats/running shoes and into crocs!

If you don't mind looking like a retard, these are the shoes for you. I wear these with some socks when I'm in my sweats and just want to take the trash out or go to 7-11 for some beer. Extremely durable material and will probably outlive me.

I used to give Crocs a hard time back in the day, but I finally gave them a shot for gardening, taking the trash out, etc., and now I see what I was missing! They're super comfortable and convenient.  I originally ordered them in my normal shoe size, and they were a bit big (mainly just too wide/tall over the top of my foot).  I exchanged them quickly and easily for one size down, and now they're great!
Great shoes, color is perfect. I feel like they do run a smidge small. I wear a 7 and they’re just a little smaller than I’d like. Next time I’ll get a 7.5. But I love them!

Superb all around except for one thing. When walking this thing gets so many pebbles stuck between your foot and the sandal you have to constantly keep taking off to get it out. Sooooooo annoying. It could be the way I walk but my under armour slippers I wore for 6 years barely did this.
way oversized.

I am currently 8 months pregnant and dealing with a lot of swelling in my feet. None of my regular shoes fit comfortably so a friend suggested ordering these. They definitely make the day more bearable. I did originally order a 9 which is my normal size and they just barely fit without socks so I returned them for a 10 and the fit was much better!

Hey they're Crocs. I got them for the gym showers  and steam rooms. Plus peddling around the house and yard. You can't beat them. I got the ones that water can escape easily and your feet can breathe. Easy to clean and easy on the feet. Highly recommend them.
They are disappointing for several reasons:

I may could have use a half size smaller but what I got is ok.  Maybe it's even better that the fit is a bit loose since they still stay on well but allow more air circulation.  I'm well pleased with the purchase.

I've worn Crocs for basically my entire life except last year. I was really missing having these obnoxious, rubber slabs on my feet, so I decided to order some. I don't think I've ever felt this happy before. THEY FRACKING ROCK!!!! I got the bright red ones in men's size 11, and while they were a bit large, they were perfect in every other aspect. Yes, they did change the sizing a bit, so they're very roomy, but I don't care. I love them! 10/10 would recommend.
The color is great and the fit is perfect. My feet love them! They are well worth the money and I would gladly do business with this company again in the future.
I like these better than winter slippers.  Can go outside without having to change from slippers to shoes.  Very comfortable.  Wear a 10.5 shoe and the 11 size fits just fine.

What can I say? I love my Crocs! I bought these to replace my old Crocs that just plain old wore out. I wear these with socks and without. I love the wide toe that does not pinch the toes in any way. I can wear these all day long with no fatigue. The color I choose was Neon Magenta and the color is bright and vivid. I get a lot of compliments on the color.

I wear slippers, and regular home slippers one buys for ten bucks tend to wear out rather fast and look rather pathetic. These are very good, light, convenient, and durable. Also, attach them to the outside of your backpack with a carabiner, and change into these comfortable shoes after a long day of hiking in boots.

I typically wear a size 8 in a wide width.  When I received the size 8, they was too small in length, but the width was fine.  I reordered 9s in that they don't come in 1/2 sizes. The 9 is too large and too wide, but not so much that I can't wear them.  Since I wanted these for around the pool wear, I can make do.  A bit disappointed, though, in that I love the color and they are very comfortable.

I really like the color and design of these crocks for my sensitive feet.  However, the little bumps inside against the sole of my foot takes some getting used to until they wear down a bit.  They fit good. I have wide feet with a high arch.  I like the color a lot more than the fluorescent type colors.

This is worth the price - this is my second pair of Crocs, and I've had two other pairs of the "off" brands to compair to.  My first pair of Crocs lasted 2 years of wearing them EVERYWHERE!!  The Brand X last 6 months for one pair and 9 months for another.  These are well worth the price.  Now, the comfort.  My first pair took me a bit to get used to the 'nubs' on the bottom...I had to wear socks for the first couple of months but with socks or without socks, they were the most comfortable - I took a trip with a Youth Group Geo-caching in San Francisco and if you've ever been geo-caching, you know that you walk and walk and walk - I must have logged over 6 miles in the 3 hours, up hills and down and my feet felt wonderful.  These are great!

For some reason my flip flops that I have been wearing the same kind for 15 years now kill my knees and back.  I switched to Crocs and am able to wear them normally.  These were a lot of fun for summer.  I've worn them to the water, parks, hiking, camping, wading in the river.  Held up great everywhere.  I assumed they would look grimy very quick, but they still look great!
Only down sides.. no half sizes, & yes they are ugly, but they ARE comfortable! Great for around the yard/house. Even more comfortable with socks, but not fashionable. 😆

My daughter had major foot surgery and couldn't find a pair of shoes that were comfortable I bought these just hoping she would be able to get a little relief from the pain. She loves them. Her foot doesn't swell like it was with other shoes. She said she felt like she was walking on air. Thank you gives this Mom a big smile ☺

I was not happy with them for this reason.  I don't know if it is the material used to produce this product, but it has a strange odor that is no very pleasant. Could just be a chemical reaction to my skin against it.  I am allergic to latex, but not sure if there is latex in this product.
I have short, wide feet and require high arch support. I use these around the house in lieu of house slippers, since slippers and/or house shoes don't have the support that I need.  Love them!

The size 6 is much wider than what I expected and I have a wide foot so that's saying a lot!  I  have a pair of Crocs I've had for YEARS! which I'm trying to replace because they are finally showing signs of wear.  I'll keep them and hope I can wear them; if not, I'll see if someone else can wear them.

Uncomfortable. I purchased them as replacement for my (very) old Beach Basics Crocs - and got disappointed. They feel like a cheap knock-off from very comfortable old Beach Basics ones. I can wear the new Crocs only with socks, because of rows of sharp spikes at the bottom hurting my bare feet. They seem to be example of overdone "innovation" - more fancy, more expensive but quite uncomfortable.

Having purchased four pairs, as well as trying on a few different styles at the local Croc's store, it's become painfully clear that the physical size and shape of Croc's clogs varies wildly from shoe to shoe even within the same style (even within the same pair!). Getting really tired of having to exchange these.

These shoes are not the most fashionable, but they are amazingly comfortable and functional for walking the dogs, working in the yard, or just knocking around. They may be a little wide for people with a narrow foot, but on my Fred Flintstone feet, they are awesome!

I wear a men's 13, but always have to size down 4 sizes with Crocs, I wear a 9 mens.  They will eventually stretch out to fit my foot exactly.  Beware if you leave them out in the hot sun they will shrink!

I struggle with finding comfortable shoes. I tried a lot of different shoes in preparation for a trip to Disney World. I ended up using these for 4 days and they were pretty comfortable, more so than my tennis shoes. I also like that they are waterproof, which came in handy during the rain.

Got a pair for myself and my wife.  Mine (men's US 13) fit perfectly; my wife's (women's US 8) were too large.  She normally takes an 8 1/2 shoe.  I returned hers and ordered a size 7, we'll see how that goes.

I am not at all impressed with these shoes. Like a few others I always thought they were pretty ugly. But I needed a new quick slip on to run to the bird feeder, run garbage out etc. So I thought what the heck found a good deal so decided to try them. They feel like hard plastic. Wore them for less then an hour and my feet were getting sore (had socks on). If I had paid more for them I for sure would be sending them back. But for under $20. they'll suffice. Good for when I need to wash garbage bins. I really don't understand the great reviews they are REALLY cheap shoes.

I bought the lined Crocs, and I'm enjoying them very much.  They do have a small arch support which is not something I would normally buy, but they are not bothering me as do most footwear with arches.  I bought a size 10 which is what I wear normally, but I am unable to wear them with socks as they are too narrow.  I don't mind wearing them barefoot, though.  Overall, a reasonable purchase.
Bought to use in the chicken coop for washing durability. Great but too big for me and my husband. We also have to wear socks due to the ribbing in the inside of the shoes.too rough

when the Crocs fit, I can wear them all day.  Very comfortable. The size I ordered originally was too small (I ordered a 9 woman's for my usual 9-9.5 shoe size based on previous reviews saying the Crocs ran a little large--wrong for me).  I got the next bigger size and they fit wonderfully.  The posting above about fit, how long I can wear them, etc. are for the too-small-for-me size 9.
The Crocs brand says it all. It’s a trusted name and has continued to be a quality product. The variety of colors makes for a good choice for both men and women.

Perfect! I have been trying to find a children's size 4 croc to fit my 9 year old daughter. I ordered a women's size 6 (based on shoes dimensions) which fits my daughter perfectly!! I am so relieved to finally find a pair of crocs that fits!

I bought these for not husband who was stationed in Afghanistan at the time. They had to walk 3.5 minutes to use the toilet or shower. He wore these when he showered and they were perfect because they weren't slippery and protected his feet. Since he has been home, he only wears then for showering at the gym. I personally thing crocs look ridiculous but their function for protecting feet while in a public bathroom is worth it.
I'm in my fifties, work in a factory so I'm standing and walking on concrete all day.

Bought these for hubby for Christmas to wear around the house and he says they are so comfortable and that it was his favorite Christmas gift. He even liked them more than his new smartwatch which is really saying a lot! I just ordered him another pair in blue because he wears these so much.
Bought for my granddaughter and she loves them. Fit just right, she wears them everyday to school as they are so comfortable. Arrived two days earlier than they said they would.
These are very comfortable, good for around the house or a run to the grocery store. The color (pepper) goes with more than I expected. I have wide feet and these are just right.

The size of this shoe actually matched the size chart! This is great news for those weary of buying shoes online without trying them on first.. These are the most comfortable shoes my achy feet have had in eons. Hey, don't knock the Croc! I am thrilled with my purchase! Seriously, y'all.
They were cheap so I will keep them, but they’re way too big even though the size is the right one.  They will be fine for doing some backyard gardening after a rain.

The two shoes were of different length. The right was a 13 and the left was a 12 even though they were both cast as 13s. They had to go back. Amazon made that relatively painless. One star minus to Croc and  full 5 to Amazon. As footnote I then purchased the same size direct from Croc and they both were of the same size. And the deal was 2 pair deal for a good price.

Fits like it should, as in the product description. i have a nice amount of room,as i have extra wide feet,i wear size 11 4E shoes.So you can buy these classic clog footwear, with no worry about it fitting your feet.
Have been buying crocs since their inception- this pair replaces a well worn pair I've had for years- price was right, loved the "pepper" red color  - their the best!

Bought these for my 10 year old daughter. They are slightly bigger than she needs but she's in between sizes (bigger than the kids sizes but not quite adult) so we knew the fit wouldn't be perfect. She absolutely loves the color and doesn't mind them being a little bigger than she needs. She's had several pairs of kids crocks in the past and they have always withstood everything. (She's not exactly a delicate girl.) Would definitely recommend if your looking for a durable, yet stylish, slip on shoe.
Works perfectly for me to slip on to run the dogs out the back door to our yard. They slip on easy and are loose, but not so loose that my feet slip around.

Classic Crocs still get the job done. Lightweight, water tolerant, easy to put on yet stays on your foot. My feet a wide and I appreciate the roominess of Crocs. The strap can be flipped up to make backless sandals or flipped down when you need them to be securely on your feet.

Love these--I resisted buying Crocks for a long time because they just weren't my style. Now I'm going to buy some slip resistant work ones. They really are comfortable. I always buy sandals a little smaller than shoes, and these I also ordered smaller.

My mom needed a pair of crocs as suggested by her podiatrist. As much as she hates the look of them, her crocs have definitely helped with her foot issues. These were true to size and my sister likes to steal them from my mom because it seems that crocs are making a comeback in middle school and high school.

These replaced some Crocs I've used as house slippers for over 10 years.  My old ones were an XXL size (they didn't come in shoe sizes back then apparently) and were a bit big.  These new ones are slightly smaller than the XXL's and they fit great.  They are a bit more narrow, but this keeps them on my feet better than the previous pair.  I expect to buy another pair in 2025 when these wear out!

The 13 was too small and the 14 was too large (and wide), until I threw them in the dryer on high for 3-4 minutes. After that they fit perfectly. Make sure you put them on and walk around with them before they cool completely (since heating warps them and you need to straighten them out). These crocs are great and I plan to wear them all summer.
This was a gift for my husband he loves them and wears them around the house.  He is very happy with the way they fit and how sturdy the material feels.

These shoes are very comfortable even with a toe bandage on.  They are well made and a good value for the price.  My only wish is for a material that won't make your feet sweat and still be easily cleaned.

As other purchasers have noted, the sizing of Croc brand clogs is off. I would guess that these and the pair of Croc Sport clogs are a full size larger than the number sizing would indicated. Because these are clingy to the foot, they don't shift around despite the sizing so we chose not to exchange for a smaller size. Previous non-Croc branded clogs we've owned shrank over time, especially when exposed to a lot of sun so it is possible that Croc brands do the same and account for the generous sizing. Overall, the build quality is quite good and these Crocs are comfortable.

There is nothing wrong with these shoes other than I didn't care for the style of them.  They are just too wide looking for my likes.  They were super comfortable.  I ordered a different croc that is more narrow and I was happier with them.
Love the softness and they are so comfortable. I love them for camping, Hiking, Canoeing, around the house trips to the lake and so much more.

I am not allowed to wear these around the house, or anywhere without public ridicule.  That being said, they are fantastic shoes for back packing!!! Light weight, and great for river crossings when you want to keep your boots dry.  All the holes let your feet dry out quickly, the heel strap keeps them from being washed down stream, and your toes are protected from rocks.  They also make great camp shoes.  My buddies bought the camo ones, but I wouldn't buy something harder to find than you need.

I suffer from plantar fasciitis,claw to,etc.Tried numerous products for foot pain.Crocs are hideous looking but as soon as possible I get out of my composite toe work shoes and put these on.Since I started wearing them the pain in  my feet is greatly reduced and my feet no longer cause me to wake up at night

These shoes are so comfortable. Easy to kick off and slide on. Washes up in a snap, mud and dirt down the drain. The bright pink color is beautiful. Crocs are an ugly style, but their comfort, durability, and convenience far outweigh that!
It’s really cute and fits great, make sure you get a size bigger than your exact foot size if you want to wear the strap I put cute little croc charms on them

These were a little shorter than the off brand crocs but fit perfectly. The back band is shorter than the back of shoe but fits perfectly. My wife has wide feet and they do fit well. We looked on EBAY for them but used pair of crocs was only ten dollars cheaper with shipping amount and Amazon was free shipping for prime. Will probably buy a couple other colors in the next month.
Most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. But beware, they shrink when exposed to heat. Order at least one size up if you plan on wearing them outside or leaving them in your car in the summer.

I have been ordering size 6 for years and they have always fit perfectly.  I ordered two new pairs and they are both too small.  I suggest ordering a size up.  Not as roomy compared to my older pairs.
Bought these for great grandson he loves them. He is now soon to be 17 and he has worn crocs since he was four he has and will always love his crocs.

These Crocs are super comfy and durable, and they are easy to clean. The holes allow air to circulate, so your feet stay cool. I would highly recommend them if you are looking for something to use in the garden or for chores around the house.

i use these as slippers for around the house. i love them! they dont get all nasty from sweaty feet & they don't get worn out the way woolly slippers do.  i like that i can wash them off if i need to. and since they are ventilated even if i use them with socks, my feet don't get hot

Very comfortable, but I regularly wear an 11.5... 12 is a little too big but I was concerned that the 11 would be too small...  However, perfect for slipping on quick to take the puppy out in a hurry which is why I bought them.  Very pleased with the purchase...

These things are great! I’m a Hawaii Marine and when we train on the big island our showers are outside. It’s an adventure to get to them, as it’s a cold, rocky way to them. Gone are the days of broken floppy flops. Gone is the imminent threat of nasty water invading your feet. Gone are the stubbed toes from stray rocks. All my friends are jealous I see it in their eyes. 10/10 would buy again.

The first pair I had were a knock off brand and I got these hoping they would last longer. It's been at least a year and they have. I mainly wear these around the house and the patio. I have bad knees and the cushion in these really help. They are really light weight also. Barely seems like you are wearing anything. I like wearing them while I'm cooking (careful of hot liquid, won't protect from burns) or doing dishes. Also good when you have to be on your feet a long time cleaning and vacuuming. Not good on hot days. Wear with socks if you plan to wear them all day. The grip on the sole is much better than the off brand ones. Still won't wear them on wet ground after slipping badly with my old ones. I do use them as pool shoes though. Buy them a little bigger than you would think because if they are too tight and you wear them without socks you can get blisters easily. My friends kid wears these all the time and he gets blisters because he runs in them. The off brand ones I originally bought i told myself they were for gardening. After slipping a few too many times and being freaked out by bugs crawling in the little holes and I don't use them for that anymore. I have been told many times how ugly these are and i tell the people to try mine on and see how comfy they are. They agree and then say not to wear them in public ha ha.

Overall great quality however the strap on each one is a super different length than the other which is kind of annoying, as if you use the straps one is too tight and one is good. Overall love them, color really matched the photo, and great to wear around my dorm.

Okay so yes these are probably the ugliest shoes ever created, but who cares? I had a gift card and thought "girl, treat yo self!" so I set out to find the comfiest shoes I could since I walk across my college campus everyday (and YES I plan on wearing these in public). The ugly things arrived and I slipped my feet into them and felt as though I was walking on clouds. Nothing could bring me down because they were so comfortable that they actually started looking good in my eyes!! Now all of my friends are buying them and I'm the most popular girl in school. All thanks to the butt ugly crocs!

I love these shoes.  they are inexpensive and wear like steel.  I had a pair of black Crocs that I wore to work, wore on the boat fishing, wore to a couple of formal dinners (who looks at peoples feet?)., and use as slippers.  My feet are very sweaty but my Crocs are NEVER hot, never smelly, hardly wear and soft and subtle.  What an incredible invention and wonderful accessories for my aching feet.

I've never had a problem with the classic clog fitting before, but I can't even get my feet all the way into these shoes!  They are too narrow. It is doubly unfortunate since these are the only shoes I can wear without my feet hurting.

These things are awesome and the price is great. I have already worn them in the rainy pacific NW, Haiti, Nicaragua, I figured I would need to throw them out by now but they are holding up great. Probably going to order more as Christmas gifts, and gifts for myself.

I am not fond of the flexible piece at your heal which used to be firm on the old models. It ends up twisting frequently. My other complaint is that crocks in general expand and get bigger after a few weeks. I have found that putting them in the hot sun helps to shrink them.

LOVE this color! My husband has crocs for hour shoes and I thought, "eh". But slipped them on and did a few chores and knew I needed my own pair. Comfy! I love that you can just rinse/wash them off if they get yucky unlike normal house shoes. This color is even prettier in person!

I live in Crocs, as almost all other shoes hurt some part of my feet.  I liked the shine of these, rather than the dull finish I am used to.  My friend had crippling arthritis in both feet.  She had to give up all walking.  Her podiatrist told her she could not wear any shoes, ever, other than Crocs.  After she did that, she was able to resume her very long walks.  With that as an example, I wondered if Crocs would work for me - and find that they do.
My wife likes her crocs almost as much as my dog does. I bought these replacement pair since the dog installed many more ventilation holes in her old ones.

Loved the product! Ordered women's size 7 for my wife's birthday. She wears women's size 6.5 and the 7's were way too big. For half sizes I would suggest going with the smaller size, unless if you plan on wearing lots of socks. Returned and reordered. Thanks Amazon!

I have worn heels most of my adult life and my feet are finally retaliating. I have been wearing flip flops around the house but the soles were too thin and I was sick of something between my toes, so I took the leap and purchased some crocs. I am so happy with them- perfectly comfortable, easy to slip on and off, my feet don’t ache, fantastic for wearing around the house/yard. (Don’t let me lie to you, I’ve also worn them to the store and other errands)

I have ordered Crocs before (about five years ago) to wear outside while working in the yard. They are great for that purpose - when you get ready to go back in the house you can simply hose them off. My old Crocs had worn down to the point where they were so smooth they could be slippery on a concrete floor, so I decided to order these . Since I loved the old ones, I tried to get the exact same shoes. My old ones were made in Mexico so I ordered the ones that were also made in Mexico in the same size.  The new ones were a lot stiffer and somewhat smaller. I can still wear them but they aren't as comfortable or as well made as the old ones.
My husband wears these in the kitchen because we have triplet 2 year olds that throw food on the floor constantly and it hurts his feet!  They are easy to clean and very comfortable!
My husband wears these everyday . they are cimfy and last long he does a lot of walking. They lasted about 2 years with heavy daily use. He is on his second pair and the price was competitive

Love the color (garnet). I wear a size 9 (women) and these DO fit but more like an 8.5 fit on me. If I order these again, I will definitely order the next size up. Everything else, though, is what I have come to expect from Crocs.

I really like the shoe. It feels a little short, but it might be that I'm not used to clog type shoes? I'm going to keep this pair and order another pair one size larger, so I can compare. It's a great product. I plan to have a pair for home & a pair for work.

These Classic Clogs are a staple for summertime, and I was able to purchase these for 1/2 price from Amazon! As usual, they fit true to size yet are roomy enough for my feet to breathe. The cutouts provide plenty of avenues for airflow. They are comfortable enough for me to walk in them all day long. They're not as cute or stylish as some of the other Crocs styles, but I can slip them on easily for quick errands or outside work so they're very practical. I just replaced my first pair, which were almost 10 years old, so they are durable as well.

These fits as expected & seem comfortable. This is my first time buying Crocs because I was looking for a new type of shoe to wear around the house rather, than flip flops or western boots, so Im trying these. The sole has a bumpy texture, which im not used to, but if I can get used to that I think these will work great. The plastic on the outside seems decently solid while the inside is semi spongy & comfortable. Since im rough on my foot wear this is a bonus. Hopefully these will last a little while!

Absolutely love it! Except one point, it gets slippery inside the Crocs when wet ... so expect to slide out of them easily which is somewhat tricky ... but definitely need to buy more pairs :D ... but they're light and until now durable, a bit soft on the toe part, where the crocs could be harder above all in bigger sizes like mine ...
Love these, husband thinks they look stupid but whatever I'm comfy.  Bonus they are easy to clean if you step in mystery messes left by pets, toddlers and babies.

I normally wear 8-8 1/2 shoe size.  I tried some clogs size 8 on and they fit my feet perfectly.  My feet are a little wide so these may be a little wide for some people.  They provide great support for my feet and I love how light they are.  I am glad there are holes in the uppers of these shoes.  Without them they would be to hot to wear.  I am completely unfashionable since I always wear socks with mine.  I don't care if people cringe when they see me in them.  That is better and less disgusting than letting my feet sweat all over in these things.
While I LOVE crocs normally, these are quite narrow. Bummed out. Thoroughly bummed.
I ordered my size but they are to small and hurt my feet. I can’t wear them. I have 2 other pair that cost more and they fit fine, are very comfortable.

I am annoyed be because this is too close on my feet to be a 9. They fit exact and literally has no space/room for toe wiggle. I am in a next country so I can't even send it back. They need to  start making these on half sizes
Ended up getting two big blisters on the side of my feet where the rivet for the strap rubbed. Not worth it at all. Nursing blistered feet is not my idea of a fun vacation.
my daughter is an 8.5, purchased these because they were a women's 9, they ended up swallowing her feet.  Returned and purchasing a different size, hopefully they will fit.

You can't beat the classic clog for comfort.  I'm on my feet a lot in my work, and my feet stay comfortable throughout the shift.  I like to wear a gel insole in them for a little extra padding, and that makes them even more comfortable.  The only downside I find with these shoes is that as they age and the little nubs on the bottom wear off they become very slippery on certain surfaces.  Other than that, they're the perfect shoe for someone on their feet a lot.
These can be genuine crocs . I’ve had them for maybe a week and they are not sturdy at all. It’s as if they’re stretched . Non of my other crocs have done this

Bought 7M size as a Christmas present. The giftee is a 7.5 and it fits her quite close. If you want extra space go for a half size bigger. But would get whatever your regular shoe size is. If you buy mint green it’s just like the picture.
Purchased for daughter for our Disney World trip. The 7’s were a bit too small and the 8’s a bit too large. They are okay and she didn’t complain much with 7 days of walking.

When I first saw them, I thought - Oh no, they are too small. I put them along-side my old crocks and the new ones were almost 2 inches shorter! But before repackaging, I put them on. These new crocks fit like a glove!! So if you've had your crocks for a long time, I suggest they may have expanded, as mine did. Time for these new ones that come in lovely colors and actually fit your foot once again. I also love having the good grip on the bottoms.

I was having problems with left ankle pain - to the point that the burning would keep me awake at night. All those years of commuting by bus and train took its toll. My podiatrist recommended I get some Crocs to wear around the house. I am now pain free. I had the tendency to go barefoot when I got home, liking the freedom of "free feet". With Crocs, my freedom is not inhibited and I don't know what I would do without them. Immediately on taking off my street shoes and stockings, I slip into my Crocs and don't mind them at all. Thank you, Dr. Daley and the Crocs people. I am now OTC pain killer free.

I have ONLY worn them once, ONLY IN THE HOUSE, out them right back in the bag. They're too big, don't look good on the feet.Just not like the other  CROC shoe products that I have. purchase was disappointing, which I RARELY say, but it's true.Sorry.

Love these . I bought the navy and they are awesome . They are well made, fit perfectly and could not be more comfortable  .  I have a problem finding a toe box that allows room for my bad baby toes .  These are perfect for me and my problem feet . They have good cushion for walking too . I will get other colors . A great purchase .

I usually buy from a Croc store and am disappointed with the fit of these.  Comparing the soles with the ones I've been wearing, these are definitely smaller.  Not really sure how that works, except maybe it's because they are sold as "unisex" instead of regular "men's" or "women's".

Wear these at work, at my desk, so my feet don't get sweaty in my work shoes. Got blisters for the first couple weeks and the bumps on bottom bothered me for the first two days but no problems now. Have had for about a month or two. Stand at my desk all day and can't complain. They do what I needed them to do. Support my feet and prevent the nasty sweat from closed shoes.

You know, these look like Crocs.  Beyond the fact that they are cosmetically blech, being chunky and rubber, they are absolutely the most comfortable thing to wear.  I purchased these as house shoes, and have been enjoying the lovely squishy insoles.  I would not recommend these for any style purpose, and I don't think I will ever wear these out of the house, but they are soooo much more comfortable than flip flops.  For beauty, I would purchase another Croc style, but for just bumming around the house, this style was the best price.

I wear these everyday! I am in high school and I absolutely LOVE these crocs! I bought the lapis color and it is gorgeous! I have been looking for crocs that I like for a very long time. Since crocs are in demand right now, BUY THEM if you have a chance. They fit perfectly, I can wear them with socks or without, and they look pretty good too! PLEASE BUY THESE THEY ARE AMAZING!!!

I have progressive MS and can no longer keep flipflops on my feet, so I finally tried crocs.  OMG these are wonderful. I can go out in the yard and back in without any problems on any surface.  And, because of the strap at the back, they will never fall off of my feet due to my condition.  Also, I can wear with or without socks.  Love them.

This is my second pair of these crocs in the last year. I wear them while swimming in our tidal creek behind the house. I don't know what happens but I keep losing one every summer and it is always the same foot. Anyway, I ordered these, they are the same size I have always worn but they feel kind of small. If I bought another pair I would go up a size. My big toes are rubbing but since I only war them for this one purpose they are fine. I do like the holes and the way they drain when I get on the dock.
What can I say they are Crocs amazingly comfy. Great to work in, and when my feet swell they are still comfy. Love em. Just a little powder in the summer heat. I live in the South so we know hot.

The shoes fit OK but slightly snug compared to my older pair but really my older pair is probably stretched somewhat. The 4 stars is b/c I got the brown pair and the color makes the shoes look like they are dirty all the time! Just don't get the brown pair....

Come on they are Clogs and they work great. Awesome quality! They seem bomb proof to me. I owned and used a pair of Clog "knock-offs" for a year and a half, and destroyed. I think I used them with holes in the bottom for at least half the time. So these seem like an amazing product. Just wish I would have come up with this idea.

I ordered the exact size that I have been wearing for years.  I thought they looked smaller, but figured that the old ones had just sort of stretched out and sagged a bit, but then I compared the length of the sole. Definitely a difference in size.  I'm wearing them for yard work, as I did my old pair, but not sure if that's a great idea, given that they are a little small.  They are soft, so they are not uncomfortably small.
These are our go-to shoes around the house. Stone floors and old-people feet aren’t a good mix but these are super lightweight and very comfortable.

Not as comfortable as my old ones but I suspect the worn ones have conformed to my foot. Good to have and I will start to break them in soon. I have to say that crocs come as close as any item I've ever owned to being immortal.
What's not to love about crocs? Convenient, comfy, breathable. I wear these in the yard and for quick errands. Great for travel too.

I bought these for my daughter who absolutely loves crocs.  She says these are amazing & she wears them to work every day.  (She is a traveling vet tech & is on her feet all day, caring for lots of pets in lots of places!)

I have arthritis in my feet and had been living in open sandals. These give enough room so there is no pain but yet protect my feet but it is best wear socks with them. A life saver! This is my 4th pair. The colors are really cool too.

I have these same Crocs (Unisex Classic Clog M8/W10), but in a different color.  While the size I ordered was marked the same size as the Crocs I already wear and love, the Crocs I received are about 1/2 - 1 size shorter.  I also ordered several other pairs of Crocs in the size I currently have, but in different styles than the Unisex Classic Clog.  I had the same sizing issue with all the other styles I bought.  Has Crocs changed its sizing even though the size chart indicates I purchased the correct size?  Crocs, your sizing consistency would be helpful and appreciated and my review would have been 4 stars if I had received what I was expecting based on past purchases.  I had to return all four pairs of Crocs I ordered.  I'm hesitant to reorder in a larger size, but will try at least one more pair before I go to another brand.

I love the shoe, but the sizing is ridiculous.  I normally wear a 10M or 10.5 in regular hiking shoes.  I ordered these in a 9M, but they fit like 11W.  So I ordered a smaller size.  The bag these arrived in were marked that were the "Roomy" version.

I ordered one pair, and literally got two different sized clogs. The left fit, the right was uncomfortably small. They are visibly different sizes--I compared them side-by-side and sole-to-sole. I returned them the same day.

Ordered these for $9 less the first time. I had to send them back because they were too small. I did not mind that I had to send them back. They provided me with a label and returned my money. There was no option to exchange the produce for a larger size so I had to reorder the product a second time paying an extra $9. I ordered a size up and they fit the exact same as the size below! Now I have to send them back a second time! Nice shoe, but it is not worth the hassle of trying to find the right size.

Love my Crocs! I am a daycare provider, so Crocs are the perfect shoes. I wear them into the classroom when I am doing meal prep or clean up. I work with toddlers, so all their food seems to end up all over my shoes! With the crocs it's no problem, I just simply rinse them off in the sink. They fit the same as all my other shoes. They might not be the most flattering, but they work great for me.

My crocs arrived promptly, much sooner than I had anticipated. At first I didn't realize the Cayman was a modified version of the original Beach clog. Modified in the sense that it is made to stay on your foot more snugly, probably for aquatic use. If you find them to be a little too tight, its easy to fix. Pop them in the dryer for about 3 minutes. I tossed in a towel to cut down on the noise. Don't go over 3 minutes, though! Have some socks on your feet, pull out the Croc Caymans and put them on your socked feet. Stretch them just a tiny bit with your feet and let them cool. They should fit much better after this!
I bought a different model of Crocs at the store that fit perfectly. These are MUCH TOO SMALL IN THE TOE...and are not returnable. the overall fit seems too small as well.

Bought them for my boyfriend as a gift and he loved them. He says they fit him perfectly. He usually wears 11 1/2 in shoes & boots but the men's size 10 were perfect for him in width and length! The dark navy blue color was exactly what he wanted, too.
I love these crocks.  I have neuropathy so it is hard to find comfortable shoes.  But the crocks are very comfortable.  I just wish they had half sizes

Inconsistent sizing, at least on those made in Mexico. We were looking for next size up to replace previous pair for a fast-growing teen. The size W9/M7 is identical to W8/M6, both made in Mexico, with the strap being shorter than before. Inconsistent sizing makes it virtually impossible to buy online. This model is called Classic and is supposed to substitute for Cayman, but the sizing is all wrong. The ones made in China seem to run larger, but you do not know the origin of the pair that will be shipped.The actual Crocs store might be currently the best option for proper sizing, unfortunately. The only reason I am reviewing is to spare the same hassle and disappointment to other customers.

I love Crocs, and I bought these especially to work outside.  But I don't know about the unisex sizing.  I am usually between a 6.5 and a 7.  These 7's pinched by toes quite a bit.  But still much better than anything I've ever worn on my feet, and love that I can hose them off before I go inside, and when my feet are hurting, I can even wear them in the shower!
My 20 year old daughter wears these shoes all the time. They are cute and comfortable. They clean up well when they get dirty. They seem to be well made and are holding up well.

I looked at a crocs pair I own which was size 8 women so I thought they would be the same.  WRONGE They are more like size 6 women not 8.  These run very small. Measure the length of your foot before ordering.  Returning them.  They don't carry the wider size not reordering.
LOVED the price ( less than $10 on cyber Monday) and per croc usual, quality has been great. Purchased for myself to throw on and run outside to car, take dogs out, check mail, etc.

What's not too like about crocs? They last forever.  Sizing has changed since I bought my last pair as they used to be mens 10-11 now it is size 10 or 11. I think I read somewhere on crocs website if you wear a half size to order a size down.  The size 10 fit well.  My suggestion would be to try them on at a store and then order them on amazon as the price is better.  This way there should be no sizing issues. I think I paid $23.75 for my current pair and the prime shipping is always nice.

I'm an 8 1/2 and I bought a size 9 and they fit PERFECTLY. I just love how versatile AND comfortable they are. AND with the added bonus of protecting my virginity, I couldn't have gotten anything better!
I love Crocs! I always get the the Classic Mule and they always fit consistently. These ones were more blue and less grey blue (as pictured) but still good looking and comfortable.
Great product. Just as described. However, my son wears a men’s size 11 us shoe and these crocs purchased & displayed as a “Men’s US Size 11(M) shoe”, is definitely NOT ACCURATE!

I've stubbed every toe in my arsenal dozens of times since my purchase.  Do you know why I'm here and able to talk about it without writhing in pain? It's because of my Crocs!!!  OMAHGAWD!  Great fit and perfect protection for all of mah dawgs.
These are comfortable and perfect for working outside or standing long hours on hard floors. They are easy to clean and durable.
Needed a roomy shoe to be worn with socks for sensitive, painful feet.  Have a smaller, older pair.  Have worn out many pairs over the years.
Bought these for my 9 year old son who wears a youth size 4 shoe, fit great. I did notice these Crocs are more slim/narrow than a pair I have.

I returned these.I wear a 9.5 womens and ordered a 10 which is the size of the ones I own.  , Also said made in Mexico like my pink ones but unfortunately returned them because they were HUGE and floppy.  May reorder in a 9 instead but haven't yet.  bummer
Original Croc’s don’t disappoint. Have purchased Dawg brand in the past. Keep coming back to Croc’s. They seem to last longer and for more comfortably.
We ordered size 13 for son; he wears 12-13; were a little big; so reordered the 12; fits fine; we love crocs; saved our hurting feet several times .

I like crocs for work.  I am on my feet all day.  These don't have any cushion, so they aren't going to be the most comfortable shoes ever, but after a day on my feet...they don't hurt.  I have been wearing crocks for 5 years now.  I used to have plantar faciitis, really bad....I haven't since wearing crocs.  I have tried to go to a more attractive, cushioned shoe, but within two days of wearing them....my plantar faciitis returns, not bad, because I immediately start to wear my crocks and it goes away.  So I have given up and am only going to wear these to work.
This was a gift for my son's girlfriend who has a pair of white Crocs but wanted this particular color pink Croc, which was hard to find at a low price.

I love my crocs!! I wear them in the yard, around the house and even bring them backpacking for water/camp shoes! They are great because you can wear socks with them. Great quality, hold up well. Love the versatile strap- they can be slip ons or more secure. Yeah, I've even worn them gambling. Wut up.
These are my teenage daughters new favorite!  High Quality, she wears them everywhere, inside and out, and she claims they are COMFY

These fit on the big side.  Great for kayaking and working around the house.  We have a Croc's retailer here locally and they were asking $65.00 for these.  Figured I couldn't go wrong at the $18.00 price tag.  They are comfortable and serve their purpose.
These are great for summer yard work because they can be rinsed off with a hose and left to dry on the porch.  I have wide feet and Crocs fit great, leaving me plenty of room in the toe box.

This classic croc is the best one for my foot problem.Have very high arches and use orthotics.These crocs replace slippers ( that have no support) in the house.The crocs are supportive in the arch area and comfortable to wear all day.I wear a woman's 8 1/2 wide in regular shoes and find the men's croc size 7 fit the best.Would buy the classic clog again.

Until I bought a pair and slipped my feet into them, I could not imagine why anyone would wear something so ugly. Well, now I know. Wow! They are great and the perfect shoe for wearing around the house. I have posterior heel pain, and it appears the shoes are helping.

Aside from being a bit large, I like these "shoes";  I wear them daily.  They seem to be well made and they're comfortable.  As a note, I like the rough insoles because they prevent my feet from "swimming around" in the crocs as they did in some knock-offs I bought a few years ago.

Love Crocs for wearing around the house and was glad to find larger sizes available here.  Had navy colored ones last time and this time I decided to try the khaki.  I like the color and they are very comfortable.  These will last so much longer than the cheap knock-offs and I would recommend to anyone.

These are “roomy” fit, very wide and don’t Stay on my feet like my old ones that apparently were “standard “. Who knew they have 3 fit types, be sure you get what fit you want.  You have to  Search the info for the fit type, they should make it more obvious.

Excellent delivery by Amazon. However in case of Crocs one must first try it before buying. May be u can visit a nearby store to check ur favorite model before ordering online. It's a comfortable product but it's wide which slightly feels uncomfortable when u go for some longer walk. Moreover it catches dust a lot.
I have several pairs of Crocs and these are supposed to be the same size, but they aren't.  They are on the small side.  I kept them because I can wear them but my feet are cramped.

This is my third pair of Crocs.  First two bought at retail store. This pair bought on line.  Always an 11.  Ordered these as 11 too.  They came.  Great quality.  Fast shipping.  Just too small.  Held them up to my other 11s and there was a clear size difference.  Went to Crocs store and they exchanged for me with no problems.  The store claimed of a few other people bringing back on-line purchase for small sizing to exchange.  Everything good now.  Just a bit of a hassle.
These shoes are great! Bought as a gift--but received high praise from the recipient (who can be quite picky.) Highly recommend! Will buy again!

These are my absolute favorite shoes. Very  comfortable easy to slip on and off. I can wear them out in the garden and give them a quick rinse before heading inside. I also love wear them to the gym they are the perfect shoes to wear in the showers and on the pool deck. I would  definitely recommend these crocs unisex classics.  And will be purchasing more.

Size 15 is my normal size, but for these CROCS size 14 or even 13 would be a better fit for me. I think they are a little overpriced since the resin material they're made of is pretty thin .. The material probably costs the company 50 cents. But...they're pretty comfortable and I use them for slippers in the house....

bought these as a Valentine's gift for my kids. lemon yellow for my daughter and denim blue for my son. they love the bold colors, the fit, and the comfort. I am a chef and wear black crocs to work in do I know they are comfortable, durable and easy to clean.

I was so relieved when my Crocs arrived. I have such big problematic feet that I was worried that M might mean they wouldn't fit. I am using them for my wedding shoe. Going to bling them up but rest assured, I will be comfortable! This is my second time around and as a bride who has been there done that....comfort is the only way to go! :)
I don't understand why my 12-year-old wanted these. Is normcore still a thing? The upside is, these are the only shoes that don't stink and can be literally hosed off. I'll reserve my judgment.
Do not order a size up.

Awesome shoes. Adjust the swiveling back securing foot strap and you can wear it all day like any other sandal. I've tried very hard to make them slip off and I couldn't get them to slip off accidentally. Leave the swiveling back securing foot strap towards the front of the shoe and you have a quick and easy slip op show or sandal. The shoe's design is very airy. Obviously you feet will get cold on a cold day, but it's refreshing. I would buy it again, but it's unlikely that'll i'll have to buy another because the Crocs feel solidly built and durable.

I NEVER thought I would own a pair of crocs but after my husband got a pair for working outside our house he talked me into getting a pair as house shoes. I couldn't be happier :) I have the white pair and I wear them every day around the house cleaning and to go outside with my son while he plays and they are still nice and white even after months of wearing them. They clean up nice and easy.

Very comfortable. Helped to seriously reduce discomfort & lower back pain from standing and working in my home kitchen for long hours. I love to bake and cook. These shoes helped me to continue to do what I love. Took a couple of days to get used to these shoes. At first seemed slightly big for my feet, even with socks on. Now, I can't live without them. I wear them indoors only. Highly recommend! Will by another pair.

Initially I couldn't wear the shoes for very long because I'm missing cartilage in one knee. However, I hung in there - and now my leg is straightened back into position and I wear these crocks all the time!! I have 2 pair and switch out. Replace your old crocks and see what a difference it makes to have all the "new" features once again. I didn't realize how worn out my old pair were until the new ones arrived.

Crocs are ugly as hell but are the best all day kick arounds available. These are my house shoes, my gardening shoes, and my take out the trash shoes. No support but lots of cushy comfort if you stand all day. Easy to wash. This is about my 5th pair and I can tell you that they last a long time before stretching out or otherwise becoming un-wearable. Crocs rock!

The cayman i received fits fine and works fine.  The details of the moldings, however, were noticeably less defined than the ones i bought last year.  Upon closer examination, i noticed that the words MADE IN USA imprinted on the underside of the crocs on last year's model were replaced with MADE IN CHINA on this year's model.  Perhaps THAT explains the lacking quality difference?  Again it still works fine, but SORRY!  I'm not paying $30 for crocs MADE IN CHINA that look like the cheaper chinese-made knock-offs!  For those, the only things lacking are the cute little croc buttons on the sides.  I'll buy other brands (albeit made in china) for a lot less.

The basic Crocs design, which this model represents, is classic. I use it exclusively as my indoors 'shoe'--when I enter the house, my outside (dirty) shoes come off and the Crocs go on. They're also waterproof, so you can use them in the shower, or at the pool or beach, if you wish. I bought my first pair 5 years ago, and it's indestructible; I only bought this second pair because I needed it to use on vacation. The shoe sizes are generous--I'm a size 12 but wear a size 11 Crocs--so it might pay to try on a few sizes in a store before purchasing it.

I had anticipated these being smaller than expected, but I should have stuck with ordering my actual shoe size and I think I would have been fine. They looked decently put together though. Was going to use these sort of like slippers for work around and outside of the home.
I use them in the garden, the first thing I put on in the morning. They're comfortable, lightweight, easy to slip on or off, durable. Great product!

This is my third pair I bought, I’m and 8 1/2 and have crocs in a size 8 and 9. I bought a size 8 and they are made in Mexico and my other 8s are made in Italy.  They are a little more snug and a little stiffer then my Italy ones, I don’t mind bc I never put them in sport mode. I have another pair from Mexico and they do feel a little different, the ones from Italy are probably the best quality. I still love them tho

It gave a price range and it was difficult to find why some were so much cheaper.  You would have to put in each pair individually to see the price according to color (of which there were many)  I called customer service who called me back and let me know the mud and one shown were the cheapest by several dollars.  I had the generics before and love these REAL CROCS.  Made well and run wide which is great for me.

They fit well enough and help with the recipient's knee pain. Had an issue with the last pair though, a heel strap broke loose at one end before they were a year old. Taking a chance that that was a fluke, since the original pair lasted long enough to be worth the price.
Absolutely LOVE my big, bright orange crocs!! I also got a pair for my sister in law too and she absolutely loves them too!!

I have worn many Crocs over the years, but recently discovered that some versions like the Bistro style have started shrinking and warping if left in the sun to dry. I had two pairs that warped after two hours of 80-85 degree heat. I never had this problem before.

Good quality. Fit somewhat small. My husband wears a size 11 so that is why i ordered this pair. They do fit but with no room to spare. His heel comes right to the end. He decided to keep them because he doesn't wear them out and about he uses them as slippers and to let the dogs out and play catch. But the fit is obvious when you look at him.

I bought these for my wife because let's face it, no man looks good in Crocs - not even my Dad and his are camo.  But my wife loves them and wears them mostly outdoors.  They last forever - well, unless you buy yourself a new Labrador puppy.  Then they still last forever - you just can't find them.  At least not until your puppy gets a bit older and decides to bring them back.  Then, bonus, your wife has two pair.
My husband usually has to wear a size 15 but these are wide and he had to size down to a 14 and they fit him nice.

These fit accurately and are super comfortable. I had my last pair for 7 years until they finally gave in w/ a considerable amount of abusive wear. I recommend these for gardeners, chefs or anyone on their feet for long periods of time. They are easily cleaned; they can go in the washing machine, be hosed off or worn in the shower. This purchase may not impress fashionistas, but your feet will thank you.

I began wearing Crocs when I had my first bout with plantar fasciitis several years ago.  I don't know the hows or whys, but the Croc stabilizes my foot and gives support to help my feet not hurt.  I wear them around the house and occasionally when I go shopping.  But for every day wearing around the house shoe, there is nothing better for support and comfort.  My neighbor even thought my yellow ones were cool.  I like different colors and there are so many to chose from. My mom and dad began wearing Crocs also when they helped my feet.  They wear them every where.  Great shoe!
I needed a pair to slip on to go out in the garage. Size is small. I wear a 12 which is tight. I should have ordered a 13.

Not the best looking clogs, but dang are they the most comfortable.  If you have lower back pain, this cushioning capabilities of these clogs will soften any impact on your back.  Super comfortable.  The only problem I have with this product is the price is high considering what this shoe is made of.  Other than that, it is really the most comfortable clog and I wear these around the house all the time
My wife and I got crocs, she picked the color. It's the first pair I own and they are not bad at all. They are more comfortable than I expected. Good for summer.

I'm not supposed to go barefoot excessively due to plantar fasciitis, so I bought these Crocs because I was looking for something supportive and easy to slip on that I could wear exclusively inside to avoid tracking dirt through the house (also, they came in size 15, which is hard to find). On the one hand, I love these shoes--they are perhaps the most comfortable I own. On the other hand, they are horrifically ugly. I suppose that works out for the best--it makes it easy to remember that they are for the house only.

my boys love crocs.  they wear them all day long.  they will not wear any other shoes.  they are durable, but my one son who runs everywhere does destroy these shoes.  I usually have to buy 2 pairs for him.  Buy then he is very hard on his shoes.  These shoes are great for everything though.  You can wear them to school.  you can wear them to the Lake or beach.  Great for all seasons except winter.  Just not a winter shoe.....
So the new "in" thing is to wear "Crocs" at Mounted Games Across America Events. So Papa gave in once his wee one won National Championship! R/

I based my purchase from the reviews I read on Amazon.com. Although the length is okay the shoes are much narrower that I was led to believe. I have a cheap pair of garden clogs that I bought at Walmart about three years ago that the soles are quite worn on but they are far more comfortable. I doubt that I will buy another pair of Crocs.
I really like the convenience of slipping into my Crocs.  They are very comfortable and glad I found them on Amazon so I could get a new pair.
I normally wear a women’s 9 1/2, but the nine fit perfect. I wear them in the winter time around the house as slippers. I love them!

They arrived with the display hook still attached.  When the hook was removed, we found that it had mangled one of the shoes slightly. My daughter decided to go ahead and wear them anyway, but you do expect things that are new to look new when they arrive. The shoes did arrive quickly and were packaged well.

Several years ago got my husband clogs at Walmart--Crocs copies.  He rarely wore them and recently told me they were uncomfortable.  Since my Crocs were very comfortable, I was surprised to hear this.  So I let him try mine (we are just one size different).  He loved them even though they were a tad small.  So we got him the real thing and he is a happy guy!
My 20 year old grandson had almost worn out his crocs, and told me Crocs is going out of business. I told him to pick out a pair on Amazon!  He chose the camo style and loves them--year round!

Had to return-same size I usually buy but way too big. Contacted Crocs who said that they are made by different supplier than they use (?) and I reordered from them after consulting with their Customer Service. I reordered in my usual size which they assure me will be fine. I still don't understand why the shoes aren't identical-both Crocs Classic Clogs, so why should they fit differently in the identical size? Who knows!

I did not like the Khaki color on my feet, made them look too much like clown feet. I have wide feet and normally wear a 7- 7.5 W  and purchased the 8. However, I returned for the 7 in Dark Brown and found these more bearable, lol. The comfort is TOP NOTCH though!
My only complaint is that they are VERY small for the indicated size.

This is not my first pair of these.  I bought  a pair exactly like this about 3 years ago and they were so comfortable I finally wore them out.  I wear them around the house like slippers and they keep my feet comfortable on the tile floors.  I can also walk right outside and they are great when I am walking around the pool.  I love these, and they last a long time!  A great buy!
These look good, or as good as a croc can look. Fit as expected. Are not as comfortable as my old crocs but I think I just have to break them in. Overall I am happy with them.
As first reaction to the product I love it. But there are some  evaluation which will depend on how long I have used the product and that would come later not as soon as I buy the product!
My niece loved these! They fit exactly as expected and are a good quality croc. Love them and would definitely buy again!!
The Right croc was a quarter inch less wide than the left. I could feel the difference as soon as I put them on, I will be returning for a refund.

Anyone who has ever bought crocs knows what to expect. Those who have never owned a pair will be impressed. Easy to clean and feel like feathers on your feet. I wear them to work at the hospital and they normally last a year and a half to two years. When the shine starts to fade just slap some liquid car wax on them and they look brand new again. Great for boating or any other outdoor activities as well. The only bad thing is they can be slippery on certain surfaces. Overall a great product.
Absolutely wonderful, always soft and stay soft!
Got size Men's 10 for my husband who usually wears 10.5. Great fit! Terrific house shoes for lots of time spent on his feet in a laminate floor kitchen.

I hate Crocs. Just how they look. But my feet love them. I'm a cashier and spend 8 hours on my feet. These are a life saver. They are so comfy. I swore I'd never wear them... but here I am. Wearing crocs everyday to work.
I bought the black crocs fell in love and bought the burgundy.  They were huge!!! I had to return them and sized down from my black crocs.

I wear these around the house, and have ordered 4-5 pair of these, all the same size.  The pair I just received are at least two sizes too big, despite being the 'correct' size I've ordered previously.  They also feel completely different.  Where all of my previous Crocs feel like rubber/foam, these feel like slippery plastic.

This is my 3rd set of Crocs I've purchased, wore the other ones out from wearing them all the time. I use these shoes mainly as slippers. I suffer from heal spurs and these offer great cushion and comfort.

Was so iffy about Crocs. I admit... I'm one of those people who passed judgement. But I caved and got a pair for when I'm working at home because I'm on my feet all day. Yeah I'll be getting another pair.
Love these Crocs!  I bought them for my son for his birthday and he was pleased.  He's been wanting yellow Crocs forever.  I was worried whether or not they would fit but they worked out great!

My wife purchased these shoes as she has major problems with her achilles tendon in both feet.  Loves the fit and feel of the crocks - they are very comfortable.  Because of the extreme achilles issues she has, she did insert foot pads into each crock for extra support.  Quality seems good, will see how they hold up over the long term.
Alright I was so against getting crocs for so many years, they look ridiculous. OH MY GOD they're so comfortable I wear them every day and I love them so much.

I think this is my 5th pair of Crocs. I can't think of another pair of shoes that are this versatile and comfortable at the same time.  Albeit they may not wear as slow as they used to. What I particularly like is that I can wash them and dry them with a towel and be on my way.

This is probably my 5th pair of Crocs; I wear them just about all day every day.  I love them because they are comfortable, lightweight, and easy to clean.  Eventually the bottoms of the soles wear out for me on the ball of the left foot (what's that about?).  And this happens less quickly if I'm careful to avoid surfaces with sharp rocks.

Bought these for my teenage daughter and was kind of surprised they are popular again with the high schoolers.  But it is a great shoe for wearing before and after sports, and the support is great for weary feet.  They are roomy enough to wear with bulky sports socks, easy to slip on and off, and when they get muddy just hose 'em off!  Perfect!  Can't go wrong with this basic Croc.
nice, typical not-too-roomy but roomy enough to wear with a pair of sock.  I wear these in and around the house so they're perfect and very cushiony comfort!
Pretty much the most durable and comfortable shoes they make. Call Crocs ugly all you’d like, but in my opinion, the company that invented these shkes nailed it!

They're Crocs....  They slip right on & off w/o an issue.  The rubberized insole & sole give enough cushion to help make walking comfortable --- nerve damage in my left leg & foot.  I'd rather wear these than flip-flops or sandals.  Not the most fashionable thing to wear, but I'm doing yard work, going to Tae Kwon Do, walking the dog or getting groceries / Home Depot, so fashion isn't exactly on the top of my list there...  Functional?  Yep!  I'd buy these again.

The polymer in the pink did not feel authentic.  It felt much stiffer and the toe 'ridges' were in a slightly different place.  I compared them side-by-side with a relatively new identical pair in a different color purchased from a CROCS store.  I returned the shoes.

I've never worn Crocs before this, but I love them! They fit the shape of my foot perfectly-narrow at the heal, wide at the toes. And the sole make these shoes almost soundless on tile or wood floors-helpful when you don't want to wake up people or dogs.
I've always thought that Crocs were kinda, well, ugly.  Well, finally tried them out.  So comfy and will continue to buy!

I was reluctant to try out these ugly clogs, but finally decided to see what the fuss was all about and took them on a trek in the Panama rain forest and wore them as a camp shoe for a week. Even though the Caymen is supposed to be a closer fit than the Beach, they still feel very loose, as if they're going to fall off, at first. But after getting used to them and forgetting I had them on, I realize that this contributes to the comfort. Unlike my usual sandals, these dry by simply wiping them off which is a huge benefit in wet environments. I still think they're fugly but they're extremely comfortable for wear around the house or camp, and light enough to always take with you on your travels.

Too bad this Croc is sized incorrectly.  I usually wear a size 14 shoe.  While at a local Big 5 I tryed on a size 13 and found that it was too small.  (It was worth a try)  I was excited to find this size 14 on Amazon.  Upon receiving the Crocs I found that they were marked as 14, but were several sizes too big.  I could have left my shoes on and put them inside the Croc.  When I used the printed the return label through Amazon I found that I had to pay the shipping to return them.  I contacted the seller, Surf and Dirt.com, and talked to a helpful customer service rep.  He told me that I would have to ship the item back at my cost and then after examination they would make a determination of whether they would pay shipping.

If you work around water, these are great.  They keep your from slipping in wet areas and allow your foot to breathe.  They do run very wide, but they are meant to be loose fitting.  The heel strap help keep them on your feet.  When I was a dive instructor, I lived in these things and really liked them -- there just aren't a lot of better options out there and they held up a bit better in the wet conditions than my dock shoes or penny loafers... they are not really pretty though.  :)

I have deployed many a times and have needed shower shoes each time. I had been using flip flops until my wife sent me a pair of these Crocs. I don't know why i didn't order these years ago, because i've been knowing about them and seeing others with them on. These stay on my feet, and i can walk up and down stairs with wet feet without the fear of slipping or falling. And they dry off easily. I have been using these for the last 5 months and i have not had one issue. If i ever need another pair of shower shoes, they will be Crocs for sure.

So far so good. My only issue is that they fit well when using the heel strap but are big without it. That doesn't effect how I use them but it could matter to someone else. Good value, these were cheaper than I could find them anywhere else.

I do have semi wide feet, so these fit well for me, but people with narrow feet may find them too big. Anyhow, I have a sprained ankle and torn ligament in my foot and needed shoes with high support (with a hard, un-bendable foot-bed). Of the recommended shoes, crocs were the cheapest to be honest. They are very comfortable and supportive. They're the only shoes I can wear right now w/o pain (other than my other pair of crocs).

Crocs are just about the only footwear I can wear, having lots of foot problems, especially since I have wide forefoot and very narrow heel.  The wide forefoot is a result of bone spurs; and shoe mfrs do not make wide shoes with narrow heels, therefore, if I buy wide shoes, they slip off me, but if I buy medium width, my feet would hurt from rubbing on the bone spurs.  This type of Crocs is my answer to my foot problem.
Since Crocs sold their company, the sizing has been varied. I cannot order my size in various styles without them being too small or too big.

I like them better than I thought I would.  I have a wide foot, so I ordered a half size larger, rather than smaller, and these are actually more roomy than I thought they would be.  The little strap is actually more effective than I thought it might be for keeping the ugly things on my feet.  I got them for backpacking when wet crossing a stream.  They will work fine for that.
Purchased for my daughter.  She loves them.  She says they are extremely comfortable.  Arrived on time.
Love them except the pattern on the inside feels like you are walking on a bed of nails, strangely. Going to glue some insoles for cushioning.

I bought it just because my son (4 year old) uses Crocs, and wanted to have another thing in common to talk about. Big mistake. These are the most comfortable footware I've had since 2002. Can't wait to buy them in more colors. Comfort wise, these are perfect 10s.

I have planter fasciitis and these are the best shoes for me while im working my 12 hour shifts. I have no pain at the end of the day. I would highly recommend to those with foot pain from working long shifts.

I have bought 5 pairs of crocs and have always ordered a women's 9. The last time I ordered a pair was in October 2016 and the 9s fit perfectly. I have now ordered two pairs of 9s in the last week and both are significantly smaller. I returned the first pair thinking they had been mislabeled. Today the second pair arrived they are also smaller. They feel smaller and they are visibly smaller than all of my other 9s. Make sure you order a size bigger, even if you have recently purchased them. I'm sending these back too. :-(

Purchased these for gardening purposes.  They work as I thought.  They do run small so I got a 1/2 size bigger than I would normally wear and are also quite wide.  Water, dirt, dust, grass clippings, etc, pass right through the holes...

My husband wears these in the kitchen at home. He's usually on his feet for short periods a few times a day in the kitchen, but I recently noticed that he has been wearing them out of the house - to the market, to pick up our mail, on decent drives. He says they are really comfortable.
I like these and they ran smaller than my older CROCS, so I returned for a size up. No other CROC impersonations are good. I have tried them and recommend the original CROCS.

This is my favorite style of crocs. I have found that they gotten smaller over the last 2 years.  My crocs in this same style that I bought 3 years ago are larger.  They are more comfortable.  I guess I will just have to size up to get the wiggle room I came to love in these clogs. I buy these specifically to have room, cushion, and arch support.  They do the job.  I literally live in them at home.  I have 5 pairs in different colors:)  My feet and knees have quit hurting thanks to these shoes.
everyone at my job wears these. great for cooks, servers, housekeepers. Comfy enough to stand for 10 hours, non-slip.

I'm very disappointed with Crocs. I bought several pairs for my kids and husband and all of them shrunk by 1-3 sizes during the summer leaving them outside by the patio door in part sun. Now my husband's Crocs are even too small and tight for me.
Ordered usual shoe size and these just fit, if they had been a little smaller I wouldn't have been able to wear them. Also DO NOT wear on wooden flooring , the bottoms of these shoes are slick.

I love these shoes.  The only other ones I've owned are lined for warmth.  I wear a size 10 so ordered size 8.  I find them to be a bit big but fit perfectly with socks.  Easy enough fix.  Next time I order unlined ones, will get size 7.  (FYI:  I am size 10 with a wide foot, so always border men's flip-flops, etc.  Hope this will help you in shopping.)

Love the quality of Crocs. This pair is for my daughter. I've had my pair for 10 years and they're still in excellent condition. We use them at the beach, the pool, water park, or just to slip on real quick to run an errand. My daughter will be using this pair during softball season so she won't have to walk around in cleats.

I wear these around the house, because we have hard flooring. My plantar fasciitis makes it difficult to stand for long periods of time without shoes, but we prefer not to wear shoes in the house😉 Soooo someone suggested trying out Crocs as my 'house shoes'. Genius! I wear them ALL the time.
Love these. So easy to wear. I bought for my daughter to wear after volleyball so she can change he shoes quick. Love
The top of the left shoe is misshapen as is the strap, but with a different shape. The strap won't stay up, it keeps falling down on my ankle
Great for vacations. I was so against these shoes on they first came out, but my god are they comfortable

THIRD PAIR OF CROCS I HAVE ORDERED. THESE ARE THE CLASSIC AND SOFTER, VENTED, FLATTER AND I WALK WITH BETTER POSTURE.. I HAVE ARTHRITIS AND CROCS ARE SO EASY TO GET ON & OFF. EASY TO KEEP CLEAN ..THEY DON'T SLIP LIKE GENERIC ONES,,.
Crocs are back!
Good old crocs.  They're tried and true.  Kinda ugly, but really comfy.  My podiatrist recommends that I wear these when I'm at home walking around.  I love em.
Purchased these for my daughter who is always running outside to play with the dogs barefoot. She says they are comfortable and she hardly takes them off now.
I've had and worn out many pairs of Crocs.  Someone stole my last pair of black ones.  So I bought these hot pink ones.  I dare someone to steal them, I double dog dare them to steal them!  :-)

Got Crocs for the pool and for some quick slide one and I LOVE them!! They are supper comfortable and have gone through a lot in a month already. The bottom is kinda then I have learned, so if your walking on rocks, you will probably feel them. Other than that, they are amazing. I did get the cheapest ones I could find, and they ended up working amazingly!!  They do get kind of crease-y though.

Bought these for my teenage daughter. Another great pair of Crocs. Every member of our family has had multiple pair of Crocs over the years, and they always perform up to our expectations. Will be buying more when the kids out grow or wear out their current pairs.

It was suggested by my orthopedic surgeon to wear clogs for a few weeks after surgery.  Although these are not the fashion statement I'd prefer not to make, I get the comfort piece.  After healing, I'm sure these will be a stable for using at the beach, yard or wherever.

I got a women's size for myself and they are roomy but fit okay with socks. The Crocks I got for my husband were his size, but way huge. We're sending back for a refund. Otherwise great product. Lightweight and sturdy. Good for apres hiking and for crossing streams and communal showers.
These are great to use at the water parks.  The sidewalks get too hot to walk on in the sun so these are a great option since they can get wet.
If you buy these and want to keep the strap in the back, get a size larger. i got a size 9 and my toes are squished if the strap is in the back

This is my third pair of crocs in this open style, and I like them very much. I use two canes or a walker for balance due to a bad R hip and the wide soles on these shoes help in that regard. Also, I like the way the heel strap can be pushed toward the front to turn these shoes into slup-ons. My only problem with them is the slant at the back of the heel. If I'm on a slight incline, I must the careful not to lean back too far.

They are not the bouncy, rubbery feel that crocs once were, but comfortable enough not to send them back.  I had a pair when they first came out, so we are talking about years and years of use.  Crocs just aren't like that any more.  But theu work just fine for what I need them for.
About a whole inch shorter than same shoe ordered directly from Crocs.  Are these knockoff Crocs?
Genuine crocs, and the navy color is very dark blue; looks almost black indoors.  The 9 M US Mens size is plenty wide for my 4E feet.
Both them for my husband who is very picky with shoes. He loved them. Find them to be very comfortable.

Have been wearing the Bistro (no holes) model for a year and loving them: light, comfortable, roomy and easy to get on and off--so I thought I would try the perforated model.  I normally take a mens size 10 in other types of shoes, but for both the Bistro and Classic Clog, I got mens size 9 and, for me, they fit perfectly:  Roomy, but stay put on my foot.  Besides the holes, the only other difference between the two models appears to be the tread pattern.
